Reviews.Title: “Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: NZtripper
Reviews.Content: Great front of house / reception team. Always helpful and take their time with any query.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location for easy walking to art galleries etc.”
Reviews.Author: Spider38
Reviews.Content: Breakfast buffet was great, a very good choice across four different stations. We didn't have dinner or room service there, so I cannot comment on the other food, but the menu looked good. Room was a good size, the free minibar is a bonus, as is free WiFi. The only slight downside was the noise from the plumbing when toilets in adjacent and higher rooms were flushed, it was very loud! Perhaps we were just unlucky in the room we were in (fourth floor). We had requested a room with a street facing balcony and this was honoured. Reception staff were helpful with requests for information, providing us with a map and writing on it where the key things we might be interested in are situated. They also accommodated our request to leave our luggage on checkout as we were flying later in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MCM975
Reviews.Content: i selected this hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews and was very pleased. Rooms are small but bathrooms are large. Staff was friendly and seemed to cope well with my very limited Spanish. There seemed to always be someone on the desk who spoke English. The hotel is located withing walking distance to major attractions. The restaurant located in the hotel is very good and would be able to stand on its own, the fact that it is attached to the hotel is a bonus. The breakfast is outstanding. I have already recommended this hotel to my friends going to Madrid later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: hollysadler26
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a great gem in the best location! You can pretty much walk anywhere you want from this hotel. Free mini bar was such a money saver for drinks. They provide juice, sodas, bottled water, and beer. They will ask what you prefer and refill it everyday. They will make reservations for you, the restaurant is great too. Will definately go back! The only negative comment is they beds are quite firm. But if you like that then it isn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location”
Reviews.Author: tomkmoeller
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here, location was best asset of our stay, right where you want to be to walk to all the sights, street does not allow cars so user friendly, all sorts of restaurants everywhere, breakfast was the best I've had anywhere, staff very friendly. And helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Gooble D
Reviews.Content: We just come here because all the very good reviews about this hotel and all can be confirmed. The hotel is right in the most touristic area of Madrid. Just 5 minutes walking away Puerta del Sol and Gran Via. The hotel staff is very helpful and very kind. Rooms are a bit small anyway bathroom looks pretty large. Free Wi Fi is very good. Price is medium range anyway Madrid has much more expensive 4 stars hotel. I definitely would recommend this hotel for a short stay in Madrid either business or just travel.

Reviews.Title: “2012 Spring”
Reviews.Author: StanSF
Reviews.Content: Great location in the center of the old town. Staff very helpful. Spend a few new in a standard double, which was fine, and a few nights in a mini-suite, which was very nice & spacious. Only down moment was that a wake-up call came 1 hour late on morning (no harm done). Would not even consider looking at a different hotel the next time I'm in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: wefstag
Reviews.Content: The location is good, although possibly overstated as all the principal attractions in Madrid are all within a few square miles of each other, thus easily walkable, if the weather is good. There are hundreds of other hotels equally well placed. The staff and breakfast also lived up to previous positive comments. For a city hotel it is reasonably quiet and the free soft drinks in the fridge is a nice touch. However on the other hand there was no coffee or tea making facility in the room and the cost of a simple cafe con leche was €2.50 one of the most expensive in Madrid. But there were numerous other cafes etc in the area so not a serious issue. On the first day of our stay there was a crowd of youths staying involved in a stag trip - their language was appalling. I suppose it's expecting too much for the hotel to avoid the booking, but they failed to take any action which was a little surprising. I was also a bit miffed in that having agreed the bill in Euros and given my credit card they then debitted the amount in £ sterling. To add to this they gave me the receipt in an envelope which might be construed as deliberate deception. They are not alone in this practice in Spain, so beware ! In fairness the exchange rate was not excessive, but as a principle if you pay a bill in Euros you do not expect this to be converted to another currency without your agreement. A little naughty to my way of thinking. Despite the above comments we really enjoyed the trip to Madrid and the Preciados is overall a very good hotel in most respects.

Reviews.Title: “A family friendly place at a great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Nilas5
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fabulous vacation in Spain. We began the trip with Madrid and we stayed at the Preciados. Thanks to tripadvisor, we chose this hotel and we have no complaints. it was the perfect hotel for our family, great location and exceptional service. The staff were very helpful at every step of the way - getting us settled, recommending restaurants, helping us getting soccer tickets, etc. On top it all, the hotel offered free wi-fi in the rooms and free mini bar (no alcoholic beverages). The beds were very comfortable, great hi-flow showers. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SUNLOUNGER123
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, great location, gorgeous food, well equipped rooms, very helpful staff. One thing I will say if you're aiming to spend a lot of time in your hotel then this hotel would be right but it is on the expensive side if you're only going to be flitting in and out then you could probably save yourself a lot of cash by trying less luxurious hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TorunR
Reviews.Content: In Madrid one night passing by, picked this hotel after reading Trip Advisor. Cannot compare with other Madrid hotels, since it was our first visit. We had two rooms - one twin and one double - and both rooms were small and beds intimate which was ok with us since we're family. Nothing exciting but nothing to complain about either. I was in a room facing the street an was surprised how quiet it was considering the location. The other room was facing another wall which was boring but ok with us since we only went there to sllep. I learnt about free minibar from Trip advisor, nothing they seem to promote very much, a pity since that's a nice thing when you arrive late. Note: there was a street party going on so the taxi couldn't go all the way, but maybe that was a one time thing. Next morning street was cleared and a taxi was arranged by the door within five minutes. Best of all - the breakfast buffet!!! I have limited experience of Spain but I was astonished to find such an abundance of ham, cheese, egg dishes, fruit, cakes and puddings! This prepares you for a day in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Good home base for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SatoriInShanghai
Reviews.Content: Service: most important outside of the comfort of the bed. This hotel offered great people to help us along every step of our way. Very kind, supportive, and they gave us wine to take to our room before we could figure out how to ask in Spanish. Hotel comfort: Beds were European in softness, but still nice on the back, neck, and body overall. Definitely felt fine after several nights rest here. Pillows were good. Location: Very centrally located, and easy for taxi serve out of city. Overall, the two of us (partners) would recommend, but not glow about this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “At the heart of everything - good velue for money”
Reviews.Author: Yacroz
Reviews.Content: Renovated hotel close to Sol and plaza maior, very good location. nice and clean rooms excellent service.very good restorante. Good velue for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but they knowingly put us in a room with no a/c or heat”
Reviews.Author: panacea7190
Reviews.Content: The hotel deserves high marks except for the fact that they knowingly put us in a room with a non-working a/c system. They moved us to another room for 2 nights while they repaired the a/c in the original room. The new room was inferior, as it is was an interior with a light shaft functioning as a noise shaft, virtually non-functioning a/c and noisy in the middle of the night. Waking up once or twice a night in a hot, noisy room was no fun - it is the time when one thinks of what to put in a Tripadvisor review. At the end of the stay, I had to ask for an adjustment in price for the inferior room, which they only begrudgingly provided for all of 10% of two nights, This was our second stay and I looked forward to returning to a superior hotel and room. A "terrible" is harsh for this hotel, but I can not get over the fact that they placed guests in a room when they knew the a/c was not functioning. A real disappointment, and I expected so much more.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Natalie075
Reviews.Content: Well presented hotel conveniently located walking distance from major plazas in Madrid. Rooms and bed comfortable and double doors made it sound proof. Our room also faced a quiet side street, and ensured a good night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: SueDeal
Reviews.Content: We chose the Preciados VIP primarily because of it's location and excellent reviews on Tripadvisor. This hotel exceeded all our expectations and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Examples: Our car was carefully valet-parked and the reception staff went out of their way to provide restaurant recommendations and directions, even though their own restaurant next door was as good as any we found elsewhere. We had pre-booked the breakfast and it was more than worth the cost. We had a superior room on the 5th floor with 2 balconies and great views of the city rooftops and absolutely no noise at all! Only one small negative, I had emailed in advance for a bottle of Cava to be in our room for a birthday surprise when we arrived, however it wasn't there and I had to chase it up with reception, although it was then sent up immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay.highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dundeetravellers_8
Reviews.Content: As normal we read the reviews on trip advisor before booking. All we can say is its been a great stay. The reception staff, cleaners and restuarant staff have been acceptional. Nothing to much trouble.we had a room on the fifth floor with a small terrace. Superb to sit out at night before we went out.the hotel restuarant was extremly good with fine quality food.the breakfast buffet in the morning is one of the best we have had in many years.the hotel is central for all the tourist sites and the sites away out of the city can be easily reached by a great metro system.we recommend this hotel to everyone,from families to business people. Thanks again everyone.great five days in a lovely city

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the front and back end of our trip to Spain. This is a charming, well-run, boutique-style hotel just off the Gran Via. The rooms are typical for European hotels, on the small side. Everything in the place was spotlessly clean. Front desk staff were outstanding with their helpful manners and greetings. The rates were quite competitive with a big city hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay in centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: blueyspositan
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel with outstanding service. We had a ground floor suite which had all possible amenities with perfect decor. (in fact all the hotel is excellently maintained). Especially worth reporting on is the wonderful breakfast buffet -much the best we had during our holiday in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent smaller luxury hotel, quiet and safe.”
Reviews.Author: bostongolfers
Reviews.Content: This Hotel fit our needs just fine. An exceptional breakfast avaliable and quiet rooms. Excellent staff and great central location. Beds were comfy and room was nicely appointed with a great bath and shower. The hotel resturant is a good place to meet others for business or travel.

Reviews.Title: “OK but some mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: tomasz34
Reviews.Content: We have reserved a suite due to the terrace factor and I can say that the terrace is absolutely outstanding. LOCATION central, close to some major attractions such as Royal Palace or Plaza Mayor. Some 15 minutes walk to Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza museums. Lot of nice restaurants and tapas bars. Very good location. ROOM Suite - absolutely wonderful terrac as I have already mentioned. There is no gym in the hotel but there is some equipment in the room. Free mini bar which i a nice surprise. But - the room is very noisy, There is no noise from the street but there is a lot of noise from inside the hotel. Moreover we had a feeling that a hotel is build right on the metro as every few minutes until late night there was some sound similar to the sound of the train stopping and restarting. So overall - not very comfortable stay. RECEPTION SERVICE very good, no complaints RESTAURANT There is a restaurant in the hotel but we have not tried it. SUMMARY SOme good points in the hotel, especially the location. But due noise the sleep quality was quite poor and therefore stay was quite uncomfortable

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: clleach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days and the hotel staff was great! Always helpful with suggestions and directions. Cristina Garcia helped us get checked into our flights back to the States through Air France which was a maze! She persisted and maintained her composure through out our interjections and the poor navigation through the Air France web site. She was most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: nickinooFrance
Reviews.Content: Lovely room albeit a little smaller than I imagined for a Superior room however the roof slopes on the 5th floor making it feel smaller but it was a great room and very comfy bed with an excellent bathroom. The reception staff were very attentive and helpful, always a smile and plenty of help/information on hand. They pre-booked several things for us and seemed to have tickets available for most things. Breakfast was excellent, not sure why there was a negative review on this, loads of fresh coffee, probably one of the best hotel selections of fresh fruit all prepared and delicious and then a great assortment of other yummy things from fried eggs, bacon, tortilla to traditional pastries and cakes and juices. OK it's at top hotel prices (€18) but it's a very good breakfast We get really irritated when we can't make a coffee in our room, it's such a small thing but I wake very early and love to ease my way into the day sipping a hot coffee in my pyjamas while catching up with the news. It's just not the same having to shower, dress, get in the lift blah blah. Makes me grumpy!

Reviews.Title: “High expectations, very average experience”
Reviews.Author: Tjimmie
Reviews.Content: We booked the Preciados because of its #1 position on Tripadvisor and because it was supposed to be in a quiet area. We were warned of the small rooms and small beds but that small!!! So we upgraded to a junior suite and for that price could have stayed in a 5 star hotel. Anyways, the suite was giant and spotless so we were happy. Until we opened the windows at night for some fresh air (airco couldn't be switched to higher position ourselves). It wasn't that quiet at all!!! We were on top of a glass assembler and the noise was awful. So closing the windows again and sweating around. Yes, the hotel is close to everything and it is spotlessly clean. But I was not impressed and a bit disappointed that this hotel was ranked #1.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot”
Reviews.Author: OysterDiving
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff friendly and excellent value. Bed was very comfy but room possibly a bit on the small side. Check out the restaurant across the road if you a carnivor!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SteveFromBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Freindly professional service combined with a location near 3 metro stations make Hotel Preciados an excellent place to stay. Rooms are modern and comfortable. Staff is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AlanLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Just spent a very pleasant night here. Was upgraded at no additional charge to a corner suite. Room was well soundproofed, comfortable bed. Excellent service. Breakfast wasn't included in our rate, and cost an additional 15 euros each. Great location - El Corte Inglese is round the corner and it's a short walk to Plaza Mayor - recommend eating at the San Miguel Market.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Pennington32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to celebrate a birthday and a wedding anniversary. The location of the hotel is perfect, close to the metro and within walking distance to most places. The hotel is very clean and the rooms comfortable. The staff go the extra mile to be of assistance and are happy to recommend restaurants etc. One particular member of staff always went out of his way ensuring that we had a very pleasant stay, Miguel A Diaz is a real star! We did eat in the hotel restaurant on one occassion but have to say were very dissapointed with the food, but once mentioned to the waiter the restaurant manager did his best to rectify the situation. Will definately stay here again. The soft drinks in the free mini bar are most welcome after a hard days shopping and sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Bathrooms need renovating for the price, service was good.”
Reviews.Author: Kjmjs
Reviews.Content: I think the value for money wasn't there. I expect a higher quality room for over €247 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis1973
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Clean, attractive, modernly furnished room. - Classic, older hotel with completely remodeled rooms and public areas - Hotel is located on a busy pedestrian street, close to the stations of two Metro lines. We were able to take the Metro from and to the airport with our luggage with little trouble (Our arrival and departure were on weekends. Taking the Metro with luggage during the week might be challenging.). - Aside from the hotel’s close proximity to the Metro system, one can easily walk to many of the old city’s attractions; in fact, walking enthusiasts could probably walk to any of the old city’s attractions in a reasonable amount of time. -Rooms have wi-fi and there are two computer terminals available in the basement for guests’ use. -Despite the Preciado’s location in a lively part of town, the rooms are effectively sound-proofed against street noise. -The Café Varela, located in the hotel is a top-notch restaurant, which, in addition to being worth visiting for dinner, offers a memorable buffet breakfast which will last you the day. -There is plenty of hot water and excellent water pressure (and the tap water is quite palatable). -The hotel’s many attributes are crowned by its friendly, helpful staff, many of whom are English speakers. All staff members are patient in dealing with guests whose Spanish may not be up to par. Cons: -Although rooms are well insulated from street noise, there is considerable sound transmission between rooms. -While the room décor provides for attractive lighting, and there are LED “gooseneck” lamps at bedside, I would have preferred some brighter lighting for reading. -My room was not overly large and there were two simple chairs provided, however these chairs weren’t made for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ciao8055
Reviews.Content: Madrid was a wonderful city to visit. The Preciados Hotel was wonderful. Customer Service at the front desk was spot on with recommendations to local restaurants for dinner... excellent! Our hotel room was clean and spacious. We will keep this hotel on our radar for our return visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Woodcliffmom
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Preciado for 5 night in Feb. Through Tripadvisors recommendations, found such a gem in Madrid. For a Hotel centrally located to so many main attractions and to the metro, the price was very good. it is less than 5 min from the Plaza Mayor where we found wonderful restaurants and tapa bars. They have a restaurant on site and breakfast there was convenient. We had 2 teenage daughters and had 2 adjoining rooms but the price of the 2 rooms could have easily been for one room. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The free mini bar ( nonalcoholic ) was always well stocked and provided such a convenience when we came back from a day of sightseeing. I look forward to the comfortable bed every night. They have electric shades that will cut out light if you need to sleep late. The window/ balcony has double doors so it is very quiet in the room even though it is near the center of the city. The hotel staff was helpful and provided information that ranged from how to navigate through the metro to where can we see flamenco dance. Front desk spoke English well, especially Ann Belen. I am always impressed with the hotel staff sunny and helpful attitude. This is definitely a hotel I would recommend to everyone and would go back. Our trip included a Bravo Bike tour of Madrid and a Bike tour of Segovia. These were the highlights of our trip. What a great experience! When in Madrid, must stay at Hotel Preciado and take Bravo bike tour. They were able to accommodate bikers of all different levels and give everyone a wonderful experience. Our tour guide Kaspar took many memorable pictures for us also.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Barnacle_bil
Reviews.Content: At the time of writing this review, Hotel Preciados is the top hotel in Madrid according to Trip Advisor... Look come on, this hotel is corduroy trousers of hotels, beige in every way. Rooms? Meh, doors don't close properly, cheap furniture, fluorescent lighting, smell of damp. I will say one thing positive, the window/door could have come straight from a submarine, it stopped all noise from outside, which was great & not only that it stopped putrid smell of the bins from rising up into our room, maybe little things like that got this hotel in the No1spot? Location, meh, yes it's very close to Sol, but it's not the closest, however it is very close to a dubious looking back street if you're into that type of thing. Staff, meh, pretty sure they were wearing corduroys. They weren't rude, or polite, robotic would be a good description, which is cool and all that, well it would be if they were painted silver and had heads like lightbulbs, but they didn't, unfortunately. Food, excellent breakfast spread, best I have ever seen & I've stayed in many many hotels, no in fact that's a lie, once in Thailand I had fresh mango cut like a boat floating on a stream of orange juice. You know, buffets, they're cop out arent they? Think about it, yes they're quick, but they're always overpriced, nothing is cooked for you & you have to get your own food, there's always some yellow slop that could be scrambled eggs or perhaps not, bacon, always so much bacon, do people really eat this much bacon? Please for the sake of my sanity, ALL hotels, hire a cook for the breakfast meal and start having a nreakfast menu.... Maybe have a small buffet for those strange types that prefer this, if that's you check for corduroys.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located Hotel in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: GoemonIshikawa
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel about 1.5 weeks prior to the actual stay without any issue. The booking website can be a little confusing at times but in the end, I got the rooms that I wanted. Prices are surprisingly good considering a hotel located so centrally. Getting to the hotel can be a little bit of a pain in the rear due to heavy downtown traffic. However once there, you leave the car with a valet who parks it in a small garage located underneath the hotel. The garage seems to be geared more towards smaller city-style vehicles. We had a standard Sedan (Audi A4) but a large van would definitely not fit. The hotel rooms have wonderful decor and a nice balcony view. There is a free minibar with non-alcoholic beverages which is a nice surprise. The wifi signal is also clear and strong even on a 4th floor room. Despite the available amenities, the best part of the hotel is its location. It is literally next to a few great restaurants and discotecs so you will never wander too far from home base. Additionally, the major plazas and streets are all within walking distance. The hotel is quiet at night and your rest will not be disturbed by late-night revelers walking about the street. Book soon because this hotel definitely fills up. As we were checking out, we saw at least 2 individuals turned away due to lack of vacancy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Shellybw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for my 40th Birthday. My husband booked a superior room,lovely room, free mini bar, jacuzzi bath, free bathrobe & slippers. Staff very helpful. Hotel is very centrally located for all main attractions. We did the Segway tour on Friday afternoon which was great, got to see all main sites. If you fancy Tapas you must visit, mercado de San Miguel near Plaza Mayor. Even managed to see a football match, which is a must if you get chance. Defo go back to Hotel x

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but be beware of "single room".”
Reviews.Author: MashaFurman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, but I think a little overrated; I expected more from #1 hotel in Madrid. I stayed at this hotel on Christmas week and mostly liked it. The only downside was my "single room" didn't have windows with a street view, which was quite shocking. I wanted to change the hotel since this one didn't have small rooms available, but on a first night I was too tired and then it kind of grew on me. The room did have a window to the courtyard, so I renamed my single room to a "single cell' and decided to stay.Probably if it was summer, I would move, but in winter it was dark most of the time anyway and cold outside, so the air I got from the tiny window up in a courtyard and air conditioner was not so bad. I could adjust a heater and use it together with a conditioner. Everything else was fine. The location is great, close to everything. The breakfast was very good. The room was small, but clean. There was a hairdryer in a bathroom and they gave me a bathrobe when I asked with no charge. I also had a teapot with hot water to make tea every night also free of charge. Internet worked fine and there were two computers downstairs where you can check into your flight and print tickets. There is a nice Salad bar place across from this hotel open until 11PM, with salads and really good hot meal. The staff is great and speaks English. I went on one tour on my last day, I am not a big fan of tours, but I didn't have time to go myself and the bus was 5 min walk away from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: George610
Reviews.Content: Very decent hotel, nice and quiet location [but at the same quite touristy, equivalent of Vendôme or Picadilly or Empire State Building area]. First - the breakfast is simply amazing. We couldn't believe how good it was. We booked a superior, and came to realize that it meant, along with probably larger room, sloped ceilings in the bathroom, and weird small terrace which was completely unusable in the winter. So overall, I don't think it's necessary to stay in a superior. The personnel is extremely friendly and helpful. Which, to be honest, I found in most hotels in Spain, regardless of the price range. Overall, if you considering doing the museums, I would recommend staying south/southeast of Sol. For us this hotel was more of a base to explore Descalzas Reales/Palacio/Conde Duque/Universidad areas. I agree with some reviewers that while this is an excellent hotel [especially for the money], it is misleading to have it as Tripadvisor's number one in Madrid [which was partly the reason why we picked it]. There are definitely more fabulous hotels in Madrid, and if they are more expensive, chances are they are worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful.....”
Reviews.Author: shropshirelad2
Reviews.Content: We visited the Preciados for three days on our first visit to Madrid. The Hotel is perfectly positioned in the centre of the City, all the sights we wanted to visit were easily reached on foot. All the staff at the hotel were v friendly and pleased to attend to all our requests. The rooms were comfortable, quiet and the showers powerful! Here are a few of our observations and highlights of Madrid- Firstly, we booked our transfer through Aerocity, we booked from the UK, both journeys were easy, minibuses were on time, price was 22 Euro for the two of us. Our favourite Museum was Museo Cerralbo, a 15 minute walk from the hotel, this is a large house donated to the state earlier in the century and still laid out as it was, it is crammed with art, furniture, porcelain etc, the ball room is awesome! Our favourite restaurant was La Catedral, near the Plaza Sol, this is a busy Tapas bar/Restaurant, the walls and furniture are dark wood and gilded, the staff friendly and efficient. Finally, Plaza Major is beautiful, day and night, certainly not to be missed. We would highly recommend a few days in Madrid....

Reviews.Title: “Honest, well located, clean hotel in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: otavioclark
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 days in Nov/2011, with my wife. Staff very pleasant, the rooms are clean, yet not very spacious, the location is perfect: near most attraction from the center of Madrid. Would be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location. Lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: broomekim
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights on my way out of Spain. The location is very handy to everything, a stones throw from Sol. I would definitely stay again. Loved the room too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in the centre of the city”
Reviews.Author: Dohfar
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the good TripAdvisor rating, and can confirm it's a really great hotel. The location is a definite plus point - just off one of the main shopping streets, and there's lots of cafes and restaurants nearby. It's walking distance to all the major sights, eg. the Palacio Real is 10 minutes away, the Prado 20-25 minutes. The metro from the airport takes about 45 minutes, change lines twice at Nuevos Ministerios and Alonso Martinez. It's difficult to criticise the rooms - modern, solid furniture, bright decor, spotlessly clean. A very comfortable bed with plenty of pillows. Heating system worked well. Decent sized bathroom with shower that worked perfectly. Free minibar (soft drinks only, though!) and free wifi. Perhaps the addition of a comfy armchair would make it absolutely perfect? I thought the breakfast was very good, probably the best I've had outside the UK (nothing can beat a freshly cooked full English breakfast). A huge choice of meat, bread, pastries, cakes etc, plus cereal, eggs, bacon, coffee/tea/fruit juice. All very good quality, and newspapers in several languages including The (London) Times. All the staff I met were professional and helpful. There's a restaurant for dinner, but it's a bit more expensive than other places nearby. Note that if you book through the hotel website the quoted price does not include VAT (and to be fair it does state this).

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: pallinime
Reviews.Content: Perfect location near Gran Via and Puerta del Sol. Quiet street in the city center. A lot of restaurants and shops near the hotel. Friendly staff. Nice rooms with free mini-bar and wi-fi. But there's no facilities for making tea/coffee. The only minus is breakfast!!! It's very poor but rathher expensive!!! If I come back I'll certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stefanok
Reviews.Content: This is a nice functional hotel. The location is perfect, the rooms are huge and well appointed, quiet and comfortable. For some reason, I expected more personality owing to the great reviews on Trip Advisor but I think it was pretty business like. It's great value (105 euros for a single) so I can't fault it but I was surprised that it wasn't more "wow". I have stayed in places in Madrid with a little more personality hence my neutral review but don't let this sway you if you need a nice and good value place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Amenities”
Reviews.Author: PDXTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel Preciados twice and was pleased with my stay both times. The location is the perfect combination of being centrally located (2 minute walk to Puerta del Sol) but the rooms are still quiet. The front desk staff is very helpful, the room size is nice with a comfortable bed, the bathroom is well equipped with big towels, a good shower and a hairdryer. And the free wi-fi works well. Overall, a great spot for being in the heart of everything and a good place to rest after too many tapas & vino!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in central location. Book it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RAECambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews on Trip Advisor before booking the hotel and we were not disappointed!! It is a very central hotel, where you can walk everywhere. The service was super and our room was lovely. A huge bathroom, very comfy beds, a free mini bar, dressing gowns and slippers.................great breakfast, excellent Reception staff.....I could go on! I would certainly go back and would recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “great hospitality and lovely staff's”
Reviews.Author: jerardneo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 days there. Hotel placed beautifully – the old streets are around, nice Santa Ana square 2 min walk, Prado is 10 min walk. Rooms are big enough, spacious bathrooms. Friendly staff. Nothing to complain.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: 8HappyCamper
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel we stayed in in Spain out of 12 hotels...many 5 star. Why? Great location, excellent value (we stayed in some more expensive hotels that were far less quality). really helpfull staff, quiet, good beds, shower etc, free wi fi, the rooms were not boiling hot, great breakfast,...simple. I will definitly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Preciados”
Reviews.Author: MichalK74
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Preciados during Christmas 2011. Generally the service was perfect but unfortunately food in hotel restaurant including especially breakfast do not fit to 4 stars and the price. Dinner in restaurant was on the level of food-court with prices on the to high level. The breakfast was the worst, all so called warm dishes (eg. Scrambled eggs etc. ) was always cold. Small choice of other food was not sure on this price level. The same like the breakfast staff service. What is good in this hotel is location, rooms and staff but please try to eat in different place.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, well run, well deserved reputation”
Reviews.Author: tolland27
Reviews.Content: This is a well-run establishment and deserving of the high ratings it has earned on this website. My wife and I stayed here for three nights. The location at the Callao Metro station makes it convenient by foot to the Palacio Real, Opera, Plaza Mayor and to most other sites by Metro. For those who come in to Madrid Airport, you can take the Renfe to Sol for 2 Euros and avoid all the Metro changes and stairwells. It is a moderate walk to the hotel and certainly doable with a rollerboard suitcase. Although the Callao area can really jump, the hotel seemed quiet; certainly our room that faced the street was quiet. We had a standard room that seemed larger than it really was because of the design with built-ins for our clothes. There was a controllable thermostat, the bed was very comfortable, and reading lights were provided on both sides of the bed. The bathroom was modern, clean, and we were surprised by the quality of the towels -- usually hotel towels are thin -- these were large fluffy bath sheets. As in many hotels, you need to insert your electronic room key to engage the electricity. The hotel staff was very helpful making a number of recommendations for tapas and dinner. The best tip was the market at San Miguel for tapas, a 10 minute walk from the hotel. There are many choices but you should't miss the simplest -- the olives.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: MiaMobile
Reviews.Content: I stayed last XMas vacation in Madrid. I have been several times in Madrid, this time I chose to stay at the Hotel Preciados due tothe Trip Advisor review. We got a room with a view to the inside patio far away to the street.love that the room had free WiFi for my IPad and a refrigerator with cold drinks and beers with they replaced everyday free of charge. The hotel is two blocks from La Plaza Del Sol, one block from El Metro La Chueca and La Gran Via with multiple stores and restaurants and one block from the best department store El Cortes Ingles with a full stock supermarket and wine store on the basement. Thanks for the nice staff of the hotel. Looking forward to come back? Try the hor chocolate store and churros at El Valor one block from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “motel 6 in a high-rise”
Reviews.Author: sunshine_susan
Reviews.Content: This place is only functional if you are completely exhausted and have nowhere else to stay; furnishings are minimalists, comfort is non-existent, bathroom needed lights repaired (repairman on ladder was in our room after returning from dinner, and seemed put out that we wanted to use our tiny room). Staff was unhelpful and unfriendly. The high reviews posted on this hotel must be comparing this to the local SRO.

Reviews.Title: “All promises fulfilled”
Reviews.Author: papinek
Reviews.Content: Well, one may be suspicious when reading excited reviews about a destination sniffing bias. It is however, surely not the case here. Probably all was already written about the location and the facilities. Let me therefore put emphasis on the friendly and attentive services. All requests about our room were duly noted and fulfilled, so we really felt at home. Café Valera stood well on its own merits, locals visibly frequented this venue for its excellent food. Do not miss the breakfast buffet and consider the romantic package also, we thought its worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irish051
Reviews.Content: Hotel Preciados is very conveniently situated, close to shops, walking distance to Royal Palace and just around the corner from a metro station. Staff were friendly and helpful and spoke English which was great as we are not Spanish speakers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative in Madrid downtown”
Reviews.Author: Paulo Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in downtown Madrid, in a closed street for cars. The service is very good and location also, with lots of shops and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Lino2939
Reviews.Content: For Madrid standards, this hotel is ideal in terms of its central location (a quick walking distance from 3 metro stations, Gran Via is right behind the hotel, El Corte Ingles is 1 min away...etc), price is very reasonable, and staff are extremely helpful, courteous, and pleasant. The rooms are modern, clean and well equipped (powerful hair dryer, shampoo, body wash etc). The metro station "Plaza Espana" which is 2 min walk away, takes you directly to the "Santiago Bernabeu" station (only 5 stops away) for those who want to watch a Real Madrid football match. Also located at walking distance from the Plaza Mayor, the Palace and Cathedral, the Opera, and the Latina area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happy2BTraveller
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel is good especially the front desk. Considering the price, I can understand why this hotel has been ranked as number one in Madrid. If you are looking at a well located ie convenience to transport, shop and eat, then you can't get better than this place. Complimenatry mini bar (non-alcholic) is a good touch. I had to get used to hotels in Spain & Italy in that they do not provide tea/coffee making facilities as we have stardard in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located but very quiet also... ideal for families”
Reviews.Author: Raps777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in downtown Madri, but in a closed for cars street. There lots os shops and restaurants nearby, but it is quiet, slient, and provides rooms for families. The staff is very friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: wazbln
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in January. We had a superior room and a standard room, both on the fifth floor. The rooms were very well equipped, extremely comfortable and excellently presented. Little or no street noise penetrated into the room. The staff were great: friendly, competent and unfailingly helpful. Room service and the restaurant are both reasonable. The breakfast selection was quite good. The hotel is very centrally located, in easy walking distance to many attractions (the Royal Palace, main shopping area, etc.) and only one or two metro stops away from many more (including the Prado, Reina Sophia and the Thyssen museums). Callao metro station is about 20 seconds walk away and Sol station is about 2-3 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: Rainmaker59
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 stayed at this hotel for one night only - New Year's Eve. The hotel is situated in a great location within walking distance of downtown attractions. The staff at the front desk were extremely helpful...we had accidently left behind an etching that we had purchased in Rome and the staff located it, packed it securely and had it shipped to us in the US via UPS. Our room, while small, had many nice details to it including a stereo system with controls on the wall over the bed. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Kramia
Reviews.Content: Booked the penthouse suite for two nights and we loved it, room was spacious and views from the terrace breathtaking! Great location, and staff at the desk most helpful with directions. A very disappointing room service dinner but breakfasts were just amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophia L
Reviews.Content: thank you for my great time. hotel es muy fantastico y no caro.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Colin G
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here thanks to a good online booking price. Very nice place and within walking distance of many city centre attractions; very close to Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great location, AMAZING breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CoandChan
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and our time in Madrid. Our room was very nice and a had great view. It was a perfect location for seeing everything by foot. The bath tub was very large and could stretch completely out. It was a nice perk to have drinks in the fridge every day. If you want to try an amazing breakfast, stay at the hotel. They have everything (4 tables). On the last day, I tried the flan. It ended up being the best flan of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: Sapsopan
Reviews.Content: + location, location, location in the middle of the town, yet not amidst all the hassle, close to whatever you need to do in Madrid; + complementary minibar; + cleanliness; + good breakfast. - very small room; - some staff really look like they hate their job. Bottomline: location is what you pay for, accommodation is decent, not always do you get within the price range indicated here (80-131£) though. My 150£+ per night was a bit beyond value for money for me, hence three of five overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: nyist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the middle of all of the hustle and bustle for shopping, eating, and touring. It first appears from the outside to be a non-descript place but once you enter you realize that the whole place has been recently renovated (2008?) and that the hotel staff behave in a very professional and helpful and friendly manner. The rooms are nicely appointed with my only complaint being they do not have hair conditioner or body lotion available which is strange since they do provide toothbrushes, extra cotton face wipes, etc. The best part of the hotel is also the cafe attached to the property. The waiters started to recognize us by day 2 and were very friendly, chatting and knowing what we would like to have almost without ordering. You can get just coffee, drinks, tapas, or a full blown gourmet meal and of many of the places we ate in, the cafe was one of the best. Many regular people stop in to eat here, not just tourists. The hotel is right next to the main drag where all the department stores and boutiques, the Calle Preciados as well as the Gran Via. You can walk to any of the major tourist spots in 10 minutes as well. Finally, we had our New Years Eve dinner there and they were so sweet with providing the 12 grapes and individual bottles of champagne with glasses so that we could venture out into the Puerto del Sol along with all of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor”
Reviews.Author: elportoguy
Reviews.Content: Great location, hotel restaurant is nice. Near to Santo Domingo, Callao and Sol metro stops, as well as Plaza Mayor, Puerta Del Sol, Palace, and other spots. Hotel itself was very nice and clean. Good-sized room and well-priced in our opinion. We'll stay here again when in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Just doesn't quite cut it.......”
Reviews.Author: WaterfordMagnum
Reviews.Content: Over the last few years, my partner & I have been to a number of hotels, in a number of places in Europe. This was the first time we had stayed in the number 1 hotel on Tripadvisor & I've got to say that on the whole, we were pretty disappointed. I always try to identify all the positive aspects of a hotel first, so will do so again here. Firstly, the location is perfect, smack bang in the middle of where you want to be & close to the subway & within walking distance of central squares, great shops, restaurants & bars. Secondly, the breakfast is terrific. Really varied & catering for just about any wish or whim you might have. We also ate in the excellent & good-value restaurant, where we probably had our best meal of the stay. Staff are friendly enough too, but not entirely & in the restaurant seemed a bit snooty. Our room was comfortable & we loved the black-out shutters & complimentary mini-bar. However..... this hotel is really expensive for what it is, (I'm not sure quite how much, as my partner treated me for my birthday,) but I do know it didn't represent any kind of value for money. The room we started off in was close to some fairly noisey work being carried out in the hotel & although we were relocated without fuss, our new room was as small & felt like a pretty standard hotel room. Not what my partner expected. We stayed for 3 nights & on 1 occasion, the room was not cleaned Furthermore, there is nowhere to actually sit & relax. No lounge, no bar, just the foyer & the restaurant. We found this most bizarre & ultimately annoying. All in all, we were disappointed. This is allegedly, the number 1 hotel in Madrid & we felt we were entitled to feel a "wow" factor. Sadly we didn't. It was pleasant & comfortable & the breakfast/food was good, but I expected that. The bottom line is that this hotel just doesn't quite cut it, particularly with its most elevated status. We have stayed in better hotels for less than half the price & wouldn't return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mungo69
Reviews.Content: Madrid is a fantastic city and the Preciados Hotel is very well located. Location is the number one attraction here although the hotel delivers on all fronts. The only problem we had was a room that suffered with sewage smells - the night porter quickly moved us to another room! All in all a very nice stay (2 nights) and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Abejorra
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while traveling with a friend this summer. The rooms were simple, modern, and clean. The bathroom was spacious and the beds were comfortable. The staff were very nice. We were able to walk to many popular tourist spots and the subway system was close too. The balcony rooms are popular, but I requested a quiet room; we got an inward facing room with a view of other rooms, and it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: BinaryNomad
Reviews.Content: This delightful little hotel in central Madrid is clean and quiet and comfortable, the perfect size, with an exceptionally helpful and friendly staff. The hotel restaurant is not fancy, but the food is quite good for lunch and dinner, and the breakfast buffet has plenty of variety. The location is almost ideal -- right on the edge of the shopping district and old town, just a few hundred feet from the metro stops for two different lines, and in easy walking distance to the palace, Plaza Mayor, Plaza de la Puerta del Sol, Mercado de San Miguel, etc. (The Madrid metro is awesome, by the way -- fast, modern, and unbelievably cheap.) Many excellent restaurants within a short walking distance as well. The only thing I really missed and wished this hotel had was a quiet bar where one could go to relax in the evening with a glass of wine and catch up on email. Other than that... I picked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and would happily go back again - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tinabee
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and also because of location. We know Madrid very well so wanted somewhere central for shopping bars and restaurants. The hotel fits this bill. Its very close to Callao, Gran Via, Puerta Del Sol, Huertas, etc. The hotel was very straight forward, staff are friendly, although not sure about the advice from a couple of front desk staff regarding taxis and restaurants. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, but there so many cafes nearby so we were spoilt for choice! The room did not blow us away, but we didn't expect a luxury suite. It was simple and fairly basic with a safe, tv, etc. We did have a balcony which was good. One really good thing was that they offer a complimentary mini bar of soft drinks every day, which you do not see in many hotels of this sort. Sleep quality was pretty good, even though the hotel is on a busy but pedestrianised street. Would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to se the sights, in particular shops and nightlife of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: emmalucy
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean, as is the whole hotel. Excellent location. We stayed in a hotel near the airport when we first arrived for 40Euros and it was very modern and clean. You therefore paying for the central location. Bed very comfortable and room quiet. Bathroom outdated and in need of modernising. No coffee/tea making facilities. Overall I would recommend this hotel to friends but if they can find another hotel with a central location and modern clean rooms at a cheaper price I would say give it a go. This hotel is not cheap, however it is the capital.!

Reviews.Title: “Number One for a reason”
Reviews.Author: FSR99
Reviews.Content: Great location near two metro stations and lots of eateries. Can't speak to other rooms but the junior suite was not very junior - nice sitting room, spacious bedroom and over-the-top bathroom. The breakfast (we opted for a breakfast-included rate) was wonderful ranging from American fare (cereals, eggs, etc) to terrific baked good. Walking distance to Plaza Mayor and big department stores and shopping and easy Metro access to wherever you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable, good location, but a bit overestimated”
Reviews.Author: lapatriarca
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a three day visit to Madrid. We chose the hotel because of the excellent opinions expressed by travellers. Well, the hotel is located right in the heart of the city, you easily walk to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Gran Via in less than five minute. It is next to two subway stations, hence perfect for sightseeing. Rooms are clean, soundproof, minibar is free, personnel helpful, but... the room decorations are simple, just one chair in the superior room (there are two chairs in the balcony, but, if in winter, you do not sit outside!), no armchair. The room was narrow, the lobby also very small (just two couches). We paid 180 euro without breakfast, we had expected something more trendy..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Katandapickle
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, a few minutes walk from most of Madrid's sights and walking distance from anything you could want to do in Madrid, this hotel is located in the midfle of Madrid's shopping area. When we walked in we were immediately greeted and assisted by staff, who gave us a free upgrade to a wonderful room, helped us to plan our sightseeing and generally did everything possible to make our stay enjoyable, including printing our plane tickets, posting mail and finding us a sewing kit. Very comfortable, well equipped, clean, quiet rooms and great service, what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Definitely reccommended”
Reviews.Author: lafamosaItaly
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers real value for money - location is in the centre of this vibrant city, close to Plaza del Sol and metro, within walking distance of the Latin quarter and most places of interest. There is a small market close by enabling the purchase of freshly made churros to eat and souvenirs to take home. The staff were very friendly and helpful with information and the purchasing of tickets to see the Prado. Our room was fitted with double windows so no city noise, was clean and very comfortable. The restaurant was open all day and served a great fresh salad which is sometimes hard to find when travelling. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: LBaynes
Reviews.Content: I booked one night's stay here on the basis of the reviews on tripadvisor. It was fine, but no more than fine. The room was basic albeit comfortable enough. The major minus for me was that there was no tea or coffee making facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Emmens
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, perfect location (in the old town and 2 metrostops nearby). Small rooms, but that's normal in Madrid for this price. Friendly staff. We received some information about Madrid and the hotel at arrival. Payment at check-out. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “High Quality City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGH-UK
Reviews.Content: After staying here its easy to see why this hotel is ranked so highly on tripadvisor. Preciados delivers on everything I look for in a hotel, it has a great location just off the Plaza del sol and right opposite the metro. Our room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. The view was terrible, just a brick wall but I came to the city for a couple of days to see the city not sit in my hotel room looking out the window. Good value for money as we booked in advance, the breakfast is a bit expensive but it was a high quality buffet that really sets you up for the day. Staff appeared genuinely friendly and handled all requests without hesitation. Wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: BonitaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed this fine hotel. We had a car and Raoul was very helpful in taking it to the garage for our trips. The rooms were very clean and spacious. We were on the second floor overlooking a side street. It was quiet. The window had a shield that could cover the window if you wanted complete darkness. We didn't eat a meal at the restaurant but had drinks so we could play cards. They were very gracious to us. All the people we met were friendly and if they had a joke, we heard it. The location was in walking distance to everything- the Prado to the castle. I recommend this to anyone and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: My wife, 12-year old daughter and I stayed here for two nights at the end of our trip to Spain. The hotel is well run by a capable and friendly staff. It's a good base for an American tourist. Location: It's on a pedestrian "mall" that takes one to the Puerta del Sol, which is one of the primary squares in central Madrid. There are many restaruants, bars, shops and the like very near the hotel. One has many choices of metro stops for Madrid's clean, efficient public transportation system. Also, if one likes to walk to sites (as we do) most of the major attractions are an easy stroll through the always atmosphere-filled streets of Madrid. There might be better locations in Madrid but I have not stayed in any (and I've stayed in three other Madrid hotels). Rooms: We had the "penthouse suite" (Room 622) which had a marvelous patio and plety of space for the three of us. The modern decor was functional and the lay-out was well done. However, there were a couple of issues with the room. The bed is not comfortable by my standards (or compared to the beds at Corral del Rey in Seville). Further there was a sewage smell seeping from the toilet on our last night there. (In the hotel's defense we did not notice it until late Friday evening and we were leaving early Saturday morning so we did not alert them to this issue and give them a chance to fix it). Finally, the elevators make signficant noise and vibration and that woke us up from time to time. All in all the room was a bit of a mixed bag. Restaurant: I don't take points away for the quality of food in a hotel's restaurant but I will give extra weight if a hotel restaurant is awesome. This one is not. We had free breakfasts with our room and we did not even eat breakfast there on the second day, opting to go to Starbucks (which everyone knows does not exactly serve high quality food). There are many places close that are good but that restaurant is not one of them. Service: The hotel's staff is top rate and well trained. Most speak good English (better than my bad Spanish) and are eager to please. They made some fantastic recommendations for us for meals and we appreciate that. There is no complaint about service at this medium-service hotel, but there is also not the effusive praise that one would find in my Corral del Rey review. Value: This is a good value hotel. Our room was 300 euros per night and it is very large by Madrid standards. No complaints at all about their pricing. Overall this is a good, well located, medium service hotel that would equate to a nice Hyatt or Hilton in the states. It's not going to "wow" you but it's not going to be a problem either. The attitude of the staff and the location move this hotel from a three star category to a four star category, but it's really not a five star hotel (nor does it hold itself out as one). As always, I hope this review is helpful and please feel free to contact me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: neversayneverFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Madrid for two nights, but not consecutively. Between the two hotels (which by the way the other received higher reviews), this hotel was by far superior. The location is in the heart of central Madrid, providing an advantage to all sight-seeing. The hotel rooms are large and comfortable in comparison to other typical european hotels. Our room had the following: A large window that opened up for fresh air (something you learn to appreciate in Europe), Flat-screen tv, free wifi in the room and the entire hotel, the bathrooms were large and extremely clean. Also, the food is awesome except extremely expensive. Overall, you will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: cokeguy72
Reviews.Content: Nice little gem of a hotel that is a convenient walking distance to all central Madrid attractions. Located between Callao & Santo Domingo metro stations and one short block south of the Gran Via. Because of this location, it is devoid of the usual central Madrid tourist crowd noise, but Puerta del Sol is less than an easy 5 minutes walk away. Our queen-size bed was comfortable and the other furnishings in the room were modern and practical. The bathroom was roomy and clean. Minibar consumption is free! Hotel staff was exceptionally helpful. Many restaurant choices on the same block and gazillion more choices nearby in any direction from the hotel. Affiliated cafe next door provides excellent breakfast (not included in room rate), midday meals, and nighttime snacks and drinks. This is a great destination for business travelers or more mature couples who prize a quiet respite from the tourist crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NapkinSir
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and the breakfast is superb. Only realised there was a free mini bar when on the last mooring of our four day stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JLJ166
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for a long weekend. The hotel was ideally located within walking distance of the a lot of the main areas, and a short taxi or bus ride from the rest. The hotel was clean, comfortable, attractive,and had a restaurant . The breakfast buffet was extensive, and although we did not eat in the restaurant, we had a drink outside before we went out in the evening, and a coffee etc when we returned. The staff were all efficient and friendly and helpful. The bathrooms were spacious, and the minibar (free) was a godsend when we han forgotten to buy water for overnight. You can buy tickets for the Madrid bus tour at the desk, and the stop is a few minutes away. We look forward to coming back to Madrid, and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Gill1Scott
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a 4 night city break - chose it thanks to tripadvisor reviews and the free mini bar! It wasnt the plushest or most comfortable hotel I have stayed in but the central location more than makes up for that The room was of a good size, the bed very comfortable. We ate in the restaurant and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, good location, noisy room neighbours”
Reviews.Author: neilyork
Reviews.Content: Hotel Preciados, Madrid I booked to stay at the Preciados a few months in advance of my city break to Madrid. Upon arrival, I have to say I was not disappointed. I was welcomed even though I arrived at midday (some hotels get grumpy if you arrived before their 2 or 3 pm curfew). Soon into my room I first of all tested out the free wifi. It was averaging 7mbps throughout my stay - nice! The room itself felt modern and the nice double bed was comfortable. The large flat screen TV had a mix of channels in most of the European languages. The bathroom was huge - even had a bidet which I haven't seen at a hotel for quite a while. I actually thought they had stopped installing them! The downside was late in the afternoon there was a nasty drilling noise right up until 6pm. I couldn't determine where it was coming from as it sounded like it was further up the the hotel but nevertheless it was annoying. I also found it annoying that the couple near me decided to have a jacuzzi at 11pm - they were either directly above me or to one of the rooms either side of me. Now the hotel can't stop people doing this, and nor should they, but I shouldn't be able to hear the whir of the tub or what they are doing in it. In the morning, I took breakfast in the hotel which was included in the room rate. The selection was not as good as my previous Madrid hotel but was nice in taste and everything seemed fresh. Check out was friendly and the bill was as anticipated. Overall then a nice place let down only by the noise from my neighbours!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CrookyCymru
Reviews.Content: We had stopped in on Madrid after staying in two fairly small French hotels, so this was like a breath of fresh air. The hotel has the feel of a 5 star hotel. Cases were brought to our room which was of great relief after carrying them about all day. Rooms were very comfortable, and spacious for a city hotel. Free minibar in the room supplying a decent amount of drinks, and a prime location in the heart of the Madrid. All this for less than 100 Euros, makes this a must-stay hotel when you visit the city. Only faults were the very small ironing board that was delivered to the room in record time, and the sound of drains coming from the bathroom area which woke me up, but this was only because we had left the bathroom door open overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Quiet Rooms”
Reviews.Author: fredruth
Reviews.Content: Loved this centrally located hotel...we were also on the 5th floor and rather enjoyed our balcony in lieu of a bit of a bigger room...personal preferences is all. Clean rooms with amazing technology. Just shut the windows, doors to patio, bathroom skylight (optional to open or not) and and your room is essentially soundproof. Last reviewer mentioned lack of A/C...I was there the exact same days and the high of 70 with lows in the 40's made A/C seem not to be needed and I suspect they had it shut off for the season. Anyway, the highlight was the staff especially Eva from Segovia. My wife and I took the AVE train to Segovia for a day trip on Saturday 11/12...really worth it. Anyway we bought 4 beautifly hand painted glass plates in Segovia. Spoke with the artist who showed us her studio, kiln and home. Carried the plates around all day, but, upon arring back in Madrid I dropped them and 2/4 of the glass plates broke. In the AM I asked Eva to call the store (closed.but the artist had her cell number on the store card)...Eva called...the artist would give us similiar plates but we would have to go and get them..we were leaving the next day and couldn't go. Eva was going to visit her family that day (pure serendipity), got the plates for us and gave them to her aunt who was going to MAdrid Sunday evening and dropped them at the hotel for us AMAZING...now..in many years of traveling I have NEVER had someone go out of their way for a stanger like this...kudos to Eva ((Management...you should give her raise and an employee of the month award). All in all great place to stay and their on site Gallecian food resturant is worth a dinner in this city filled with fabulous eateries!

Reviews.Title: “Preciados - Very good for the location and price”
Reviews.Author: krafih
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Preciados for business in November and the location made it very easy for us to see as much of Madrid as possible based on our limited time. It is just off the Gran Via and is directly on the main pedestrian only shopping strip. The hotel itself is what I would consider to be very close to 4 Stars, but not quite there. Nevertheless for the price I paid of 108 Euros (via venere.com) for a single room (warning: quite small, but perfectly acceptable for a solo traveler), it represents a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great - but maybe not the fifth floor”
Reviews.Author: El_Timon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - clean, comfortable, friendly - in a very central location - walking distance from Sol station and just off Gran Via. Good size bedroom and bathroom and good range of toiletries including a disposable razor and toothbrush. Double glazing keeps out the noise but the AC is a bit noisy. Comfortable mattress and soft pillows. Free mini bar, nice for juice in the morning and mineral water. Only one alcoholic drink - beer. Minisafe in room. Why not the fifth floor? there is a plus and a minus and it depends on how you value each: the floor is built into the roof which results in a smaller room size with only a three quarter size bed (the minus) but an outside terrace area (the plus) with two chairs and a table and a view (if you stand up) over the roof tops. For us the minus greatly outweighed the plus. I would definitely stay there again but on a different floor.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NDP
Reviews.Content: The Preciados rightly deserves its award from Trip Advisor that is displayed on the desk in Reception at this top quality hotel. Located right in the heart of Madrid, it has a certain style as you walk through the lobby and staff are as other reviewers have said, friendly and professional. Though the street that it is located on is nothing special, the electric shutters on the large windows shut out the outside world. I have never had such a comfortable stay in a city hotel. The room was a good size with ample space and a free mini-bar which to my surprise was replenished every day.The decor is functional, though not cold and it was a nice room to relax in. The price was right for a hotel of this size. though breakfast was not included which was a shame. However, I recommend you go to the 9th floor of the El Cortes Ingles department store by Callao for coffee which has an amazing roof terrace and view!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: hixonac
Reviews.Content: We had a layover in Madrid on the way back from a Mediterranean cruise. I booked the Hotel Preciados based on Tripadvisor's reviews. We were not disappointed. We arrived around 7pm and checked in and went to our room. Spacious, very clean, comfy room. The free stocked fridge was a bonus after travelling all day. The amenities in the room were fabulous. The hotel is right in the middle of all points of interest. The staff was great, gave us a map and we were gone. We were able to walk to the Palace, cathedral and the food market, it was wonderful. The Plaza's were packed and it was a Sunday night. Starbucks right up from the hotel was great on our morning preflight. I can't say enough positive things about our stay. If ever we are in Madrid again, we will definitely stay there. Thanks Hotel Preciados for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ssanti9475
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience in Barcelona I was so happy to check into Hotel Preciados. It is located right by the Sol, Callao & Opera metro stations so it's really easy to get to & right in the middle of everything. The hotel itself is great. It's clean, the staff are friendly and the rooms are spacious. Overall a great place to stay in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good location good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Balmaniacs
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends at this hotel for 3 nights and we all found it satisfactory. The staff were very helpful and the location is excellent. Rooms were well appointed with great bathrooms and facilities. If I was going to Madrid again I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: JandP255344
Reviews.Content: Central location, beautifully decorated, excellent service - what more can I say? We fortunately were upgraded to a corner suite, however the overall feeling of the hotel was excellent and I suspect that the other rooms were also great. Restaurants, bars, shopping, Sol all within a short walk. Buffet breakfast was excellent also. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: KatieWilgus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so modern and contemporary and is located in the heart of Madrid. It's walking distance from anywhere you'd like to go. The rooms were very spacious for a hotel in Europe and so clean. The beds were very comfortable. My husband and I stayed here for three nights on our Eurpoean adventure trip and were not disappointed. HIGHLY Recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is spotless,it is in a perfect location close to old & new Madrid and the buffet breakfast is one of the best I've ever experienced. We stayed as a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 3 year olds) in a junior suite and the size and design were perfect. The staff were all helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast was an innovative arrangement of fresh meats, fresh fruits, fresh juice, fresh salmon, fresh little baguettes & sandwiches, alongside hot food and breads/pastries. Just a beautiful start to the day. Sleeping was a delight. Rarely do you get a perfect location in the heart of the bustle, but is silent in the room at night. This is because of double glazed balcony doors and electric shutters! It is a little complicated to navigate the local streets with a car and our room had a couple of glass tables we had to toddler proof with cushions on the corners, but I'm nit-picking. I would never stay anywhere else in Madrid, either on my own or with a young family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Magicflo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Preciados is situated right in the heart of Madrid, has nice, modern and clean rooms a great breakfast buffet and very friendly staff. I highly recommend it! (Unfortunately, I also booked Hotel Atlantico, the number one on tripadvisor.com, but don't fall for that! It was terrible and I cannot understand that ranking.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Angus W
Reviews.Content: Picked this one based on TripAdvisor reviews, and location. Within walking distance of everything in the older part of Madrid. Car parking available, which is well worth it. Very helpful staff; had everything arranged exactly as requested for an early check-out. Decor is modern, with wood and tile floors; very clean; there are window shades which are controlled from the lighting console beside the bed which we didn't find the first night. Even though the hotel overlooks a busy street it is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tuko_Pomoja
Reviews.Content: Like many, we chose Hotel Preciados on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews. Cartainly got that one right! We took a junior suite overlooking Plaza Santo Domingo for four days very recently and it's one of the best rooms we have ever stayed in. Really well-appointed, scrupulously clean, very quiet (double glazing and power-operated shutters!) with an excellent view. Completely separate living area. Valet parking was not cheap but we've paid more for less service. The rooms are not that cheap (we did see a fair bit cheaper on TA) but you really get your money's worth. It's a walk to most attractions or an easy metro ride from the station less than 100m away. There is a restaurant attached but we didn't use it and provided our own breakfast so I can't comment on that side of things. Staff were friendly and usefully helpful in every regard, so it's hard to ask for more. Just opposite is a shop called "Llao Llao" which sells frozen yoghurt with fruit. Brilliant for dessert every night! All in all, Preciados is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality & location”
Reviews.Author: BornAgainWeegie
Reviews.Content: Took 2 superior rooms for family. Quality and cleanliness excellent. The location of the hotel is superb, close to all the attractions and surrounded by excellent cafes and restaurants. Loved Madrid, having a great place to stay definitely played it's part.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LizabethRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Hotel Preciados. Our room, 407, included a seperate sitting area and a very large bathroom...the extra space was well worth it. Our stay was perfect. The hotel staff was professional, accomdating and very helpful. The location is great, within walking distance to almost all the sites. Yes, there is some noise from the pedestrian street, but if you shut the windows, you won't hear a thing. I have stayed in other hotels in Madrid, but I never felt the need to return. However, I would not hesitate to stay at the Preciados during my next trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “7 Days in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: OttawaLinda
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Jan 21st and found it a bit colder than expected. Had to purchase a warmer coat, gloves and hat. Coming from cold winter in Canada, I still wasn't prepared. This hotel was close to all the shopping and wihtin 15- 20 minutes from the museums/galleries! The breadfasts were fantastic and the rooms very clean! We hadn't brought the our adapter to plug in our laptop and unfortunately, the hotel has some but not the right one we could use. We appreciated the attempt made. Lovely layout in the room and bathroom since this was an older hotel all remodeled. Enjoyed all our meals in Madrid, especially the tapas and paella !

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Would return again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: MGandBH
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Europe so I didn't know what to expect for hotel rooms. As a frequent business traveler I have high standards for hotels. This place fit the bill perfectly. The room seemed small to me but my boyfriend, who has traveled Europe quite a bit, assured me it was a good size. The room was clean and we liked the free Internet and mini bar. The staff was very helpful and spoke English well. Breakfast was not my favorite but is convenient if you're short on time. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “great location,ordinary rooms”
Reviews.Author: piyush69
