Reviews.Content: The hotel is located perfectly ,just adjacent to Gran Via and very close to Plaza Mayor.Rooms are small and ok,,but the automated black out curtain in the room was very useful,the minibar is free,we came to know of it ,because of trip advisor,the hotel should publicize this nice gesture,and also iinform at the time of check in.We had problem with the local sim card of mobile and the front desk staff ANA,went out of the way to fix it.the staff is extremely helpful.they also guided us to a travel agent across the road for buying renfe tickets to seville.In case you take a day trip around madrid,(the tour operator suggested by hotel are good)the bus pick up point is hardly 50 metre from the hotel.There is also a small 24/7 kind of shop diagonally apposite the hotel.We did not take the buffet breakfast,but only sandwitches at the restaurant,and they were good.The lobby is very unimpressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: djwoz
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Preciados for three nights. The location is fantastic. Walkable to all the sights in Madrid. Subway stop is close by if you prefer to walk less. Hotel room was very comfortable and extremely quiet & dark. Perfect for getting a good nights sleep. The staff was very helpful. Free minibar and wifi add to the value. The Preciados is a fantastic hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: texann
Reviews.Content: Definitely a four star hotel. Beautifully appointed rooms and a truly wonderful restaurant with outdoor seating on an entertaining thoroughfare. Easy to find from the metro. Short stay but very happy with the booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, dont think about it twice”
Reviews.Author: duffman316
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Preciados for 4 days and it was exactly what you could ask for in a hotel. The location is perfect, you can easily walk to Puerta del sol and plaza mayor and the Metro is very close by. The staff was very friendly, a very willing to help. We arrived at 9 a.m. and they made every effort to get us a room even though it was very early. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for short break”
Reviews.Author: OxfordTravelmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with friends. Rooms modern, clean and very comfy beds. All the staff were really helpful and gave good recommendations. The hotel is in a great position and although not in the prettiest part of the city (centre of the shopping district) it is brilliantly situated for sightseeing - only a ten-minute walk to the Prado etc and in the other direction to Royal Palace. Plaza Mayor just 5 mins away. Next to a tube too - but we just walked everywhere. You can sit outside at the pavement cafe/bar on the pedestrianised street and enjoy watching everyone stroll by. Good buffet breakfast with huge range of food. Great value - would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and facility”
Reviews.Author: chapmanranch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to Spain. We decided to stay in Madrid for a week then go to Barca on the high speed train. Really happy we picked this hotel. Worth the extra few dollars compared to other budget places--and it is a better deal than the big luxury places. Really great location..quiet area but steps from the shopping and main squares. Didn't eat at the restaurant but looked great. The room was fun and clean and modern . Really liked the staff--SUPER helpful on check in and what to do. I will stay here again for sure. Go for this place...super close to transportation and lots of night life in the area but not at your door to be annoying. REcommend seeing Royal Palace from here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jehinch
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at the Hotel Preciados which we chose on the strength of previous reviews. Had a brilliant stay at the Hotel and was not disappointed. Hotle is very clean and contemporary in design. Rooms are not large but are well appointed. Have to say the bed and especially the pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was a good size and very clean. It was good to have the free mini bar as the cold drinks were very welcome at the end of a long day! The room was well soundproofed and had shutters for the windows to block out the light. Enjoyed having two small balconies to look out on. Our room looked out over the street below with all the hustle and bustle which I loved. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast buffet was exceptionally good with variety of food to cater for everyone. Had one Dinner in the hotel which was also very good. Would reccomend this hotel to anyone and especially for those wishing to be close to all the popular attractions as it is very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Niushork
Reviews.Content: Needed to stay for one night in town for a 2 hour business meeting. Was there with my boss that normally is used to more flashier-pricier hotels and wasn't impressed with the hotel entrance but gave the approval based on the rooms, which were large, clean and looked brand new. Nice bed, nice shower only glitch I found was that the toilet did not have hand soap, had to use shampoo instead. It is nothing, but higher ratings should be given to DETAILS and not only based in pricing-location. Was in need of a bottle of water and checking out pointed out to the staff, was greatly surprise when they told me it was for FREE! Nice touch. Happy to recommend the hotel and would certainly stay there again. Stayed September 2011, traveled for business

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MAXINEOxford
Reviews.Content: All good! We had a room on the third floor with a balcony looking over the street. The room was large, clean, had air conditioning and double glazing so street sounds can be completely shut out. Bathroom was a good size with plentiful toiletries that were replaced every day. The free mini bar is also restocked every day and contains water, beer, cola, sodas and juices. Chocolates and champagne were brought to our room on our first night! Reception was fast and all the staff we met were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a very central position, about 10 minutes walk from the palace and cathedral and with lots of restaurants close by. The nearest metro stop is Callao which is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. It is quite easy to get to the hotel from the airport using the metro ( 2.5 euros) but be prepared to change twice and there are some unavoidable steps. I would be very happy to recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cass2007
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 nights based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. Our room was large and airy with a good sized bathroom with spa bath and a little balcony. Check in was excellent and when we left a late check out was offered which was much appreciated. Lovely range of toiletries, robes and slippers plus a free mini bar. Staff are very helpful and speak English well. They are able to recommend anything you need - places to eat, directions, taxis etc. During our stay we ate at the hotel 3 times, a breakfast, a lunch and a dinner and all were very good and priced well given location and service etc. Recommend Plaza Mayor and side streets around it for tapas and general coffee drinking and people watching. Would definitely stay again and recommend for a central base in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two nights and enjoy each day there. The staff were unbelievably helpful and friendly. Far beyond any other hotel we have ever stayed at. The room was large and very comfortable. We loved the location within walking distance of most things. We would definitely stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean. But could be better for this price”
Reviews.Author: veronicaconley
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were helpful, professional and friendly . Rooms were as described in other positive reviews . However we had asked for a non smoking room and our room smelt strongly of cigarettes which is unpleasant for a non smoker . On the last morning of our stay there was no hot water so we had to have cold showers which is disappointing in a hotel within this price range .

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: risteardhoward
Reviews.Content: Well presented city centre hotel situated near to a metro station. My only grip being that I had a single room and the room, while modern and well laid out, was small and the window faced an internal atrium. Free mini bar and wifi are to be commended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get too excited by the Superior Room terrace”
Reviews.Author: ElmParkRoyal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Preciados 12 months ago (TripA report 24 Sept 2010) and had no hesitation in coming back and using it as a base for daytrips to Toledo, Segovia and El Escorial. A metro station is about 2 minutes walk away and accesses Madrid’s main line stations serving each of these locations Last time, Mrs EPR and I had a fab Junior Suite. None available during our visit this year, so we chose a "Superior" Room instead. Our interest was alerted because it had an outside terrace. Upon arrival we found a perfectly functional, not particularly large room, most of which was filled by bed! By the entrance area was certainly plenty of closet space , with loads of hangers and a small, easy to use, safe. Inside the main room there was a desk, minibar and flatscreenTV in an alcove along the wall. As I mentioned, the main area of the room was all bed (two twins with a double mattress), with a bit of space at the foot to walk round, together with an area to park the suitcase. Off the entrance hall, was a galley-type bathroom, with double sinks, full width mirror, and normal sized bath with whirlpool features. There was no separate shower cubicle; one had to use an attachment over the bath which worked satisfactorily. The bathroom’s fitted out in large brown marble tiling which can be subject to water marking in sharp sunlight. The hairdryer worked well; the shaving mirror was rather elastic. A doorstop in the middle of the floor was infuriating (especially in the middle of the night!). Also, the bath is under a sloping roof, so extracting one's 6ft 2in self around the shower screen whilst ducking below the slanting ceiling was something of a daily contortion. Finally, the terrace - approached by patio doors adjacent to the bed (a gap of about 18 ins adjacent to the bed!), is built within the sloping roof of the hotel. It’s about 3 ft wide and about 8 ft long. Just enough space for a table with a chair at each end. High walls meant no views, apart from more roofs, but all the hustle and bustle nonetheless evident from below. However, before we came, I knew we would be guaranteed three things - complete quiet at night, comfortable bed so a good night's sleep, and a big wide choice of spread for breakfast; all successfully achieved again. I was pleased to get a free beer in my minibar everyday (which didn't happen last year), and was very impressed by the jolly maid who diligently attended to our room at 6 p.m. one evening after a practical joke involving our "do not disturb"sign. It was also good to sit on the street terrace outside the hotel watching the world go by during the evening - and Madrid is a pretty lively place. So, Madrid and environs was great again, the hotel was as dependable as before, the room was functional but not our first choice - but for a Brit , four days of 30C temperature at the end of September puts a guaranteed smile on the face whatever the circumstances

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: MSView
Reviews.Content: Tastefully decorated and clean from the moment you walk in. Well laid out rooms with all the extras, including a powerful overbath shower and good air conditioning. All staff were friendly and helpful. It is well located, most attractions are within easy walking distance and the metro is close by. Noise was low despite the hustle and bustle outside. Good Breakfast selection. Drinks outside at midnight served by friendly waiters, watching the world go by - great! Only complaint is the pillows are not comfortable - not often the only negative thing about a hotel is so minor! We'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JoolieF100
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. Fantastic hotel, lovely rooms, nice bar down stairs and great location. I cant recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in our trip to Spain”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLew
Reviews.Content: Of all the five hotels we stayed at while in Spain, Hotel Preciados was the best. The room was very nice, with plenty of room. We had a nice view looking out over Calle Preciados, which is now a pedestrian street. The hotel is in a good location, near the metro, and walking distance to lots of sights and restaurants. Good bed, pillows, shower, and towels. Free (albeit limited) mini bar was really nice luxury. Staff were super helpful. The room did not have a clock or face cloths, but this was true of everywhere we stayed in Spain, so I don’t hold that against them. But if you don’t like to rely on wake up calls, bring an alarm clock. For meals nearby, I’d recommend Lo Scolapasta, Casa Botin, and Asador de Aranda (literally across the street from hotel). Warning: My pocket got picked while I was on a crowded Metro train on the way from hotel to the airport. My wife and I had our luggage, backpacks, etc., and I’m a fairly savvy traveler, but those thieves are pros at what they do. My wallet was attached to my belt by a chain, so they did not take my whole wallet. But they were able to take my wallet out of my pocket, remove cash, and put the wallet back into my pocket without my realizing it. It was like a magic trick. Fortunately, I only lost 70 euro and no credit cards or ID. If again faced with such a crowded train, I think I would wait for the next train. Or, if I was travelling at a time when the trains were going to be crowded, I’d just take a taxi. It would have been cheaper it turns out.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: DMCK63
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in the centre of the old town in Madrid. It is close to many of the main sites such as Plaza Mayor and Mercado San Miguel and within walking distance of just about everything else. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are well fitted out and scrupulously clean. The free minibar is a great perk. The only thing missing is tea and coffee making facilities in the room. We did not eat in the hotel due to the wide variety of local restaurants available within 5 minutes walk but the Cava Sangria is well worth a try! The only negative comment is when we tried to get an early breakfast on the day we left at 6.30 in the morning. Although the desk clerk took our order for coffee and toast no breakfast was forthcoming the next morning. We did get coffee but were advised that the restaurant was shut so nothing else could be provided. Overall, however a good hotel with a couple of minor flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: We had a suite I think - in any event, plenty of space and very nicely fitted out and well appointed sizable bathroom. We didn't know Madrid well but location was excellent with walking access to most of the city attractions. The staff were unobtrusive but very helpful when needed. We also enjoyed the restaurant either for meals or just a drink. By European standards, we also thought the hotel was very well priced. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: natmoto22
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, efficient, perfect location, clean and very friendly helpful staff. We booked a superior double (Room 505) and thought it was good for a city hotel. We had a large bathroom with jacuzzi bath, there was a good amount of wardrobe space, free space, free mini-bar which included juices, water and lager. The bed was a queen size and very comfortable and the black out blinds and soundproof windows gave us a brilliant nights sleep. We had two balconies which each had two chairs and a table on. The room was very clean and the maid visited every day. We received some complimentary chocolates, which even though they tasted weird was a nice gesture. Reception were very helpful in advising us of local restaurants and entertainment. We would definately return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “High standard”
Reviews.Author: E B
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, rooms are very clean and extremely cossy. The hotel is in the very centre of the city so it is easy to get the subway (1 minute walking the closes station). Most of the rooms are quite silent given the location of the hotel (some of those situated next to the stair case might be a little bit noisier, but not a big deal). It is an expensive place to stay, but definetely nice if you can afford it. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it promises”
Reviews.Author: JLRsydney
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here in September and found that it was well-located for shopping and eating and only a couple of metro stops away from the big galleries etc Free computer use and helpful desk staff made it perfect for what I was after.The big department store and the Puerta del Sol were an easy walk, and although the street was buzzing with nightlife my street facing room was quiet at all times because of the double windows. Only possible improvement would be an non-news English language TV channel - there were heaps in other languages, but only news in English - but at least it was the BBC as well as CNN!

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect"”
Reviews.Author: AlanO62
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent 5 nights in "Hotel Preciados" and we cannot say a bad word about it.Ideal location, just off "Gran Via" Next to "Callao" Metro Station(200m),and the Shopping area in the heart of the city, close to Puerto del Sol ,The Staff were Friendly and Very Helpful, (Especially Miguel from the Bar/Restaurant who is a real Gem), the Room was Spotless and Very Quiet with a Comfortable Bed and Air Conditioning,the Bathroom was Lovely with a Powerful Shower, Free WiFi and Wired Internet, Free Minibar and even some of the tv channels are in english.The Restaurant Food and Drinks were Reasonably Priced,any time we stopped for a drink we were treated to Free Tapas, Overall it was "Perfect" for our City Break.

Reviews.Title: “Very good a bit priced”
Reviews.Author: FRANCISCO7
Reviews.Content: The locations is perfect, close to Puerta del Sol .Friendly staff.Rooms are confortable, sound proof, very quiet.Breakfast was not included and look like to be expensive.Free internet.Maybe a bit priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - very warm reception”
Reviews.Author: SMV5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this hotel on our way back by car to London. The receptionists were very efficient and attentive from the moment we arrived. For example, twice we had small problems with our room facilities and one of the assistants was there to help us within a few minutes. The breakfast was very varied and fresh, from the fruit to the bread and coffee. We also had an excellent dinner in the hotel restaurant at a fair price. Overall, we retain warm memories of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Madrid city break”
Reviews.Author: spicyhippo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 night stay at the hotel. Room very cosy, double glazing and window shutters very effective for blocking out sound and light in a noisy city. Front desk staff helpful and made reservations for me on request. Location was very good with easy walk to all areas of the city and metro stops. We made good use of the Hop on Hop off bus, there are 3 stops on Gran Via which is a short walk away. Plaza Mayor about 10-15 minutes’ walk away. Lots of restaurants and Bars in nearby area. I have to give a big shout to El Labriego restaurant which in terms of value was unbeatable. Its a left outside the hotel and then 1st left and its down that street. We just ordered drinks and we were going to then move on to the restaurant but every drink we got a big free tapas so in the end it was a cheap night. 1 large beer and 5 sangrias came to 18 euros and we were given a big plate of paella, then chrizo, then potato salad then ham and potatoes. They really are generous poritions for free tapas. Breakfast in the hotel was very nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Perfectiados!”
Reviews.Author: bckpckrau
Reviews.Content: Five nights in a hotel of this calibre was a wonderful start to a Spanish holiday. The staff are multilingual, friendly and happy to help in any way. The rooms are spacious and new and most importantly, soundproofed. We had a room off the stairs and being more open to noise they even fitted a second door to close at night. Perfection. The double glazed window even had an electric roller shutter to ensure we slept in peace and darkness. You would never know we were right near Plaza Callao, one of Madrid's busiest and an easy stroll to Sol, Palacio Real and Gran Via. Add a stunning and ample breakfast to the equation and I would question if I had ever had a better hotel stay. Only two tiny issues: including a moisturizer with the bathroom toiletries would be nice and sadly we had a guest that lived in her high heels (day and night) staying above us. She woke us many nights but hard to blame the hotel for this. Maybe they could remind people in the hotel room booklet that impact noise on timber floors travels? Just a suggestion! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: InesTa
Reviews.Content: We stayed this August for 2 nights at Preciados. It is a perfect choice: located just in the heart of action – shopping and restaurants, but also at a walking distance for the main attractions in Madrid. The room was clean and modern. The price is excellent. Very good breakfast, we tried and the restaurant one evening and we like it. They have a nice terrace just in front of the hotel were we finished the evenings at a ‘cerveza’ and a sangria. The staff is polite and helpful. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, no problems!”
Reviews.Author: Bristraveller3870
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel 2 nights. Hotel was clean, modern, great place to unwind after z big day of shopping & sightseeing. Fantastic location situated near the metro, grand via, lots of shops & great places to eat. Staff were very professional. Breakfast was excellent, wonderful choice of food. Also ate at restaurant which was good. Loved staying here, great experience. Will recommend to everyone visiting Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: Cdchi1
Reviews.Content: Given the price I paid per night its impossible to give a less than perfect rating for this hotel, however even had I paid double I expect the rating would have been the same. I took advantage of the 5 night stay special rate hence the ridiculously low cost. If only I had been aware that the minibar was FREE...found out at checkout. Location is perfect on Calle Preciados, literally a very short walk from Puerta del Sol. Despite the street being extremely busy, the double glass doors on the balcony effectively reduced street noise at night, though the loud roadworks during the day were audible but who cares about during the day. Room was spectacularly clean after every service. The bathroom was fantastic with a great shower/bath combo. Bed was a great size and amazingly comfortable. Hotel restaurant served a great value buffet breakfast though in the interest of watching my weight only took advantage of it once. Staff were friendly and helpful though probably not as personal as say a boutique hotel like the hotel in Paris I stayed in (Des Grandes Hommes). Free wifi handy as well. The room was larger than looks in photo as well...was dificult to get a good photo due to room shape. I has TWO small balconies.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Chains/Boutique Hotels TAKE NOTE THIS IS HOW ITS DONE!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunsetInStyle
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely critical in all my reviews as trip advisor has served me abounds over the past 10 years so I try to pay it forward...Let me start off by saying I'm big on FREE so I may be slightly biased to state this hotel was near PERFECT and I stay in some really nice places. Trip Advisor has yet again served me well!!! We walked in after a tedious 8hr flight from EWR and lengthy subway ride with luggage and immediately they had a room ready, I grabbed my free apple from the front desk, some free candy from the bowl and was walked up by hotel staff to my room and given an overview on how everything operated in the room and that everything in the mini bar was free and would be repleneshed daily. I was immediately impressed as was my sometimes skeptical girlfriend. Room was well appointed, bathroom had a skylight with motorized shade, and I had two sets of french doors that walked out to a spacious balcony. My bed was super comfortable, and the staff helpful if asked any questions they even provided us maps to get around. AC worked great and used my FREE internet to work on sightseeing plans daily. Plenty of free bathroom amenities/toiletries. The best part besides the room was the hotel location, literally in the middle of everything and the Metro was steps from the hotel which is CRUCIAL in spain if your american your dollar isnt worth much so you will be using the Metro constantly (which isnt a bad thing its clean and prompt) unless you have alot money for cabs. Concerns: Not really much, there was some construction either in the hotel on our floor or in the building next door that I heard some jack hammering on and off BUT it was around noon so it wasnt an unreasonable hour and time to get up anyways. Suggestion: Charge your customers another 10 euro a night on price and put it towards a free breakfast available in the mornings in your lobby restaurant and in my opinion you will have the PERFECT HOTEL. Keep up the great work guys!!! Tip: If you want to sightsee go to madrid in august its only tourists/students everyone else is on holiday so it was easy to get into all attraction and some museums are FREE during particular hours of the day. Only downside is everything not tourist related seems to be closed

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mikhail0859
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Preciados hotel for 3 days during our trip around Spain. Our trip was started from Madrid and it was the first hotel in Spain. We were traveling with my wife, sister and nephew. First off all the staff was so friendly and helpful to explain all points of interest and how to get there. Secondly, it is a very good location in the center of pedestrian area and we were able to walk everywhere we needed. We did not spend a lot of time in the hotel , just sleeping and there were not any complains about anything. Rooms were cleaned, all supplies were sufficient and the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, service and appearance”
Reviews.Author: xerete
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise it was to hit upon this hotel. It was central to everything we wanted to see in Madrid. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Ladihwk
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff. My room was quiet, clean and great bedding. Within walking distance of so many sights. Easy walking distance of metro (minutes). Restaurant also accommodating. Free minibar and in room safe big enough for iPad and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanielCaruso
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near everything, shops, metro, bars, clubs. Really great. The room is comfortable and the service is also good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & a very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CSHH
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenage daughters and I spent three nights here in July 2011. The hotel is very central- 5 minutes from Puerta del sol & Gran Via so location couldn’t be better. Despite being in such a busy area we were never disturbed by noise (our rooms were on the 4th floor). The hotel feels quite small although it has 6 floors, the rooms are spotlessly clean and a reasonable size with the bonus of a free mini-bar (beer, water & soft drinks). Unfortunately, the room safe wasn’t working & we were advised to use the one in our daughters’ room. This was a bit inconvenient but manageable- we would have asked for a different room had we been travelling without them. Breakfast was very good with a huge range of things to choose from at the buffet and lovely freshly squeezed orange juice. We didn’t eat in the restaurant (mainly because we are vegetarian and the choice was limited for us) but the outside terrace seemed like a nice place to eat. The main disadvantage of the hotel was the small public area with a couch and a couple of chairs at reception this felt like a place to pass through rather than to sit for any time. This was our second visit to Madrid and had money been no object we would have stayed again at the Emperador which we really enjoyed (pool & club lounge) but the Preciados offered a much more affordable stay this year. Not as many facilities but a great base for exploring Madrid. In terms of things to do; we really enjoyed the Antonio Lopez exhibition as well as the main collection at the Thyssen museum.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated, no outside window or balcony despite website saying all rooms have outside balcony”
Reviews.Author: MarkKwok
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located on Calle Preciados. Note that Calle Prediados is closed off to traffic (probably in the afternoon and evenings) so if taking a taxi, make sure to state that it's at the corner of Calle Preciados and Plaza de Santo Domingo as the taxi won't be able to take you to its front door. The website states that all double rooms have an outside balcony - not my room which is by the staircase. There is a window which overlooks an atrium which is not much to look at. There is no telling of day or night. The safety deposit box wouldn't open when I tried to use it the first time and I had to get staff to fix it. I made the booking through a travel agent and my agent was told that the hotel needs pre-payment so I gave a cheque to my agent. Upon check-in, front desk staff confirmed the room was pre-paid. However, upon check-out, another front desk staff was adamant that they don't have a prepayment policy and that I never paid, despite me presenting a voucher which said the room was pre-paid. As I had to catch a train, I didn't have time to sort this out so I paid AGAIN, using my VISA. I'm now told by my agent that she has given a VISA number to the hotel after I paid her as the hotel insisted pre-payment, but the hotel never charged the agent's VISA. Now I have to wait for a refund from my agent. I don't know whose mistake it was but I wasn't pleased. I also prepaid a hotel in Barcelona through my agent and there was no problem whatsoever with that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: annina69
Reviews.Content: I did a good Choiche for visiting Madrid for the second Time

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: Almac71
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a fantastic location. Room an amazing size..balcony a plus. Everything about this hotel is wonderful except that I found the guy on reception (didn't get his name) to be quite unhelpful...in fact quite rude. He was on duty each day. The woman on late tho was much more pleasant. Overall I couldn't fault this hotel except for the above mentioned fellow (amazing tho how 1 person's behaviour can impact your stay). The free wifi was a major bonus 4 me.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way”
Reviews.Author: DebraDavisLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room for 107 euros including breakfast - a great price for such a central location in Madrid. We were actually given a suite, which was completely fabulous - a huge bathroom, big sitting/dining room and lovely bedroom with an enormous bed. Despite being on the ground floor, it was very quiet and peaceful. All staff - from those on reception through to the porters - were ultra friendly and helpful. The breakfast was superb. Cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NateMcc
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean, modern hotel within walking distance to all Madrid sights. Excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jane2806
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, just off the Gran Via. Opera, with load of nice restaurants and bars is just a couple of minutes stroll away, but if you don't want to leave the hotel there are plenty of choices right outside the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, but the food looked nice, with plenty of locals eating there- always a good sign. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The jacuzzi bath was a great touch. The balcony, although not big, really sold this hotel for me. Having somewhere to sit out in the morning to eat breakfast in a city hotel was fantastic . The sound proofing was also great, had the best weeks sleep I have ever had in a city hotel. The staff were very friendly and couldn't have been more helpful. We will definitely be staying here again on our next trip to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for visiting Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Mrsbusywoman
Reviews.Content: Wonderful time here. Location great. Rooms good size- we had interconnecting. complimentary mini bar, nice touch. Staff great, helpful in booking taxi's, giving local info, etc. Breakfast good selection of the usual meats, yogurts, cereals etc. Small lobby. No bar but plenty in vicinity within a minutes stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for sightseeing in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: VDMBoise
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for seeing the sights in Madrid. The room was decent sized, the staff were friendly and helpful, and they had good internet access. The only thing they could have improved upon was the curtains for the windows. There was no darkening shade or curtain and since the hotel is in a main nightlife area, the room stayed light all night long. Don't forget to check out the Cuban restaurant around the corner and down the alley. It has the best Mojitos I ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Hki_2412
Reviews.Content: One of best hotel experiences lately in the European cities; the location is perfect (less than one minute from Santo Domingo metro station, a few minutes walk to Puerta del Sol square). The staff was very polite and helpful, two guest computers for free use in the basement. The breakfast was very good with fresh fruits, cheese, ham etc. The room was very clean and quiet. Really loved my stay in the Preciados!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: brd_london
Reviews.Content: There is a reason this places rates so highly on Tripadvisor. The staff are friendly, the rooms extremely well appointed (the Junior Suite particularly recommended), and very centrally located. You wouldn't find anything like it in Central London for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Solid 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCG1234
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Preciados is ideally located one block from the Plaza del Sol and one block off of the Calle Gran Via. It is on a quiet pedestrian street filled with lovely restaurants and a few shops. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The lobby and staff are first rate. English was spoken and understood by all staff. Our room was good size, well furnished and decorated and very clean. Beds were firm and comfortable. A/C controls were in the room itself allowing for easy and accurate regulation of room temp. The bathroom was very large, immaculate and full of all the sundry items one could ever need. Our room rate of $150 included breakfast buffet and all taxes. A very good value to my mind. The breakfast buffet was truly exceptional! So many choices and all very delicious. We also had tapas one evening and were very pleased with this as well. The one unfortunate note of our stay, was my husband's wallet being stolen. The hotel staff was exceptionally helpful and called the police even taking time to speak with the police on our behalf, translating when necessary. When in Madrid in the future, we will definitely choose the Hotel Preciados again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value.”
Reviews.Author: IveBeenAroundNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based upon Trip Advisor rating. While it isn't the Four Seasons, it is a great hotel with very comfortable rooms at a great price. To be in this location in Centro and close to all is terrific. I would absolutely stay here again, no question. The free wifi is a welcome thing as most hotels in Madrid charge for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: LJWNYC2008
Reviews.Content: We loved Preciados - very clean, roomy, QUIET (difficult in a city like Madrid) and so centrally located. The room was super modern - huge bathroom, too, and this electric shade that completely blocked the light (we didn't figure out how it worked until the last night, unfortunately)! Breakfast was pretty good - for some reason we only got it on the last night. If we were in Madrid again we'd definitely stay there - no question at all. Exactly what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great service (mostly)”
Reviews.Author: roy_prn
Reviews.Content: We booked based on TripAdv reviews and were not dissappointed. Great location just off of Grand Via, next to a Metro stop, at the top of a pedestrian only shopping area on the way to Sol. We stayed on the first floor (no need to wait for the elevators) and there was virtually no street noise (blocked by 2 sets of double paned doors leading to a small standing room only balcony). On check-in the front desk staffed offered tourist advice without needing to be asked (awesome). Standard room size for 2 with large comfortable beds that got tight when we asked for a 3rd bed. Adequate closet and drawer space. My 13" laptop fit in the in room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- great staff”
Reviews.Author: zamfamtravel
Reviews.Content: We had trouble finding the hotel (driving from the airport), but it was well worth the three times we drove around the block. The location is perfect for walking to almost any tourist location. The location made it easy to go anywhere. We were a group of six and had 3 rooms - While the rooms, are a bit small- but not by European standards- They are truly well designed and comfortable and modern- there is even plenty of closet space and the bathrooms are very nice, roomy and comfortable. What was impressive was the great customer service: the warm and welcoming staff. This was our first stop of a two week trip and some where along the way, I lost the names of those staff members who deserve to be mentioned by name. The front desk staff ( maybe Oscar?) the doorman who took care of our car and of course the young woman in the restuarant in the morning who even made us especially prepared expresso. Have to mention the incredible spread for breakfast. There was so much to choose from and all was tasty. We had a young hearty eater in our group who really enjoyed the expansive and delicious breakfast selection. This hotel knows how to cater to its guest. They even offerred us tips as we headed out for the day. Without a doubt, we would stay here again- You are getting a great place for the price. They were a great start to our vacation. We recommend the hotel and it's wonderful, warm, and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Average at best, definitely not the best in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Flonaldo
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews of the Preciados I was expecting more, a lot more. I'd rate this hotel average at the very best and pretty lousy versus the expectations I had. Quite a lot of issues even though it had some good sides as well. I had a single room on the 5th floor and the room was really small. And I mean really, really small. There was room for the bed... and that was it. I've stayed in a lot of hotels around the world and I think this was the smallest single room I've ever been in. Also the room was located right next to the maids' equipment closet. That meant that loud noises started every morning at 9am sharp, as well as vacuuming right outside the room's door. So absolutely no chance of sleeping in a bit longer. The room didn't face the street but an inner staircase. This caused some issues as well, because the curtains in the room were pretty flimsy and almost see-through. So first thing: you couldn't get the room dark if you wished. Second thing and the one that bothered me more: when you have the lights on in the room anyone from the staircase can see inside your room! Forget about privacy! Good things about the hotel: * Location is perfect, right in the middle of things * Breakfast selection is exceptionally good even if somewhat expensive * Everything was clean and in order An additional note to everyone: Be really careful with your bags & possessions everywhere and especially if staying at a terrace late at night. A bunch of American girls were having drinks at the hotel's terrace one night and one of them had their handbag stolen right there. Didn't take more than a few seconds and she had right next to her seat.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, good value!”
Reviews.Author: Scigal1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Preciados. It is close to the metro so easy to get to and to get around Madrid. The rooms were large and modern and the breakfast was extensive. The front desk proved very helpful in arranging tickets. The waiters in the adjoining restaurant took the time to interact with our family. Compared with the other hotels we stayed in in Italy and Spain, the hotel offers very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Preciados = Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CJIMI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, earlier this month, and have no complaints. The room was clean, quiet, and the A/C worked well, even on the hottest day. There is a metro stop adjacent to the hotel, and you are a short walk from the Puerta del Sol. We found the staff to be most helpful. The mini bar is free. If you drink that dry, there is a Mini-Mart across the street from the hotel, which is open every day until midnight. There is a flat screen TV in the room, with several English language channels. Our rate included a most copious buffet breakfast. An earlier reviewer complained about difficulties in booking a day trip to Toledo ( a must see destination ). The train is the best way to go ( 40 miles in 30 minutes ), but the train does often sell out . So, book your tickets in advance. I was feeling too lazy to deal with the airport bus on departure, so I asked the front desk to call a taxi. Even on a Friday morning, the ride to the airport took only 25 minutes, and cost us 27 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems”
Reviews.Author: eyechick
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Spain with my adult daughter and we selected the Preciados based on several reviews and price. It was the most expensive of the 3 hotels we stayed at in Spain, but we thought it would be worth it for 4 days in Madrid. The location is very convenient to the Metro and Plaza Mayor. The lobby is pretty, the staff are very nice and the room and bathroom were lovely and comfortable. So far, so good. The first problem we encountered was that the safe in the room was locked closed. We didn't want to go out without locking up our passports and money, so we waited for someone to come to unlock it, which took longer than it should have (they said, "right away"), about 45 minutes. Second problem: first morning, the shower broke and one of us had to take a bath. That, fortunately, was fixed by the time we got back that day. Third problem: We inquired about a bus to Toledo to spend the day. The staff told us, "don't take the bus, the train is much better" (even thought Frommer's said the bus was the best way to go.) They printed out a train schedule for us and told us where to get the train. Never offered to book our train tickets for us. We got to the station in plenty of time, only to find out the train was sold out ("it always sells out") and the next train was 2 hours later. We ended up getting back on the Metro to the bus station, where we very easily got a bus ticket and traveled very comfortably and quickly to Toledo. Fourth problem: 2 days before our departure, we asked about transportation to the airport. We were told a taxi is the best way to get there. We asked if the taxis take credit card, and they said if they book it for us, they will make sure they take credit cards. The next day, we asked them to book the taxi for the following morning, again reminding them that we needed the taxi to take a credit card, ("sure, sure") and they asked if we needed a wake-up call, which we did request. Next morning -- no wake-up call!!! ("So sorry") We rush to get ready, the taxi is waiting, the ride to the airport is fine, and the taxi driver tells us, "Cash only!" We were furious. The poor taxi driver is upset, we're upset, my daughter runs into the airport to use the ATM, leaving us with euros to take home! While she's gone, the taxi driver calls the hotel, and the staff offers to pay the taxi and put it on our credit card charge. Too late! ("So sorry") Also -- it would have been nice for them to have told us about free entrance to the Prado on Tuesday evenings and to the Reina Sofia on Wednesday evenings. We were just leaving the Reina Sofia when we saw people lined up for free entry! A hotel should be about more than just appearances -- it's about customer service. We were extremely disappointed in the Preciados and cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug1331
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally in the center of everything. Within walking distance of major sites, metro stations, parks, shopping and more. We booked a suite, which was worth the money after a long European trip in small rooms. The room was very spacious, the beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were large with plenty of counter space. We loved the stand up shower and separate soaking tub. We loved the automatic shutters; they allowed us to sleep in after spending late nights on the town. One thing we had trouble with were the light switches all over the room. Each and every light had its own individual switch and some had two. My husband and I had to start on opposite ends of the room and make our way around the suite trying to figure out how to turn all the lights off. We found the staff to be extremely helpful and friendly. The restaurant within the hotel was fantastic and stayed open late for us night owls. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Well located update hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Palman13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in central Madrid. It has been updated lately and is generally very modern. Typical of a European hotel, the room is a little small but well appointed with good comfort. The bed was comfortable and staff very responsive. We found the hotel a good value convenient in central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: taxatty
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in the "interior" Room 415--if having a room with only an "inside" window overlooking the inside of the hotel bothers you, don't stay in a "15" room. It didn't bother us at all--the room was very nice--a comfortable bed with a very firm mattress, the room and bathroom were quite large for a European hotel, the free mini fridge-bar was a nice feature (once we plugged it in), and it was absolutely silent at night. The wi-fi worked well, and there were also two computers to use for free in the basement if needed for boarding passes, etc. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is reasonable walking distance from the Royal Palace and Plaza Mayor and many good restaurants and shopping opportunities are nearby. The special weekend rate was a steal for a 4* Madrid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jax2001
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Preciados. Walking distance to so many things and convenient to the metro. Room was clean and comfortable. Good breakfast. The staff was friendly and helpful with restaurants recommendations and with hotels for other cities in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: FunLoverVancouver
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beyond our expectations. We reserved a suite for 3 nights (2 separate sleeping rooms) which was located at the 'bow' of the hotel - fabulous! What fun for my daughter and I to have our pictures taken in our hotel robes on the balcony (husband down on the street with the camera!). The room was immaculate, beautiful large bathroom with huge jacuzzi tub, free minibar, lots of closet space and very quiet (even during the political demonstrations in May). The front desk staff was unbelievably helpful and nice. We loved the buffet breakfast in the restaurant, the best we've had. The restaurant was great for dinner as well. The hotel location was perfect for walking to many major sights (e.g. Royal Palace). Went on a day trip to Toledo (took the nearby subway to the train station) and had a great day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly awesome”
Reviews.Author: Austin78703
Reviews.Content: My family( my sister and parents) just returned from a 6 day stay in Madrid. I had picked this Hotel from the reviews on Trip Advisor and it was great. The location is perfect. It is right off Gran Via, the largest street in Madrid. It is just a brief 2-5minute walk to 2 different subway stops. It also is very close in walking distance to Plaza Mayor and Plaza de Sol. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Every night we asked for recommendations for dinner and were extremely pleased with every suggestion. Our rooms were very clean with very comfortable beds and each had mini balconies we could sit on at night. Also the rooms in general were spacious with large bathrooms for Europe. They also have free Wifi, which worked great with our phones. I highly recommed this hotel and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Cowiemcnic
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located perfectly for all tourist attractions, restaurants, bars and shopping. Room size is reasonable and the free mini bar is great. Our room was spotless and although we faced on to a street there was no noise at all. Hotel staff were all friendly and attentive. Only downside was that the aircon was quite noisy. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDallasTX
Reviews.Content: The taxi ride from the Atocha train station was approx 8 euros for 4 people. The hotel appears new, clean and fresh. Check in was smooth and easy. The rooms, although on the smaller side, made great use of the space. Nice closet and drawers for your clothes. Our room on the 4th floor had two balconies with doors you could open to let the breeze in. Great lighting by the bedside to read at night if you choose. Beds were very comfortable and had down pillows. Free wifi worked great in the room as did the air conditioner. Rooms also have a safe. The hotel does have an onsite restaurant but we did not try it. There is a small convenience store across the street from the hotel as well as a frozen yogurt place. Starbucks is located right down the walkway on the corner. This hotel is closest to the Callao metro stop (about 3 min walk). Overall, I would recommend this hotel for a short stop in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay, What a Gem'”
Reviews.Author: Jonesms
Reviews.Content: Fabulous!!Perfect location with the tube just around the corner, grand via 5 mins away and key sights a very short walk (ie Palace 15 mins walk). The rooms are soundproof and very clean and bright. Free wifi and mini bar...An absolute fantastic find. Will be vIsiting again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location.....extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tsd5
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews on this hotel on this website and found them to be spot on! The rooms were very clean and contemporary. The location was perfect for getting around town on foot or by metro. The real highpoint was the staff. Daniel and the rest of the staff were incredibly helpful in every way possible. They were always helpful no matter how many questions you asked and were always patient. When you are a tourist in a place you are unfamiliar with this is absolutely imperative. They knew how to deliver!!!! I would go back in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Execellent hotel in great location! Love the service too!”
Reviews.Author: CaseyTeh
Reviews.Content: Very good location that is accessible to all the attractions in Madrid. Practically walked to all the tourist attractions. Had a wonderful stay in Madrid, soaking into the Spanish lively and warm atmosphere. Will definitely come back again and will pick this hotel once more. The service from this hotel is excellent! Free wifi access in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suite, nice location, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: TLMSLC
Reviews.Content: We agree with the positive coments posted to date. Top floor rooms have a small but pleasant balcony where you can sit out and enjoy food from local markets or just relax and read. Hotel staff is attentive and helpful to tourists. Many neighborhood cafes within a two blocks. Try the newly opened Brazilian restaurant one block down. No onsite spa or gym but for those starved for a workout ask for a discount pass (8 Euros) to a fitness club two blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, I'll stay there again”
Reviews.Author: inhiding
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Preciados because of it's TA reviews and the hotel delivered. The room we stayed in on the 2nd floor was very nice, clean, and had two very small balconies. Our room faced the front of the hotel which opens to a small pedestrian thoroughfare. Despite being on a low floor, we didn't find it to be very noisy and we had no trouble sleeping. The room featured electric blinds controlled by a switch next to the bed, they kept the early morning sun out until we were ready. The room also featured a small fridge which the hotel restocked daily with juices, bottled water, and 1 or 2 beers. That was nice to come back to after a day of sightseeing, and it's included with the room. The property is in a great location, with lots of shopping and restaurants very close by. A Metro stop is also within about 5 minutes walk. We had lunch in the restaurant in the hotel and thoughtit was very good. The front desk staff were all very friendly and welcoming. Housekeeping kept the rooms very clean. Our room was right across from the maid's closet. They get started around 9am every morning and can be a little noisy. It didn't bother me, but if you think it might be an issue, ask for a room away from Housekeeping. Also, high speed wi-fi was FREE. Very appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mdh95070
Reviews.Content: I booked two joining rooms for my family and it worked out well. We enjoyed the breakfast at the hotel and the dinner was great as well. My only wish would have been a fitness area in the hotel. The hotel does have an arrangement with a gym (we did not try)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: WaitingtoWarmUp
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we stayed in while in Spain. Wonderful location and a very helpful staff. The rooms are small, but confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rxtourist
Reviews.Content: I actually didn't expect a whole lot from this hotel since it was so reasonably priced. I assumed I'd get what I paid for but I was wrong. I got a whole lot more. We had two rooms - both were pretty nice. We arrived at 9am, hoping we could just have them store our luggage until check in. They had two rooms for us right away. The first night, the night manager helped us with a problem and was sympathetic and offered good advice. We were so grateful to him. The breakfast was nice. The location was great. The rooms were clean. I have already recommended this hotel to two colleagues that travel quite a bit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: likeeat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Preciados for four nights. The rooms are bright and clean. The staff were very helpful. The room, including free WiFi throughout the hotel and complementary mini-bar, restocked every day, was only about 130 Euros. Plus, the location is convenient to many things one would want to do in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, an excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: ncc17011
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed three nights at the Hotel Preciados for first time visit to Madrid and highly recommend it. Friendly staff, very nice clean rooms as well as excellent location close to metro stop and car rental facility. Outstanding [but not cheap] breakfast not included in room price. We had room not facing pedestrian street. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Well located nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: oenophile1230
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. The superior rooms were very large and comfortable. The hotel is in a great location near the Opera, Sol and Plaza Mayor. The staff was very helpful. Free wifi. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located. Well appointed with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Arlene945
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here and recommend this clean, friendly and well appointed , centrally located hotel. It is also very good value for money. Madrid is a beautiful city and this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel in a bustling area”
Reviews.Author: heatherbessie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (mid-thirties couple, reasonably well-traveled) just returned from an anniversary vacation to Spain. It was our first time in the country. We really liked this hotel. It is immaculately clean, the staff is very nice and the restaurant is great. The price can't be beat, given the exceptional quality of the hotel. Free WiFi is great, and we never had connectivity problems. The hotel is located in a very busy touristy area, similar to Broadway in New York City. The advantage of the location is that there are many restaurants and shops within very close walking distance. The disadvantage is that these restaurants don't seem to be very "authentic" and the area really lacks any charm of Old Madrid. The area did seem safe, and not seedy at all- just very touristy. But the old town is within short walking distance, so we made our way there for many meals and drinks. The metro is also accessible. I'd definitely recommend this hotel given the quality and price, as long as you don't mind a bit of a walk to some of the nicer areas of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel - could improve cleanliness and service”
Reviews.Author: netgrl22
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the great reviews and decent price. We stayed here two different times during our trip to Spain. We arrived prior to the check in time but were still given a room immediately. Both rooms were of average quality and the mattresses and pillows were good but not great. My main complaint was the lack of attention to cleaning in both rooms. One had a used bandaid on the floor in the bathroom and the second had used dental floss on the floor. Both of these oversights made me really question the cleaning at this hotel and rubbed me the wrong way. Further, the front desk staff was not unfriendly but the desk was always understaffed and it was not a place to go for restaurant recommendations or tips on the city. I also didn't understand why a business hotel had an unsecured wireless network. The rooms have safes but we had to call the front desk to have ours reset during both of our stays as they were not reset after the previous guests. One of the rooms we stayed in, #1, was right next to the restaurant and street and was very noisy at all hours of the day. The other room on the third floor was much better with shades and windows that blocked light and noise. Make sure you do not stay in room 1. On the bright side, the free mini bar was a treat. I would not stay here again if I return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “`it's `OK.”
Reviews.Author: brandeetucker11
Reviews.Content: The people at the front desk aren't that friendly, but they tell you where things are and they get the job done.... Don't expect friendly service, the front desk people are bitter and annoyed and quick to respond. I've stayed in many hotels all over the world and I'll probably stay somewhere else when I return to Spain. The room was OK, the staff was OK and the location was OK. The biggest problem we had with the hotel was once we checked out and arrived in London hours later, we found that we lost our computer charger at Hotel Preciados. We called them MANY times to ask if they could send it to us and each time they told us to call back another time. Each time, the man on the phone said that he had to check with house keeping. By the 6th phone call, we figured we would never see our charger again. So, we sucked it up and paid 60 pounds for a new one in London, because we had work to do and needed to use our computer. In my eyes, customer service should continue even when you leave the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BB in KC
Reviews.Content: I can't add much to other reviews i've seen. This is a great place; rooms were quiet and very comfortable. Very close to the Gran Via and easy to get around. You should definitely try the Galician Crepes and an espresso in the downstairs cafe. Really great!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Great Service and Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Vicki52
Reviews.Content: I did a double trip over my Easter break to Madrid and Barcelona and I have to say this hotel was fabulous. Tip: I would honestly say not to bother getting the metro to the hotel - just stick with a taxi. From the airport it was 4 line changes and after a few wrong trains it took me and my sister 2 hours to get the right station - all with a suitcase up and down stairs. However once I got to the right station it took us 2 minutes to find the hotel which was fantastic! Our room was also ready - even though we arrived very early. From the easy check-in and great staff, to the terrific value deal we got (free breakfast) for a #1 hotel on trip advisor you would expect this hotel to be high priced but its great value. As others have already commented - the location is fantastic and I must recommend the yummy yoghurt shop nearly opposite the hotel - Lloalow (poorly misspelt). We managed to pick up the bus tour round the corner from the hotel and the metro was also a corner away. The only negative was that our room had no view what-so-ever - but when your in this fabulous city its nice to be out exploring it! The beds were really comfortable - everything was in a modern design and the bathroom was lovely. The mirror heated up when I had a shower so that I had some steam-free mirror. This sounds simple enough - but when there are 2 girls cramming for mirror space to get ready and go out - this was much appreciated! The breakfast was fantastic and if you are deciding whether to choose breakfast - I would definitely recommend it. I've stayed in alot of hotels and I thoroughly enjoyed it - a full spread of breakfast, freshly prepared and plentiful: hot cooked breakfast, ham, salmon, cheeses, yoghurt, fresh fruit, chilled milk and cereals, pastries - cannot compliment the breakfast enough really and it would really set me up for the day. The sight seeing was great - I recommend the Prado museum as a must. I'm no art fan but I really found my appreciation of art in this museum. I also went to the Reina Sofia museum but I must say I didn't like any of the modern art - both museums were really close by to each other and on the bus tour. Something that I must recommend to everyone though is Madrid Place - I really enjoy seeing old castles and buildings but never before have I seen such a beautifully preserved castle - a must for everyone. When I next return to Madrid I will certainly be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: TerroirThyme
Reviews.Content: This small hotel does all the big things well. It is in the exact center of Madrid, with easy walks to the Prado, Thyssen, and Royal Palace. It's steps away from the Metro. The hotel is smartly designed and decorated. My room was large, accommodating 2 adults and 2 kids easily. Large balcony, marble bath, etc. An excellent value as well. It was odd though, that the front desk wouldn't lend me a corkscrew. Maybe it's a Madrileno thing... I would definitely return and recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Best location, Excellent service, nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: peepeep
Reviews.Content: My family occupied 2 rooms from May 22-26. This hotel is only 50 meters away from Corte Ingles, 2 blocks from Puerta del Sol and 3 blocks from Plaza Mayor----all within walking distance. Valor, the famous churroz con chocolate cafe is only 30 meters away. No other hotel can beat the convenience of that location! Their best asset, though is the hotel staff. They are courteous and helpful, always ready to go the extra mile. Special mention to BONI, who always gave us directions to nice tourist spots, helped me search for a spanish cologne I've been looking for, and even weighed our bags for us to make sure we dont go beyond the 23kg weight limit. DANIEL from Front desk looked for a particular restaurant that served my husband's favorite dish and made reservations for us. There was also Robert and Andrew who also served us well. Among all the hotels we stayed at in the 3 weeks we travelled around Europe, Hotel Preciados is the best overall.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl2275
Reviews.Content: This was one of our favorite hotels during our stay in Spain. Great location (right next to two metro stations), professional staff, very clean rooms, wonderful shower, free mini bar. The location was a bit noisy but as we found out on our trip most places in a big city are going to be somewhat loud. The window shades were also nice as we arrived early in the morning and needed to nap before sight seeing. The hotel was very accomodating with an early check-in. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again the next time we visit Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dededa80
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of my favorite hotel for its location, value and service. I was a little nervous at first staying in the city center. I was very hesistant and afraid that the noise levels from the streets and crowds outside will keep us up at night. But surprisingly, all the noises were shut out from our room, our windows were doubled doored and shut close, locking out all the noises from the streets. We had the most amazing naps and sleep there and I can't ask for more. This hotel overall exceeded my expectations and I would definitely come back and stay again. The hotel's location is very conveient, it is walking distance to all the major sites in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, breakfast not to be missed.”
Reviews.Author: SolihullStew
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I took the time to check out this hotel on trip advisor before booking. We stayed for 3 nights and were not disappointed in any way. The service was first class, our room on the 3rd floor was immaculate and all linen / towels changed daily. Windows were double glazed so no noise at all from street below. Windows also fitted with shutters to keep out light. Brilliant! Mini bar was replenished daily. The location is perfect for the Palacio Real and the Paseo de Prado and Retiro Park. All within easy walking distance. Madrid is a beautiful City and the Preciados a lovely hotel. I would definately stay here again and gladly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, mixed service”
Reviews.Author: mixip
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Atlantico Best Western on my last three visits to Madrid - I wanted to try something different so chose the Preciados this time. The location of the hotel is superb and the rooms themselves are well appointed - the mini-balcony in particular is nice and the much lauded free "mini-bar" is a nice touch. On check in my friend's room was not ready (despite it being well after the check in time) to which there was a fairly indifferent response (which given the much talked about service in other reviews surprised me) - perhaps something was lost in translation as later she received a box of chocolates which was a nice thing to do. The only things that really didn't make it excellent was that my room was opposite the main cleaning station cupboard so things were fairly noisy once housekeeping started so a restful lie-in wasn't on the cards. The shower in the bath also suffered from very low pressure at the peak 8.30am time making it cold and unusable. Outside of peak, it was fine and all other amenities were great - especially the free (and good!) wi-fi. In summary, you will definitely have a nice stay at the Preciados and it's a great place to start a Madrid break.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Don't hesitate.”
Reviews.Author: Travelleraroundthewo
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Amazing real Madrid location. Great walking to the heard of old Madrid. Excellent rooms. You will not go wrong. Near puerto del sol. Demonstrations while we were there but all was peaceful and even reminded me how lucky most of us are to be able to protest, vote, etc. Book this hotel and you won't be dissapointed. In fact you will be happy you did. Also Madrid is a great city. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: foody1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I got much more than I expected given the reasonable rate. It is in the middle of everything and a great starting point to walk the entire city. About 15 minute walk to the royal place, 10 minutes to plaza major, 20 minutes to the prado. The area is busy and crowded until very late at night, but the windows have FOUR panes of glass and you hear absolutely nothing in your room. You also get free Wifi and free minibar. I was a little hesitant at first because I read that the area directly north of Gran Via (two block from hotel) is the red light district and can be sketchy, but everything turned out fine. The street was very busy and i felt very safe in all hours of the day. I would stay here again on my next trip to Madrid. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast in Spain”
Reviews.Author: Bonnyj
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, good location, but a couple of blocks from the Puerta De Sol. Beds were very comfortable. Minibar refreshed daily with beer, water, soda and drinks. There was room to keep a little sandwich or snacks in which was very handy. Staff was very warm and friendly. Everyone spoke very good English. Our room was small, the design is minimalist, so there is not a lot of warmth or decor to the room. There are rolladen type shutters on the windows plus double paned windows to keep out any noise or light. Great high speed internet access and printer available to print boarding passes. The highlight was the buffet breakfast! Freshly squeezed oj, great coffee, eggs, ham, sandwiches, dessert, fresh fruit, enough that it could be a "brunch" as it was served from 7 - 11 am. Everything was delicious. There is also outdoor seating for the restaurant, There are many good , inexpensive restaurants right outside the hotel on a pedestrian street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dennis040
Reviews.Content: Great location. Room could be more comfy n cosy. A little bare. But complimentary mini bar is great. Overall, value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet yet so convenient”
Reviews.Author: roangirl
Reviews.Content: Very convenient central location, yet close to shops, metro etc. Spotlessly clean, sound proofed room. We had a loft room with a little terrace overlooking the roof tops, even with the door open at night you could not hear the traffic. Free mini bar in room - excellent value. Only problem with being high up the wi fi signal was very low. Had to use our laptop downstairs. Helpful staff speaking good English. Room not very big but comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel--highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Blus7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Madrid. Picked to stay at Preciados due to the Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed at all. First, and frankly, foremost, they allowed us to check in at 8am. Let me repeat that, we were checked in and in our room within 10 minutes of arriving at the hotel, when the check in time is 12pm. Honestly, that alone made me love this hotel. Here's the rest: impeccably clean, great looking rooms; fantastic shower; free minibar AND wi-fi, hello?!; great restaurants with good food that isn't a total rip off; very friendly staff. In terms of the location, it's great in that it's very centrally located. However, it's not the nicest in Madrid. The area around the Prado where a lot of the fancy hotels are, like the Westin Palace, would definitely be my top choice. However, you're really getting an amazing deal with Preciados. I highly recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: LeChat123
Reviews.Content: This is a great value. A surprisingly excellent hotel that attends to details (electric blinds that close all the way, free mini bar, wonderful beds, quiet, extremely clean, all the ammenities you might want/need, laundry, great breakfast buffet, etc.) 2 quibbles: though there was WiFi, it did not support Skype, and the shower was slippery to the point of being a potential hazard. Everything considered, a stellar experience. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Markate
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Easter weekend for our daughter's 21st birthday and had a fantastic time. The hotel is ideally placed for all the sights and we walked most of the time, only using the metro to go further afield. We had superior rooms which were plenty big enough. Bathrooms were very large and all spotlessly clean. Beds were comfy and the double doors to the balcony blocked any street noise. Although the breakfast seems expensive it is well worth it. Huge choice and all very fresh. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and booked a flamenco show for us at Casa Patas which was amazing. We got the metro in from the airport and found it easy to use. It took approx 40 minutes with two changes and only 1 euro each (2 euro's on the way back). Be aware of pick pockets though. If a man on the platform hadn't banged on the window and shouted we might have been caught out. We would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Elgranpoobah
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of March/beginning of April 2011. I have a very hard time sleeping and it's of utmost importance to me that my room be very quiet and dark so that I can sleep. I had an inside room and it was so quiet you could hear a pin drop. No noise, from inside or outside of the hotel. It was also perfectly dark (and also quiet) due to the automatic outside shutters. Since it was an inside room facing the interior of the hotel, I had absolutely no view, but I would gladly sacrifice that for a good night's sleep while travelling. The bed was very comfortable, the room spotless and modern. Very nice, modern bathroom. The location was ideal. It was within a few minutes' walk of everything I wanted to do. Calle Preciados and several other nearby streets are mainly pedestrian except for, apparently, morning deliveries. As a single woman traveling alone, I felt safe walking day and night and loved the location of the hotel. The service was excellent. If you can believe it, when I needed to go to the bank the manager had one of the staff members accompany me to show me the way. From now on I won't stay anywhere else on my annual trips to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Matchless in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MaggieWags
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel...everything is very modern and very, very clean. The staff is very helpful and made reservations for our tour to Toledo. The breakfast which was extra is great value, with hot and cold dishes, lots of fruit and great pastries. It is very central and we walked everywhere, but still very quiet at night. I would certainly highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Excellent rating on all factors.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: davidandelaineburn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel with friends. The rooms were well equipped, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is ideally located for seeing all of the main sights in Madrid. Would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cm8dj6
Reviews.Content: My sister, niece and I stayed in one of the superior suites for 5 nights. The king size bed was great for us & the extra room had a fold out couch made up for our adult niece. It worked out great! Room had 2 TV's, one bath, small desk, automatic black out curtains (was very quiet), freee safe, small stocked fridge, bidet, shower, separate bathtub w/shower & 2 sinks). Hotel was very close to all the sights we wanted to see. Breakfast buffet was expensive (about 15 euros), but was very extensive & delicious and the only thing open for an early decent breakfast. We used it 4 out of 5 mornings. Wifi was free & fast & 2 computers downstairs with printer (couldn't get to print though). Staff was wonderful. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Simmrouter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Preciados for three (3) nights during our recent trip around Spain. The location of the hotel is excellent as was the service, buffet breakfast and the rooms. We enjoyed this hotel so much that we returned for our final night before departing back home to the USA! I would highly recommend this hotel to both business and leisure travelers. It is centrally located with many fine restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: finalflash
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early april, after reading the other reveiws on tripadvisor booked this for 3 nights. The reveiws on this site are well justified as the hotel is excellent with friendly english speaking staff, roons that are both very well equipped, modern and clean and a very quiet room given the noise and bedlam that is madrid by night.
