Twin double glazed doors are to thank for the peace and quiet. The location is fantastic next to the puerta del sol and calle grand villa. It is also in walking distance from plaza major and the palace. Hotel is in a perfect location to see all of what madid has to offer. Only small negative was the wifi signal strength in my room, a small thing really but it was strange since in the hall outside the room the signal was perfect inside was quite weak, maybe something to do with the walls and keeping noise levels down which is never a bad thing. Overall excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tourist039
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find, very close to metro Santo Domingo. It's in the city center so very close to the gran via and more. It's a very safe neighbourhood. The room is very clean and has enough space. The bathroom was also very clean which I find very important. It has a bath tub and usually I find the tubs in some hotels a little bit dirty but this one is clean. The mini bar was free, very nice. Free wifi. The only minor issue is that the airconditioning does not seem to really cool the room. I can imagine that the room would be very hot in the summer. but that´s the only con.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, would gladly stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: tobyo99
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed for 4 nights last month and would recommend it highly. The very friendly staff speak English but didn’t mind speaking Spanish with me. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfy and I loved the free wifi too. The location is great and is only a few minutes to the nearest metro stop. But as others have said, you could walk basically anywhere you’d want to go. We had really only one issue and that was that we could not use the international calling card (bought at a kiosk in Sol for 5 euros) from our room. And it was a bit frustrating finding a phone we could use. We discovered that there was a public phone in the basement of the hotel, alas, it was not working. That would have been perfect as it was nice and quiet down there. We did not eat at the restaurant but the food smelled delicious whenever we walked by. I’d gladly stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but disappinted by hotel bedroom”
Reviews.Author: leopold25
Reviews.Content: Free wifi works as I am reviewing this after 2 of our 4 nights! Such a good location but terrible street noise throughout the night. Delivery and refuse trucks right outside. The hotel has no public space just a sofa in the lobby and then you get the lift to your bedroom whic is fine for a city hotel where space is at a premium providing the bedroom is satisfactory. Ours is not. It is so small and despite 2 windows there is little natural light as it faces another building. It is sunny out there but I have to use a fluorescent light to read. The bedroom makes me feel claustrophobic but there's nowhere else in the hotel to go to relax and read. Not sure where the photos on the website are from but there's no indication of any lounge or outside balcony space.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Madrid”
Reviews.Author: CincyJoe95
Reviews.Content: Hotel Preciados is a clean and modern hotel very close to the Gran Via and Plaza de Espana. It's in a good location for walking to all of the major attractions in central Madrid. Our service was outstanding. One tip--if you are driving, and especially if this is your first stop after a long plane flight, be sure you have exact directions to the hotel. Better yet, consider hiring and following a cab from the airport to avoid getting lost. We spent too much time circling the area and finally ended up driving on the pedestrian plaza to get to the hotel. Once we got our bearings, it's relatively easy to find, but it's not obvious the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: adajos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Preciados for two nights. The rooms were big, modern, very clean and we slept very well there. The staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful. We did not try the breakfast as it was not included and seemed a bit overpriced to us. The location is quite good, it's a 5-10 minute walk to Plaza Mayor and the Royal Palace--and really you can walk to any of the major sights that Madrid offers. It's on a very clean, safe street--that said, if you stray a few blocks east or north after say 10 or 11PM you definitely end up running into a bunch of young (legal, from what I've heard) prostitutes--they did not seem aggressive to me, but then again, I was walking with my wife :) Even there, it did not feel unsaf, just giving a fair bit of warning. I would certainly stay at Hotel Preciados again, it is very obvious why it's such a highly rated hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: kathyKnoxville
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great--service, restaurant, and room. We got 40% off because we stayed 6 nights, so we upgraded to a jr suite. It was lovely with a king size bed, a seperate living room, and big bathroom with double sinks, stall shower and jacuzzi tub. The location is excellent, within easy walking distance of all major sites and really close to both Callao and Sol metro stops. (Sol is really useful since many lines converge there.) Preciados has a wonderful buffet breakfast which is expensive, but worth the price. Room service was excellent as well. It was good and very fast. Also, the mini bar in the room was well stocked and FREE!

Reviews.Title: “As expected from the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: Tess026
Reviews.Content: The staff were charming and helpful. The room was relatively small but more than adequate, with a comfortable bed and all the facilities you would expect - except a kettle . The complimentary soft drinks in the room were much appreciated. The bathroom was clean and pleasant to use. The double glazing onto the street worked well, it's a shame the internal soundproofing wasn't quite as good. I'm not too sure about the location, I didn't get to know Madrid well enough to know if this was the best area to stay. As for being close to El Corte Ingles, how dull is that. Think Debenhams and House of Fraser rather than Selfridges, Liberty and Harvey Nicks. Why is that such a big sell ? The Breakfast buffet was good, but it's easy to find somewhere outside the hotel for coffee and pastries. The dinner menu was pretty dull and expensive however. Ten winning ways with hake is not my idea of fun. I'd definitely stay here again, though I'd take some persuading to eat dinner in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, comfortable, well-situated”
Reviews.Author: JackSD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Preciados for four nights for a business meeting, and it turned out to be an excellent choice: The rooms are attractive and well-furnished, with a sleek, fashionable air; the hotel staff is immediately responsive; and the location of the hotel -- just off the Gran Via, a few blocks from two major locations of El Cortes Ingles, and sitting on the edge of the historic heart of Madrid's old city -- could hardly be better. There were only two drawbacks: while the breakfast buffet in the hotel's restaurant is very good, the food at other times is only average, easily surpassed by the many interesting restaurants and cafes in the neighborhood around the Teatro Real just a few blocks south. And the staff, while instantly efficient at all times, is slightly impersonal. It's running the establishment with great competence but also with a somewhat restrained air. However, all in all, I wouldn't hesitate to return. (One tip: the junior suites and rooms facing the plaza Santo Domingo and the Calle de Veneras get some minor traffic and early-morning noise; rooms facing the pedestrian-only Calle de Preciados may be quieter.)

Reviews.Title: “Prestige Suite - EXCELLET!!!”
Reviews.Author: beanersts
Reviews.Content: For a little over 200 Euros my wife and I stay in room 622 the Prestige Suite which is the only room on that floor. The deck was awesome and big, only wished it was a little warmer the last day to enjoy it more, very romantic. The bed was comfy and roomy with an adjacent living room with its own TV. The bathroom was the best part and the shampoos and other toiletries with bathrobes and slippers was a nice touch. Did not eat at the hotel, but there is a Starbucks just up the block. There are two metro stops on different lines about a 1min walk to one and about a 3 min walk to the other. If you have large luggage do not take the metro. There are no escalators only stairs down to the metro. Taxi is about 30 to 35 Euros to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Great location and exactly what was expected”
Reviews.Author: RobYoung
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in Madrid at the beginning of March. First of all it is very easy to get to from the airport, dont waste your money on taxis, the Metro is clean and easy to use. It's 2 changes to the hotel and takes approx. 45 mins but for only €2 it pefect unless you have particularly heavy luggage. We arrived early and luckily our room was ready for us, so we could check in immediately. The Receptionist was extremely helpful, giving us a map of the city and pointing out where all the attractions were as well as the best places to go for Tapas!! Great service! Rooms were clean and modern, not particularly big but fine for us. We were on the 1st floor so close to the street, but with the triple glazed windows closed, sleep was completely undisturbed. The hotel is in a very good location, just around the corner from Gran Via and the majority of Madrids attractions are within walking distance (if you're feeling tired the Metro is only €1 per trip!) with Palace being just 5 minutes away! All in all a great stay and would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aoife28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute pleasure to stay in. From the moment we checked in it was hassle free. We had a superior double room with a terrace facing out onto a quiet street. The room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable . The bath tub with the hydromassage feature was amazing . I also love the fact there is free wi Fi throughout hotel . Big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, centrally located hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jinty74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in March and found the hotel excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were a good size and cleaned every day and the location is fantastic - close to Gran Via, Calle Mayor, La Latina and walking distance to most other places. Despite its location, it's on a quieter street, so there was no problem with noise. My only suggestion would be it would be nice to have a hotel bar, to relax with a vino or two after investigating the lovely city, but there's plenty nearby. Definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Roof Deck”
Reviews.Author: Lucyc9092
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met our daughter, who is studying abroad, in Madrid for a few days and booked the Prestige Suite for a little more than 200 euros a night. We had the bedroom while she slept on the pull-out couch in the living area. The room was pleasant but the bathroom was luxurious and the roof deck was wonderful. We bought wine and cheese and bread at the Corte de Ingles and enjoyed happy hours outside while watching the sun set.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: RobinGM
Reviews.Content: As a hotelier myself I can only say that this was the most wonderful experience. I would like to thank all the management and staff of this lovely hotel for the excellent time we had staying at their hotel. The rooms are comfortable, clean and very nicely decorated as are the bathrooms. The hotel is very centrally located and we had the an amazing time just walking around the area visiting the Royal Palace, shopping in all the boutiques and eating in excellent restaurants. Well done and we look foward to seeing you again soon. Gracias para todos.

Reviews.Title: “TA comes through!”
Reviews.Author: Miran_Ali
Reviews.Content: For once I have to agree with a TA top rated hotel. I was there for two nights. I had a room with a small balcony and a massive bathroom. The bathroom had two sinks, a bathtub with a jacuzzi and was excellent. The room's a little small but fine for one or two persons. It'd be unreasonable to expect anything bigger at this price in central Madrid. The location is fantastic. The hotel staff were excellent. They really care about TA reviews, btw. There are screens all over the place showing their ratings. I encountered two lots of front desk staff. Oddly the fellow on evening duty was excellent while I didn't really care for the lady on the morning shift, similarly of the three bell boys, two were excellent and one was an idiot. The mini-bar is stocked with juices and non-alcoholic beers and is a welcome complimentary addition but much more important is the free wifi. The housekeeping is okaaay.... I had a t-shirt lying in the bathroom and it wasn't hung up. Two odd omissions, no tissues in the bathroom and no hot water kettle. But the quality of the rooms and the location trump all these small issues. I will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: max29
Reviews.Content: Second time staying here and the standards have definitely slipped. Was given a street side room which let in noise despite all the sound proofing. Night reception guy is extremely unfriendly, very cold individual as pointed out by others. Having said that the guy on reception on our last night was quite friendly and the day staff seemed fine. The first room was quite nice but the noise meant that we had to move at 8am next morning. Moved to a much quieter internal room but the decor of the room was poor. The bathroom door was warped and you had to heave it opened and closed and all damp stains all over the bedroom ceiling (i took a video of it but its too large to upload to this site) The hotel is in a very good location but is expensive for the rate. Also, even the basic things don't seem to be attended to like not having a bottle opener in the mini bar (had to ask for one at reception) the safe was locked when we arrived in the room (again onto reception) Id probably try somewhere else next time im in Madrid. Its a 4 star hotel grade - I wouldn't rate it more than 3. About €45 to the airport - if you're not in a hurry i recommend the metro or aerocity taxi (€27)

Reviews.Title: “Proudly displayed and deserved their TripAdvisor rating”
Reviews.Author: EUHawkeye
Reviews.Content: My family had a great stay at the Preciados for a weekend holiday. Almost every aspect of our stay met our expecations and were consistent with all the TripAdvisor reviews. The front desk visibly showed the TripAdvisor endorsement of a 4 1/2 rating and deserved the high marks. We had a junior suite for 2 adults and 2 small children. Rooms were very clean, nicely appointed, had 2 TVs and an exercise bike! The sleep quality is good with nice beds and double windows/doors to the picturesque balconies overlooking the pedestrian Calle de Preciados. When you hear about the sound-proof rooms, the windows aren't just double pane, there are literally 2 separate window/door frames! It couldn't handle the noise of the most rowdy of drunkards outside, but adequately handled the traffic and general noise and was a nice feature. The additional fold-out bed for the children isn't for adults, but perfect for kids which are happy to be in a hotel and aren't concerned with the comfort. The bathroom was very spacious, with a separate shower and bathtub, 2 sinks and toilet/bidet. The staff was friendly and helpful and attentive. They provided recommendations for restaurants, highlighting maps of attractions and asking if we needed a taxi upon departure. The door man happily greeted us every trip in and out of the building. Location is great for walking and touring, very close to Gran Via and near the Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. It's a hike to the Prado and Parque de Retiro, but we made it easily with kids in strollers and enjoyed the cityscape and unique buildings on the way. The free mini-bar is a nice touch, but don't expect it to be overstocked - i.e. one beer, one coca cola, one juice, 2 waters, etc. Breakfast is not included in the room charge, but the on-site offering was very nice and worth the price. The restuarant staff managed the offering well and kept everything plentiful and in order. A couple words of advice, not about the hotel, but in general. The Old Town is quite dense and tour book maps WILL NOT suffice. Get your map at the TI or the hotel for a very detailed street map. Also, if you take a taxi from the airport, be sure to ask for the Plaza Santo Domingo! Our driver dropped us at the Puerta del Sol (since calle Preciados is technically pedestrian). It's a haul from the far end of the calle Preciados with luggage and children in tow and even more challenging without an adequate map. Taxis can pull up directly to the hotel door from the adjacent Plaza Santo Domingo. Excellent stay, recommend the hotel, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great in great location !”
Reviews.Author: btcarroll
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights from the 21st February, in a superior double which was clean, well equipped and had a small balcony which we appreciated. The free WiFi and mini bar are a nice touch not found in all hotels. The bathroom was bright, airy and well stocked. The location is excellent, only metres from two Metro stations on a pedestrian street two minutes from Grand Via, easy walking distance to Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor, Cathedral and Prado Museum. We found all staff to be courteous and pleasant. The reception staff were particularly efficient and helpful. We availed of the Romantic Package which was good value and the meal was excellent. We have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our stay in Madrid - the Preciados”
Reviews.Author: KazzaLou
Reviews.Content: I picked the Preciados pretty much on the strength of the reviews on this site and was not disappointed. I booked a junior suite which was a lovely room. The room was very well equipped and the free mini bar (water, juices, colas, beer etc) is a great touch (why don't all hotels do this?) I found the staff on reception very helpful. As soon as our taxi pulled up outside when we arrived our suitcase was taken in. We had a small problem with our safe in our room which was readily fixed by someone who came up to our room very promptly. When we checked out of our room the reception staff were very helpful and organised our taxi back to the airport that evening and looked after our bags whilst we made the most of our day in Madrid. Breakfast was fine (smallest problem in that nothing resembling English breakfast tea!).....great choice of food and friendly staff. The hotel itself is quiet given its very central location in Madrid. On our first evening when we left to go out in the evening we were totally oblivious to the fact that it was hammering down with rain....just didn't hear it at all. The Preciados is a lovely hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Preciados tops for location & service!!!”
Reviews.Author: JimLag
Reviews.Content: The location puts you in walking distance to almost every tourist & shopping site in Madrid. The free in room wi-fi and beverages are a nice touch. Our rate included breakfast which had a nice varriety of food and was very tasty as well. The front desk and bell man service were fantastic and attentive to all of our needs. In fact one night the bellman walked us (4 blocks in a rain storm) to our Flamenco dinner & dance show because he was concerned that we may not find it on our own. I have stayed at 4 and 5 star hotels around the world and have never received that kind of treatment from a bellman. It was a four star hotel with five star service and location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city, boutique hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: KRC2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights, with another couple. Our rooms (superior doubles) were spacious, plenty of light, and the large bathrooms were enhanced by a skylight, and a hydromassage bath. Front desk staff were courteous, english-speaking, helpful and kind when one of us was sick. The hotel was an easy walk to Calleo metro station, and to Sol and Plaza Major. The terrace was tiny, but in good weather would have been pleasant, and french doors could be left open if fresh air was required. Our view was only of other buildings, but we had no street noise and slept well (excellent kingsize bed and linens). Bedside lights included an LED reading light - this displayed the thought that has gone into making this hotel comfortable. Our friends´room overlooked the street and was noisier on friday night (but maybe a slightly better room). Computers/printer available, and free wifi throughout the hotel. The lobby was big enough/had enough seating, to rendezvous - but is not a big, Marriott-style lobby. The buffet breakfast was to American 5star standard. Restaurants and cafes in the area are in abundance. Like most hotels in France and Spain, there was no kettle/tea tray in the room - if you have space for a travel kettle, it´s worth taking. We drove there, and had requested a parking space when we booked - probably not a bad idea for when the season becomes busy. If you drive, make sure you have GPS, a good streetmap and GoogleMaps directions to get there - a first time visit to Madrid in traffic, and with its one-way system, is a bit daunting. Once there, we left the car in the garage for the duration of our stay (we did not feel that 18euros/day parking charge was high given this is Spain´s capital, and space in the innercity is at a premium). If you like boutique hotels within a city - such as the Old Bank Hotel, Oxford, UK - you will like this hotel, and we found its location to be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A good quaity hotel in a perfect location - ticked all the boxes for us.”
Reviews.Author: mariposa05
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean hotel right in the centre of Madrid and travel to and fro the hotel is easy, thanks to the Metro just a few yards away. In fact, we made hardly any use of it, as we found it nicer to explore the city on foot (other than out visit to Bernabau Stadium which was a bit too far). Breakfast was plentiful - lots of healthy (and not so healthy choices!) - a range of fresh and delicious pastries, fresh fruit, meats, cheese, cereal, yoghurts, hot breakfast, a good choice of quality bread etc. The room was immaculate, not that spacious but big enough to relax for a few hours before going to bed. The beds were just a dream - extremely comfortable, the best I have ever slept in...and no street noise whatsoever! The free mini bar was a nice addition - a few bottles of water, juice and beers. Tip: the El Corte Ingles supermarket (basement) is great for buying snacks. In addition, the famous Valor cafe is just around the corner if you want to try chocolate con churros. This hotel is a safe choice in what is a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KELor
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for six nights in January. I found the front desk to be very helpful- they changed our room immediately when I was not happy with the first one (very minor problem). We loved the breakfast- yes it is 15 Euro, but they had an amazing and delicious selection of breakfast foods, and we were not hungry for hours. I found the entire city to be rather formal and cold, I think this is just the way Madrid is- but we had absolutely no problems. We ate several times at the large department store Il Corte Inglese-(top floor) which is only minutes away. Also be sure to have hot chocolate and churros at Valor which is very close as well. One night when the weather was awful, we had room service- it was more than adequate. The free wi-fi and mini-bar were most appreciated. The hotel has a perfect location, immaculate rooms, was very quiet, and we both agreed that the bed was the most comfortable we had ever slept on! It was a perfect place to stay! Try to take a side trip to Toledo- it was our favorite part of the trip- the front desk was quite helpful with trains, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lbenshop
Reviews.Content: My family really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was perfect! The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated in a modern style. We also loved the breakfast at the hotel. It was a great way to start the day. It seems some people feel the front desk service is lacking and they are unfriendly. We had no problems at all and found them very accomodating. I found the staff, like most people in Madrid, quite reserved, which may come off to some as unfriendly. We did stay at another hotel in Madrid on the second leg of our trip and I was missing The Preciados. The only quibble I have was loud noise above us during our last night there. It sounded like construction, dropping pipes, etc. I was so tired that I feel asleep anyways, but other members of my family were not so lucky. That is why the sleep quality rating I gave is low.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: spazzymazzy
Reviews.Content: overall, this hotel was amazing!! Our trip consisted of going to Madrid for 3 night, then Seville for 4 nights, Granada for 2 nights, and then back to Madrid for another 2 nights. And out of all of the hotels, this hotel was the BEST. First of all, unlike other reviews say, the staff was extreamly helpful and nice. They were never rude or snippy. Our rooms were very nice. Besides the last night of our stay, when were heard loud clanking and banging noises from the floor above, we had no problems. We adored the fact that the mini-bar was free and it was refilled daily. It became a nightly thing that once we came back to our rooms, we would sit down, and have a coke and a siesta. Happy times! The maids were EXTREAMLY nice and would always give you a smile and a hello when ever you passed them in the hallways. The location is key. Either a 2 minute walk to the Gran Via (a very busy street) or a 2 minute walk to the quaint little side streets, which we found many adorable resturaunts. The breakfast was amazing, as well. The foods did not at all taste generic and seemed like traditional spanish breakfast foods. The staff was nice and so was the food! :) The wifi was free and fast! Our stay was beyond amazing, and I recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LTS1Bournemouth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, very close to all attractions and shops, all in walking distance. The room is well fitted and maintained, just a little on the small side, but very clean. Free wi-fi and free mini bar which is re-stocked everyday, a lovely touch! The reception staff were efficient but not particularly friendly, the chambermaids were much friendlier and in my opinion have a much harder job. The car park was very expensive. My recommendation would be not to hire a car in hindsight, I am a fan of having my independence on holiday but the traffic in this city is much worse than the likes of Paris, London, Cape Town etc. There is a buffet style restaurant opposite the hotel which was terrible - so avoid! I would recommend this hotel and had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: emakenshin
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights on the middle of December. it already cold but Icould enjoy the life in the room without heating due to double window. Also there were some X'mas events on and aroung Puerta de sol, where is very near to this hotel but did not care the noise. Room itself is not so big but compact. Personally I had huge trank so there is not enough place to open up it but no problem for visitor of a couple of days.Breakfast was fulfilling, more than I expected. Hotel staff is very kind regarding Taxi arrangement, advice of good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms, clean & new amenities”
Reviews.Author: rod1957
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel in great location. Only blemish is the high cost of meals, far cheaper meals either side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid's best choice for quality, service and location - a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Loredan01
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews we decided to book at the Hotel Preciados for our long weekend trip to Madrid and we lucked out big time; without doubt, Hotel Preciados is everything we expected and more and unless you have to stay at the Ritz there is no reason to consider any other hotel in Madrid. When visiting a city for the first time one isn’t quite sure where a hotel might be located to areas of interest, sights and restaurants but Preciados is right there for everything. About the hotel: check in was quick and efficient and we were given room 304 on the 3rd floor which looks over Calle Preciados, a semi-pedestrian street. Throughout our stay the reception desk staff were friendly and helpful. The room is large by European standards as is the bathroom. Bed was a good size with a selection of pillows and the room has plenty of storage space. Wi-Fi was free and quick and the room included a free mini-bar that included soft drinks and some beers – both the mini bar and the Wi-Fi can add to the cost of any hotel stay so both of these are very welcome and again, comes down to the thought that has gone in to making a guest feel welcome. The bathroom is a good size with a bath/shower, bidet and plenty of toiletries, hair dryer, etc.; lots of hot water and fantastic water pressure. Other nice touches included music from the in-room radio in the bathroom and LED reading lights by the bed. One point to note: by one of the sides of the bed are switches with up/down arrows that raise and lower external blinds which allows for a pitch black room. We travelled from the airport by Metro to the Callao stop as we only had carry-on luggage and wanted to experience the subway but I would recommend that anyone with heavy luggage take a taxi form the airport and get dropped off at the hotel – the trip by Metro required two changes and a few sets of up and down stairs which wouldn't be much fun with heavy suitcases. Apart from the trip from and to the airport we walked everywhere as the hotel is well situation for just about every major tourist site in central Madrid. We did not eat at the restaurant that is attached to the hotel but we did find a couple of local places of interest. Coming out of the hotel and turning right towards the open area with the Callao metro station, turn right again into a small street and you will come across Valor on your right which is a famous place to have chocolate and churros – there is sometimes a line but well worth the wait a good way to start your day. Just a few doors down from Valor on the right is a small local restaurant called Carpe Diem with welcoming staff and great tapas. Prices are about the same as all other tapas bars but we found their selection to be fresh and tasty – a good selection with a few beers came to about 50 euros for two (which was a full meal) which is about what we paid the previous day in another place that we had found to be disappointing. The next day we stopped by for a late lunch and took advantage of their 3 course 11 Euro menu which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small but well-appointed, clean & quiet room”
Reviews.Author: piegirl52
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 2 nights at Hotel Preciados and was quite pleased with my stay there. Location was excellent - could not ask for better. We could walk to tons of great things (including the awesome El Corte Ingles deprtment store - the supermarket in the basement is a terrific place to get well-priced gifts of wine, candy, cookies,etc.). The fantastic Madrid Metro--which is really easy & convenient--was a 2 minute walk. Although Madrid is very walkable, using the Metro helped save our tired feet a lot of extra steps and since we didn't have a lot of time, also helped us to see more by saving us time (*note: a 10-trip ticket is EU9.00 and can be shared!) Although the room was quite small (our cabin on the cruise we took was larger!) it was super-clean and very well-appointed with plenty of places for our things, and had a great shower. Double windows meant it was very quiet (and we were on the 2nd floor), and the very comfortable bed & pillows meant a good nights sleep. I would have liked to have a more comfy chair to sit in, but that is a minor point. Ana at the front desk (late afternoon/evenings) was very nice & helpful, sending us to La Latina area for dinner where we found tons a cute restaurants to choose from. Overall we were very pleased with Hotel Preciados and I would definitely stay there again on a future visit to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Annie123081
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor are within a 5 minute walk,, Royal Palace maybe 10 minutes and the musuem area is about 15-20 minutes or a short metro ride. There are tons of restaurants within a few minutes walk. There is a department store a 2 minute walk away with wines, beer and food in the basement level for drinks or snacks in the room. The free mini bar was also a plus with water and 1 beer and several fruit juices that was refreshed daily. Several metro stations are also very close including Del Sol which will take you directly to the train station in about 10 minutes. Very convenient if you are leaving Madrid by train as we were. The room is upscale with plenty of room to unpack your clothes. Bathroom was nice. The best thing though has to be the double paned windows with the blackout screen. We didn't hear one sound in that room - the only one in Spain that we stayed at with that feature. Our only complaint was that there was only one English speaking channel on the TV whereas our hotel in Barcelona had 5. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel so have no comments on that. A couple of comments not related to the hotel that might help some people save money. If you want to take the metro from the airport it is pretty simple even with 3 stops - however you don't want to do this if you and your traveling companion cannot pick up your luggage and take it up and down escalators and more important stairs as there are quite a few along the way. If you can walk 20 minutes don't waste your money on the hop on hop off bus. The commentary is rudimentary and actually was interrupted every few minutes by the bus driver yelling out the next stop on the intercom. Also, the Cultura card was handy for the priority line to get into the museum but it is very pricey so unless you are planning on seeing more than the basic 3 museums - Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia and aren't going during high season don't waste your money on this one either. Last, we took a tour with Julia tours - L'Escorial and Toledo in one day - 11 hours (website says 7) and half of that was in the bus or a pretty basic (being nice here) lunch in Toledo. Save your money and take the train to Toledo and sightsee on your own. Last, very few people speak Spanish in Madrid - or at least they don't like to so brush up on your Spanish before you go and ask at restaurants if they have an English menu because they won't always offer one up even after they realize you don't speak Spanish well. This was probably our most disappointing part of the trip - other than the food. We really expected the servers and shop personnel to be friendlier than they were - and we aren't ugly Americans - we did run across a few. The hotel staff was very nice and we found that all across Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ocala123
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at this hotel. We traveled all over Spain and this was my favorite hotel. The location was just perfect. You could walk to almost everything. Metro was only a few steps away. It is also so quite for a great nights sleep. The room was perfect. The staff was very nice. Always greet you with a big smile. I will always stay here when I return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very good with some shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Egyptiote
Reviews.Content: Though not as excellent as one would have imagined, judging by the very high ranking in TripAdvisor, we are very happy with your choice of the Preciados Hotel. We stayed five nights in Room 312. I'll state what disappointed us first: The ventilation in the bathroom was not satisfactory, taking way too long for the air to clear up (we had to open the balcony doors for this). The wall-mounted swivel mirror in the bathroom was so rickety I had to tighten the screws in all joints to be able to use it. The one available seat, an armchair, was past its prime (the seat would sink really deep when one sat on it and you could feel the wood frame press against the back of your legs -- not comfortable). A change of fabric was also in order. The fabric-lined inside of the "sous-main" was stained from a sort of liquid. The sheets were changed only on the fifth night, after I placed them on the floor (perhaps they were due to be changed anyway? We'll never know) The good points: Though with minimal space on each side of the twin beds, Rm 312 was roomy enough in all other areas. Overlooking the pedestrian and not noisy Preciados street, it also had double glazing -- so it was very quiet. Spacious double wardrobe, good mattresses (on the hard side, which I prefer), choice of pillows and a focusing personal reading light, aside from the standard sconce near the headboard. Black-out double curtains. A long, deep shelf-desk that gave us ample room to place our travel papers, guides, buys, personal stuff. Breakfast was fantastic: aside from the usual corn and bran flakes, breads, croissants, butter, cheese, marmalade selections, we had wonderful freshly baked cakes including the almond Torta de Santiago and baked cheesecake, creme caramellee, panacotta, rice pudding, creme anglaise... Plus jamon, little tuna sanwiches, egg tostadas, a variety of fruit pieces and more. Cannot praise it enough.The staff was friendly and spoke passable English, computers with internet connection were available for free and we were not charged for the minibar. The location is excellent, right in the center of the city, minutes away from metro and bus stations, the lively Gran Via and Arenal streets, as well as the historic central plazas and neighbourhoods. It is also surrounded by eateries of all kinds. Because of its very high ranking by other travellers, the minuses I described in the beginning were unexpected and a letdown. However we would return to the Preciados because its advantages outweigh the weak points.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Bathtrip
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent - lots of shops and restaurants and the attractions, etc, within easy walking distance. Reception friendly and helpful, room modern and extremely chic - we had a double balcony which was brilliant for looking out over the rooftops. Excellent breakfast (too much to choose from!!). Highly highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and efficient; great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Famiilytrav
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October. The hotel is well located-between 2 Metro stops, although I only took the Metro once because Madrid is a very walkable city. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large and had the usual amenities. Hotel staff was helpful with directions and the breakfasts were excellent. All in all a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a cold atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: midiminuit
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel and very clean. Not too far from tourism attractions. A bit far from restaurants if you want to walk. The rooms are very clean (I took a single room). There is everything you need in the rooms and the facilities are modern. My room had a balcony with nice chairs to enjoy the sun. Excellent place to stay for visiting Madrid. Close to metro stations. There is also a restaurant at the hotel. The breakfast is ok but dinner might be improved. They seem to do good drinks (excellent Irish Coffee). Free Internet. People speaks English but they prefer speaking Spanish. People at the reception are not always happy to provide directions for tourisms and they are not always very good. I almost missed the visit of the Madrid Park and this is one of the best attraction of Madrid. But overall, this is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: april1810
Reviews.Content: We arrived before our scheduled check-in time and the reception staff still managed to accomodate us (considering we had just flown 20hours, that was really appreciated!!!) The location of the hotel was fantastic as it is walking distance to most attractions and also the metro station is about 2mins walk from the hotel!! ( Callao station) There are places to eat and the centre of the city (puerta del sol) is about 10mins stroll from the hotel.. The rooms are clean and secure and the staff are friendly, informative and very helpful!!From busboys, porters and the reception staff, all of them went out of their way to provide valuable advice and service throughout our stay ( day and night)... we even got champagne and chocolates sent up to our rooms when we arrived! The only negative would be the only morning that we had breakfast at the hotel restaurant as the service there was less than friendly...we would suggest eating at one of the many cafes and restaurants surrounding the hotel for breakfast at half the price.We would definitely recommend this hotel for anybody travelling to madrid

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Situated, great room, good staff and fab breakfasts !”
Reviews.Author: ElPozo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Preciados for three nights as part of my ongoing 50th birthday celebrations. Booked by my wife as a surprise the trip was originally centered around a meal at Dassa Bassa and I was apprehensive about the hotel as my wife has a mixed record with hotel choices. My fears soon disappeared as the hotel turned out trumps on all fronts. Checking in was seamless, the roomoverlooking the pedestrianised street to the front was a decent size, nicely furnished and spotlessly clean. The free minibar was a nice touch for a small beer and a glass of orange in the morning and the quality and choice of the breakfast buffy was tremendous. the location could not have been better just 100m of the Gran Via and the metro and a number of local bars and great cafes right on your doorstep. The tapas was fantastic with a good variety with every drink. Please do not worry about reports about noise or light from outside as I doubt if the previous guests realised that there are electric shutters to the windows which completely blank out light and sound. These are operated by a switch next to the wall lights and could be missed by those unfamiliar with them especially as they dont get a mention by staff or the room literature. A great hotel and one we return to when next in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesJD
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, rooms reasonable for a city centre hotel, not all that large but comfortable. Close to all the main city centre attractions and surrounded by resturants of all types. Free WiFi and mini bar along with a payable breakfast with excellent selctions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the Heart of Old Madrid”
Reviews.Author: KenBarry
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in the Suite top floor. Fantastic room and views. Beautiful terrace. Definitely would book this again when visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Old Madrid - In The Centre of It All”
Reviews.Author: Sobee
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel Preciados in the Privilege Suite for 4 nights in September 2010. Check-in was easy and efficient and all the staff spoke English. Our suite was located on the top floor with a private terrace with 270 degree view overlooking the rooftops, squares and streets of Old Madrid. In the suite, there were two TVs, one in the sitting room (which also included an exercise bike), and the other in the bedroom area. The suite had lots of storage space, safe, refrigerator, private elevator and large bathroom with separate shower and tub. The hotel was within easy walking distance of two metro stations, Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real, other tourist attractions and the three main streets: Gran Via, Calle Mayor and Calle Arenal. There were many restaurants nearby and we felt very safe all the time. We would stay here again. We took a couple of day trips outside of Madrid: 1) Segovia/Ávila: Options were that you could book directly at reception (which we chose) or you could walk a few minutes to the travel agency at Plaza Domingo. 2) Toledo: We did this ourselves by taking the metro from Plaza Domingo to Atocha Station and took a fast train direct to Toledo.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK but not sure why so highly rated on Tripadviser”
Reviews.Author: SJMoore
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights here with my wife and six-year old daughter. I selected this hotel because it scored very highly on Tripadviser but we were quite disappointed. There was nothing really wrong with the hotel but apart from the location it was nothing special. Slightly old-fashioned, small room, no window, air-conditioning that just about functioned. Service was good but the restaurant was a bit plain and when we went there for a drink I got warmish beer and stale crisps. Overall it was fine but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid vibe”
Reviews.Author: SVtrav099
Reviews.Content: My partner and I summered in the heat for two weeks in Spain this August. We stayed at the Murmuri in Barcelona, Hotel Preciados in Madrid and the Hospes Palacio del Bailo in Cordoba. Our favourite was the Hospes Bailo, but in terms of value for money the Preciados clearly stands out. It was close to the Madrid vibe and in fact close to everything. Front desk could not have been more helpful, kind and welcoming. We would stay here again. While in Barcelona we had a moving experience of a Flamenco Opera at the Palau de la Musica Catalana. The place is definitely worth a concert visit. We loved it so much we went to the Moreira in Madrid. However after our previous experience, we understood why Frommer’s did not favor the Moreira with a star. Tapas at the Santa Anna plaza in Madrid had a wonderful atmosphere. Don’t miss the Dali Theatre Museum in Figures or Bodegas Campos when in Cordoba. They were fun.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bringing_the_kids
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Hotel Preciados, not only because the room was chic and spacious, but because of the fabulous treatment we received. When travelling with small kids it is not uncommon for staff at nice hotels to show their annoyance or make comments about the kids being noisy, but at this hotel we saw nothing but smiling faces. They put a beautiful little crib in our room, with embroidery on the sheets and a little baby toiletry kit! The location is fantastic, close to everything, and yet the noise from the busy street (no cars allowed) doesn't reach the rooms. We will definitely be staying there next time we visit Madrid. We won't be eating at the restaurant anymore though, the food tastes like it came from a can or a freezer...

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: katlondonuk
Reviews.Content: My partner took me for a surprise weekend in Madrid for our wedding anniversary, and we stayed at the Preciados. When we arrived the service was efficient. My partner was a little disappointed by the room, I think mostly because of high expectations from the great reviews on this site. He had paid extra for an outside space on the fifth floor, which did mean we had a balcony with a bit of a view of some rooftops, however the room itself was a little small (maybe because of the space taken by the balcony) and although very clean with a comfortable bed, was beginning to look just a little dated, and was a little dark. The bathroom was great and had a great shower with loads of hot water. The breakfast (not included in the price) was really good with plenty of choice (even for vegetarians!). The best thing about this hotel is its location, you can walk almost anywhere you would want to go and none of the major sights and galleries are more than fifteen minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “shame the air con wasn't working”
Reviews.Author: mogley71
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Madrid for a family wedding where we stayed at the Preciados for a week. My mum and dad stayed in a superior room which was lovely only small niggle was that the balcony was very small and didn't get the sun in the afternoon, the reason for superior room was so they could sit outside in the sun in the afternoon so this was disappointing however everything else in the room was perfect. My mum was most impressed with all the complimentary toiletries. Our room was a standard double and lovely unfortunately the air con wasn't working,we contacted the reception staff who sent up a repair man very promptly however he told us there was nothing wrong with the room (I did try and explain that the windows had been open all night hence the cool room). We were hopeful that it had been fixed however upon arriving back to the hotel that evening we discovered it most certainly was not fixed. We again contacted the reception staff who looked at their computer who told us it was 21 degrees in the room which was normal!!! They told us that we could not be moved that night as the hotel was full. After a very hot sticky night with very little sleep we again contacted the reception in the morning. We were moved very quickly into another room, but felt that they did not believe us as they again told us the temperature of the room dispite us again explaining that we only had achieved 18 degrees as again had slept with the window open (in the middle of Madrid this is not ideal). No apology was given and no help to move our stuff. We had 2 nights of very little sleep and an apology would have made a huge difference. The rest of our stay was excellent with good working air con. Depite this annoyance the hotel was beautiful the complimentary drinks in the room fridge was excellent as was the breakfast. We also loved the blackout blinds in the room. The reception staff let the hotel down, for example when we arrived to book in the receptionist answered the phone once he had started getting our details and spoke for approx 5-10 mins on the phone laughing and joking again no apology given. The doormen were all excellent and very keen to help pity the reception staff could not have shared their cheery disposition and helpful attitude. A smile goes a long way. All in all good hotel within walking distance to all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good price / location”
Reviews.Author: Waterfall84
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights in summer '09. Excelent location close to all amenities in central Madrid and tube station. Ancient restored building that gives some charm. Restaurant/cafe pretty pricey. Only minus is that at the service WC in the lobby (at the basement level), someone made poo outside (and when I mean outside, I mean everywhere!).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lovelyrita_mm
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this from Hotel Preciados right now, on their free wifi. We were very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It is a very short walk from the Callao Metro stop (which makes it easy to get to by subway from the airport) and the lobby is lovely. The rooms aren't large (this is the city, after all), but they aren't tiny either. The room is very comfortable, as is the bed. The hotel, despite being conveniently located in the central part of Madrid, is very quiet. There is an outdoor music concert going on up the street in Callao but we can't hear it at all in the room. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and there are tons of shops, restaurants, and ATMs nearby. Also, lots of tourist sites (the Prado, Royal Palace, etc) are just a short walk away. If I came back to Madrid, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SylvF
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel Preciados for 3 nights was just like being at home - comfortable queen bed with the bestest pillows, temperature controlled hot water in the shower with pressure, free drinks in the mini bar, free wifi - I and the BF really could of not asked for more! Our room was on level 2 which was right on Calle Preciados where we could open up the balcony doors and watch the street scene - it was great! Extra note: the windows are double glazed so you can't hear the street noise. The hotel is located within a thoroughfare which leads down to la puerta del sol, calle major, el corte ingles, tapas bars and so much more! I found that if you book directly with the hotel instead on the net, you may get a cheaper deal (i got 3 nights for 225 EURO).

Reviews.Title: “Good practical choice for downtown Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ElmParkRoyal
Reviews.Content: This elegant 19th century building is about 30 minutes from Madrid Baraja Airport, with a taxi fare of around 30E which includes a mandatory 5.50E airport supplement. Our taxi driver off the airport stand took a slightly scenic route which was irksome, but the cab booked by the hotel for our return was like a fixed-target missile and cost rather less. The Metro, though considerably cheaper, would have been fiddly with the changes required whilst dragging around the usual tourist luggage. The Preciados is set in a busy part of Downtown Madrid but slightly away from the main cut and thrust of the nearby Gran Via or Puerta del Sol (famous for the illuminated Tio Pepe sign). The entrance is just a doorway between a restaurant (which appears to be attached to the hotel) and an adjacent shop, and the road outside is pedestrianised at night but open for vehicles to unload during the day. The reception area is small but pleasant in a formal sort of way, and all the staff we met were diffident and helpful – and could speak English well. We had a junior suite on the fourth floor overlooking Plaza de Santo Domingo. The Hotel is shaped like a flat triangle i.e. pointed at the front, widening at the back. Our room was the “pointy bit” widening out into a bedroom in one half, and a lounge and bathroom in the other. The adequate bathroom was light-brown marble tiled throughout. There was a large separate shower stall with a sliding height adjuster for the shower head. A bit of water seepage prevailed but not much. The bath had a whirlpool facility and was fitted with a shower too. There was also a large double sink top with a full length/width mirror, and an impressive array of freebies and some very pretty botanical displays! The W.C and bidet were tucked at away at the end of the room, and all ceramics were of the mottled wipeable non-stain kind. Outside, our lounge area was comfortable, and had a sofa with a desk opposite on which sat a flat screen TV. The minibar under the desk had free drinks but worked on a basis of one small beer day and nothing much for ladies, other than soft drinks or fruit juices. Stocking with our own additions didn’t cause any problems though. There is no bar in the hotel, but there are plenty of street opportunities to refresh in all directions. Our bedroom also had a TV, plus an exercise bike (an all time first!) and a pair of odd human –sized coathangers – male and female!! The bed was big and comfortable with adequate pilows, and more available in the large adjacent closet if required. This closet was adjacent to one side of the bed, and had ample coathangers and drawer space, plus an easy to operate safe. The whole room was double – double – glazed and had automatic window shutters (look for the double-arrow buttons) for each aperture. Madrid’s a busy place but I heard nothing once our lights went out. All three areas were cleaned and serviced to a high standard everyday, and the air conditioning, circulating via the lounge area only, was easy to operate and relatively quiet. Breakfast was taken in the restaurant downstairs, and 15E per person seemed fair. It was a better spread than I’ve recently had elsewhere, with plenty of meat (including ham off the bone), cheeses, fruit, cereals, pastries (lots!), juice and coffee. It’s a bit cramped inside, so it’s best to get a table at the edge otherwise people constantly barge back and forth through the tables in the middle. Also smoking is permitted in one half of the room, so some perturbation occurred when a guy came in and lit up a fat cigar! Once you get out, the Metro is simple, cheap and easy to use. San Domingo Metro station is across the road and probably quieter than nearby Callao. It’s only 1E per single journey via a touch screen transaction that’s translated into English. Trains are quick and clean, and seemingly entirely full of madrilenos. Central Madrid seemed nowhere near as obviously multicultural as London, for example. The city is wonderful and well-maintained with fantastic architecture and some inspiring museums and gardens. There seemed to be police everywhere so safety is probably not too much of an issue. Be prepared for direct begging and hawking, however, and there are several examples of rough sleeping around the city. Eating and drinking is also easy here. There must be about a hundred places radiating out in all directions only a short distance from the Preciados. As mentioned previously, smoking is permitted in many bars and restaurants, and we also found meal quality and bit more rough and ready than most of other places we’ve been to, but the choice and quality is clearly endless. So, all in all, I was quite pleased with this hotel. I can understand all the positive reviews and the enjoyment of Madrid which most people seemed to share. So if you want a comfortable, quiet room in an understated establishment with excellent access to the city and its sights, then this might just be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel oasis tucked away from the big city”
Reviews.Author: tuckercal34
Reviews.Content: Hotel Preciados was a very nice place to stay. We stayed for 3 nights while in Madrid. You can easily walk to Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor in 5 minutes. We also walked to the Museo del Prado, the Palacio Real in about 30 minutes. Hotel staff is very accomodating and could speak English some. We were able to secure a late checkout on our last day. The rooms are spacious, modern and clean. The hotel looks onto a shopping area that does not allow through traffic, which is nice. There are many restaurants and bars within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good hotel, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Chrissie_MP
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 5 nights of our honeymoon in a superior room which was described as having one queen sized bed. On arrival we were disappointed to be given a room with two single beds pushed together. We were told all of the superior rooms were the same so decided to downgrade to a standard room so neither of us had to sleep in the dip. Also, the view from the 5th floor superior room was of a 5 foot wall so I would not recommend paying the extra. The room we had on the second floor was quiet (the hotel is in a pedestrianised area) and the air con was quiet and effective. There were only 3 English TV channels (one of which was not available), no pay per view or DVD availability, so not much in the way of in-house entertainment. Other minor complaints are the pillows are lumpy sponge and there was a street lamp outside our room (206) which meant it was permanently light, so neither of us slept very well, even though the bed was really comfortable. The location of the hotel was excellent, near to shops , metro and sights. The staff were helpful and spoke good English. The breakfast was very good with fresh juices, a wide selection of fruits, meats, cheeses, cereals and pastries (only hot food was eggs though) and self service teas and coffee. We also found the free Wifi useful. Overall we had a good stay in Madrid, but were disappointed the room was not as described.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Coops14
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor. All the positive reviews are spot on. The hotel is in a great location making it very easy to see the city on foot or by metro if you prefer. There are metro stations very close by. There are a large range of restaurants/cafes close by, which we used daily.The Grand Via is two minutes walk. The pedestrian shopping street is tjust outside the hotel. We liked the San Miguel Market, a good supply of fresh fruit, meats,fish and our favourite stall - cakes! This was near Plaza Mayor, another favourite, we found a great cafes there. We booked a standard room and we were very happy with it. The air conditioning was great as it was 36 degrees outside the day we arrived. The free mini bar is a good touch too, this contained beer, fruit juice and fizzy drinks which were restocked every day. The room was very clean and very quiet, we could not hear any noise once inside our room. The shutters were very effective. We used the two hotel computers(free of charge) which were situated in the basement. We found these very useful as our flight was cancelled due to French Air Traffice Control strke and we needed to rebook flights etc. The hotel staff deserve a special mention, they helped us so much when we told them our flight was cancelled. The reception staff were amazing and managed to find space for us to stay an extra four nights, even though we had to change rooms a couple of times. They arranged for our things to be moved from one room to another. Also the doorman was so friendly and welcoming. We are so glad we booked this hotel and would definately recommend it. We plan to visit Madrid again next year and we will definately book the Preciados.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: NorthernWanderer0
Reviews.Content: Very good location - can walk/Metro to all major tourist sights. Staff very helpful and well trained. We checked in at 8am after a long overnight flight with no trouble at all. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The windows are double-glazed to reduce noise, and with the electric shutters, the room was silent during the night. Bed was very comfortable. Free WiFi - wish all hotels were this progressive. The bathroom was large, well fitted out, separate bath and shower, everything worked. Overall, this is an excellent hotel in a central location, and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The service was fantastic. My wife and I...”
Reviews.Author: CRYA
Reviews.Content: The service was fantastic. My wife and I had lost our bags due to the plane being delayed and the staff offered to speak with the baggage representative as we don't speak much Spanish. We also had a wonderful brunch and the room was clean and modern and spacious with a great bathroom with proper doors. Great location for exploring Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Fumador
Reviews.Content: We recently made our first trip to Madrid, and although we knew much of what we wanted to see and do ahead of time, we hadn't a clue as to where to stay. I've been somewhat skeptical of web site ratings of hotels in the past, but decided to go with this hotel based upon excellent ratings on TripAdvisor. We couldn't have been more pleased with our choice. First of all, the location is excellent. It is within reasonable walking distance to most of the places one might want to go in the city center (Palacio Real, Museums [Reina Sofia, Prado, etc.], Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol), and outstanding shopping is literally a short stroll away on the Gran Via. The thing that makes Hotel Preciados such a great place, though, is its fantastic staff. They are courteous, helpful, responsive, and - get this - they smile a lot and actually seem to enjoy providing good service. We had a number of special requests that were accommodated without hesitation, such as holding our bags for several hours on our first day (our flight arrived much earlier than the usual check in time) and making sure our two rooms were adjacent to one another (we are an older couple and were traveling with two older children, so needed two rooms). After spending four nights here in late August 2010, we returned ten days later for one night before our flight home, and we were greeted at the front desk with the comment, "so glad to see you back, hope your vacation has been going well." This was BEFORE we told them our name, so I am sure the gentleman recognized us from our earlier stay and made it a point to make us feel welcome upon our return. I could go on and on about how great our experience was at Hotel Preciados, but let me conclude by saying this is one of the best hotels we've ever visited in numerous countries, and I would highly recommend it to anyone. It is very deserving of its high ranking on this web site.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect weekend away hotel”
Reviews.Author: luton
Reviews.Content: The Preciados is the perfect hotel for a weekend away, it is a 4 star hotel with clean, modern rooms, in the perfect location in the centre of Madrid. Hotel - Clean, modern, nice beds, great bathrooms, free wifi, great breakfasts, free minibar (nice touch), staff are friendly, knowledgeable & speak good english Location - approx 300 yards from either Calloa or Santo Domingo Metro, so dont bother to get a taxi from the airport just use the Metro, it took us 40 minutes from the time we got on the Metro at the airport to walking into the hotel reception. Cost 6 euro for 2 people, versus potentially 30 euros for a taxi. The hotel is situated about 1000 yards from Puero el Sol, which is considered the centre of Madrid, and is where all the shops and the Plaza Mayor (restaurants) are situated. Metro - use the metro system, it is clean, air conditioned and cheap, each journey cost 1 euro, and we bought a book of 10 between 2 people for 9 euros at the airport, note you have to pay 1 euro each additionally for travelling to and from the airport. Getting around on the metro is simple, dont forget to pick up a map of the subway network at the info desk at the airport metro station. (Note if you land at Terminal 1, it is a 5 - 10 minute walk through Terminal 2 and 3, to get to the Metro station.) Restaurants - Madrid is packed with places to eat, it is as of half the nation are waiters !! For a quick but substantial lunch I recommend Museo de Jambon, (it is a chain selling hams, sausages etc), they are currently running a campaign, where you can have a big peice of french bread stuffed with cheese, ham or both for 1 euro, a beer or a glass of wine for 1 euro, a coffee for 1 euro. This is incredible value and good food as well, you have to eat it standing at the bar as the locals do, but that adds to the occasion. For something more formal and for either dinner or lunch, try the oldest restaurant in Europe - Botin, (just off Plaza Mayor) it's specialities are suckling pig (which was delicious) or lamb. For some really tasty tapas, try the Mercado, St Miguel, (next to Plaza Mayor), go around to the various merchants, buy your tapas, buy a bottle of wine, find a spot to sit or stand and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, good value”
Reviews.Author: christiaan82
Reviews.Content: Chose the hotel because of the location, wasn't disappointed. Liked the hospitality of the staff and the tv in the lobby with up-to-date-information about the weather and such. Had the normal 2pers room. Size of the rooms was ok, bed was comfy but a bit on the soft side. Stayed at the 3rd floor and wasn't bothered by any outside noise whatsoever. The double doors in the windows prevent this, excellent. Together with electric windowshutters this makes for perfect sleeping during the day, which you do if you want to experience Madrid nightlife to the fullest. On my leaving I noticed they were very helpful to a fellow non-spanish speaking customer, sending a staffmember with to the police station to assist in the report of pickpocketing. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Lirkod
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot near everything. The front desk was very helpful and spoke english well. Room was clean and spacious and free mini bar an extra bonus. We ate at the restaurant downstairs once - but was not overly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: Euro_june
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and the room we had was spacious and very well maintained. Bathroom had good water pressure and bed was very comfortable Located just off Gran Via with metro around the corner. Local cafes well priced and down the road from Corte Ingles (major department store chain that has deli/supermarket/cafe)

Reviews.Title: “Smart”
Reviews.Author: MarkCheshire
Reviews.Content: Large, pleasant room under the eaves with its own small balcony. Nice touches such as the people-shaped clothes hangers! Good bathroom with spa bath. Very good service, pleasant staff (and the loss of a T shirt from the bed - removed accidentally with the laundry - was dealt with very well.) Minor issues: some tapping noises outside on the roof were a bit irksome in the night and I've had better breakfasts (although if you like cake, you'd be be very happy,)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay; great value”
Reviews.Author: 1travelMD
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Preciados and couldn't have been happier. The location made it easy to explore the major sites in Madrid on foot, although the subway was about 100 yards from the front door. Abundant restaurant choices nearby. Hotel is spotless and the room was very comfortable. Soundproofing was excellent so we slept late without difficulty. Staff was friendly and helpful. Fridge in room is stocked with assortment of free beverages--nice touch in Madrid in summer. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: eliza248
Reviews.Content: We had two nights in Madrid in August because we had a stop over on our way to the south and chose this hotel from comments by people on trip advisor and their summer deal seemed fairly reasonable too. We usually tend to look at cheaper hotels but have recently been disappointed, so decided to up our budget and for not much more, this hotel seemed to fit the bill. We were not disappointed! It is not a huge towering hotel block but felt more like going into a rather smart upmarket apartment block and that was really the overall feel of the hotel. There weren't any tacky or expensive shops inside, just a very smart welcoming reception area with really helpful staff. We asked ahead if we could have adjoining rooms as we had booked two rooms and have children aged 12 and 14. We were given rooms next to each other with their own joint private entrance and little lobby which meant it was like having out own 2 bedroomed apartment, which was great. The rooms were very clean and modern and the beds were so comfy! The bathrooms were very clean with good showers. The flat screen TVs offered a varierty of channels including some English ones and when one of the TVs didn't work, the hotel staff sorted it immediately. Check out was 10am, but we asked if we could check out at 3pm because we had a trip arranged and wanted to come back and change before flying out. The staff were happy to allow us to keep one room which was perfect. Breakfast was in the restaurant attached to the hotel and was fantastic, one of the best hotel breakfasts we have ever had. You could basically get whatever breakfast you wanted and eat as much as you liked. Also the cooked breakfasts and fruit seemed very fresh and not like they had been waiting out all morning. This was an excellent choice of hotel for us and we couldn't fault it. We only saw other guests during breakfast and they were a range of nationalities including Spanish which we liked. I would certainly recommend it to any discerning traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way !”
Reviews.Author: eMBieAntwerp
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Preciados during 4 nights. Can't add anything more to all the positive reviews here below except to say that they are for 100% true ! Had a wonderful stay, it was perfect in every way, great staff, clean and nice room, and the breakfast was superb, and...don't forget...A FREE MINIBAR !!! Can recommend this hotel to everyone, thank you Preciados !

Reviews.Title: “Spectactular stay”
Reviews.Author: DeanerEdmonton
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic two days we spent at this hotel. The decor is lovely, the staff were so, so helpful. The breakfast was yummy for our tummies. The location is perfect with a very short walk to just about everything and a number of cafes within arms length. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Preciados”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover1717
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Preciados for 3 nights while in Madrid. We did not book a hotel before arriving in Madrid, so we checked out a few other hotels while driving around the city. Hotel Preciados ended up being in a great location, an amazing value, and offered parking. Many other hotels did not offer parking, but rather directed you towards the nearest parking garage. The hotel was modern, clean, and very comfortable. We had limited interaction with the staff, but found them to be kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: ckgan
Reviews.Content: Just came back from trip to Madrid and Barcelona. This hotel lives up to our expectation and more. It is the best hotel we've stayed this trip to Spain. Location is perfect. Rooms are clean and more than meet our needs. Staff are helpful and even better if you can speak a little Spanish. The female clerk in the morning shift was a little grumpy and impatient. But the really nice evening female clerk more than makes up for it. We had really good night sleep in our standard double room and my daughter had a single room ,both on 4th floor. Breakfast was fantastic!. try to add it for 12 Euros a day to your room rate once you get there. It's better deal than paying it per day at 15 Euros. Cleaning staff were very polite and helpful. We asked them not to replace any Coke as we don't drink them,and give us orange soda instead. And they did exactly as we asked the same day. We felt very safe in this hotel in the heart of Madrid. We would recommend it to anyone. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Professional, Good Value, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: chris32137
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Preciados for two nights. The hotel is immaculate, with spacious rooms and baths, mostly done in marble. Beds and linens were very comfortable. The style is more elegant and professional than soft and romantic, but all the decor was very tasteful. The location is excellent, on a pedestrian street within easy walk to the Prado, Thyssen, etc. Service is professional. If I were told the hotel was twice the price, I would have believed it. My only frustration was that while we were there, the internet was down, which was a problem, but I am assuming that was a rare event. Overall, it was an excellent experience and we would be very happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for urban center”
Reviews.Author: jkmnop
Reviews.Content: On first arriving outside the hotel you think you've come to a inexpensive tourist area 2-star, but once inside you're pleasantly surprised. Rooms are nicely sized for a hotel in an urban center (this coming from a Manhattanite), clean, with plenty of natural light. The place has been nicely modernized. My only complaint is that the area is so touristy that finding good food is a bit of a problem. Otherwise the location is great with subway access to everywhere and many sites in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: PVmomontherun
Reviews.Content: Hotel Preciados was the perfect hotel in Madrid...Our family of 4 just spent 2 wonderful nights in Madrid at this hotel. From check in to check out, everything was perfect. From the very attentive bellboy to the box of chocolates that welcomed us in our bedroom and the sumptuous breakfast.... I could not ask for more..... and did I mention the free minibar... The location is unbeatable... we walked to Palacio Real, Plaza Mayor and even to Cibeles Square to watch the worldcup finals.... That was a once in a lifetime experience.... We stayed in a junior suite which was able to accomodate a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 teenagers). The rooms are beautifully appointed with a contemporary touch. The bathroom had double sinks, a bidet, a shower and a bathtub... Everything felt brand new. This was my kids favorite hotel in Spain and that is saying a lot(we stayed at Alfonso XIII in Seville and Hotel Regina in Barcelona). Please note that if you are driving you can actually drive to the front of the hotel although the road looks like it is only for pedestrians.... We made this error when we first arrived, but soon learned from the hotel staff that we could have driven in to the front of the hotel... Despite this minor hiccup, everything else at the Preciados was perfect. Although we were on the First floor with balconies that faced a really busy street, the noise did not really bother us even on the night Spain won.. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: yorkshireblond
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Very well located for the metro system. No problems transferring from the airport on the metro (don't waste your money on a taxi!). Nice and central for walking the city. Booked a junior suite, worth the extra. Free drinks in the fridge, although a bottle opener needed to be requested. It arrived quickly though. Lovely spacious rooms. A/C worked well. Loved the jacuzzi bath. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Hotel in City Centre”
Reviews.Author: Whackers
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night during the world cup finals at this Hotel. And cannot find fault with anything; staff are courteous and helpful, the price was amazingly good value including breakfast and mini bar! With the celebrations into the early hours our triple glazing doors onto the street you couldnt hear a peep from the revellers. Next morning we had a lovely breakfast catering for all pallettes. A super hotel, modern, clean, spacious, central, quiet......what more could you want??

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and best location!”
Reviews.Author: maria_elena_sanchez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 weeks at Preciados Hotel at the end of March, 2010. Everything about this hotel is positive: central location, courteous and helpful staff, comfortable beds, excellent breakfasts.
