Regular rooms are small but functional with plenty of table/shelf space and storage facilities. Noise is no problem. Two nearby metro stations allow easy access to other parts of Madrid. The hotel has virtually no common areas other than the lounge/restaurant but there are nearby cafes to sit and relax outdoors. We highly recommend the hotel, especially for tourists. One can easily walk to all the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: rianjdeus
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to madrid on business and keep going on aregular basis. I have had difficulties in getting the right hotel to stay and used to keep trying new ones every time. This time i landed up in Hotel Preciados. I was truly amazed with the kind of friendly people i ended up meeting right from the time my taxi reached on thier street. The location is very good as you can easily walk into Gran via and sol. you shop around or loaf around watching the beautiful people around. the hotel room was very neat and had a balcony. There was a good internet connection for free. Bath tubs had massage in it. Myself and my colleague were truly impressed by this hotel and would surely return to this place again

Reviews.Title: “Excelent stay”
Reviews.Author: sericaca
Reviews.Content: The Preciados Hotel was an excelent choice among all the hotels in Madrid. The local is very nice near stores, restaurants and subway stations. The employees are very friendly and are always willing to help you. The room was very clean and very quiet . The restaurant is very nice and the food is excelent. The breakfest has a great variety of fruits and breads along with the delicious "jamón español". I certainly will go back to Preciados Hotel. By the way, I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who intend to go to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: CDT_PA
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Preciados. Staff is very helpful and offers great advice on where to eat and what to see in Madrid. Breakfast is great and served in lovely, sunny room. Hotel rooms are very nice with modern decor and fixtures. Rooms can be connected with a shared hall door. Location is convenient, but tucked away on quiet square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Even better city!!”
Reviews.Author: hotch30
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the hotel. The service at reception was always friendly, although the advice on where we could watch the world cup was not brill. Whilst we were there we had some showers and the hotel provided guests with a few umbrellas which was great. The room was small but perfectly formed, with all you need on a city break. We had no problem with sleep and I am quite a light sleeper. The window have double glazed units and then a black out shutter which also helped with the sound proofing. We slept so well we had no idea on the time when we awoke! The only thing that the room could have done with was a clock that you could see in the very dark room. We used the metro to and from the airport and would suggest you go via colombia to callao. This way the are no stairs to carry your suit case up, there are lifts to use. If you go to santo domingo you will have to carry your cases. Both are very close to the hotel. It took about 40 mins each way. The overall location of this hotel is fantastic! Within walking distance are all of the major sights, and if you want to go a little further away you are right next to the metro which will take you anywhere you want to go. We would highly reccommed a visit to the Museo del jamon. This is where you will mingle with the locals. You can get a plate of Ham, cheese, Croissants, beer and a glass of wine all for a euro. It also double up as a butchers, where people are still in making purchases at close to midnight!!! It is on Calle Major, walking from Puerta del sol along towards Plaza Major it is on the left hand side, you should not miss it. There are some places you can stumble across that will serve you free tapas but you almost have to follow a local. They are usually late opening, but a great way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff with great facilities and prefectly located”
Reviews.Author: Dinorak
Reviews.Content: We spent four wonderful days in Madrid at the Hotel Preciados. It is within close walking distance to the major tourist attactions of Madrid and close to public transport and tour organisers to get you to others. Wonderful, helpful and accommodating staff from reception to housekeeping. A special thanks to Daniel and Oscar at reception and William in the restaurant. We would definately stay at the Hotel Preciados again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Buzz355
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with some other family members. We booked 2 superior rooms at the higher levels (balcony level). I thought the rooms were spacious and clean and the service was excellent. The bathrooms have double sinks and the amenities were 1st class. They provide toothbrush kits, combs, and other amenities many other hotels do not provide. The free minibar with cold drinks is a welcome touch after being out in the hot streets all day touring. They have good turndown service (who doesn't want a chocolate on their pillow at night?). On our first night they even dropped off a small box of chocolates in our room. Service is excellent. For example, I had trouble getting the room safe to work when I first checked in. At first the safe was closed and had to be opened with a key. Then the battery for the safe blew out and the batteries needed to be changed. Both times when I called to have this fixed, the staff came promptly and resolved the issue. The only nit I had relates to the window blinds. There is a heavy blind behind the curtain of the balcony doors that is intended to block out the sunlight when the sun rises each morning. It didn't work properly because the width of the blind was smaller than the size of the doors. All they needed was a few more inches of fabric for the thing to work properly. Overall though, this is a great hotel. I have stayed at many hotels, including many high end hotels and the Preciados ranks among the best.

Reviews.Title: “It is as good as the reviews claim...”
Reviews.Author: Mobilis
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms and found the hotel and staff great. Let us check in after early arrival. This is one buffet breakfast worth signing up for. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great in every way”
Reviews.Author: chefdulce
Reviews.Content: the Preciados is an excellent stay...staff friendly, clean beyond expectations, modern up to date in all tecnologies and with the most amazing breakfast. The location is privilaged very near Plaza del Sol. Of our trip to Madrid and southern Spain this hotel was by far the best. When in Madrid I already know were I am staying.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and so-so location, but nice property”
Reviews.Author: mrsirin
Reviews.Content: I was given room 001 on my first visit- what a disaster! Although a beautiful and spacious room, it's adjacent to the hotel restaurant's kitchen, and you can clearly hear the clanking of dishes and other kitchen noises on one side until late at night. Worse, literally underneath the room's windows are several dumpsters/recycle bins into which glass bottles and other items are continually dumped until at least 2:30 in the morning. Believe it or not, the trash collection truck empties these bins at around 2:45 AM, right outside the window! The room appears to have no soundproofing, and sleeping was next to impossible. On my return visit I was given a different room on the second floor. Opening up the double set of doors onto the small but nice balcony clearly showed how much soundproofing had gone into this room. Still, loud shouts from drunk teens in the adjacent street could be heard until almost until 3 AM. Also, the touristy pedestrian mall and the nearby plaza seemed to fill up with sketchy-looking characters around sundown; I'm not sure that I'd want to walk around the neighborhood at night. Still, the staff was nice and helpful, and the rooms are a good value if you don't mind the noise and location that's not near anything in particular.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: frs330
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location and very helpful staff specially for non Spanish speaking guests. The rooms are small but very clean. No Tea/Coffee making facilities. You can ask for hotwater for tea but dont expect boiling water.!! Not very good for tea or coffee. Also no iron in the room. Cleaning staff will come into room in spite of "Do not disturb " sign.!!!! Reception staff are very helpful and speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for our family of 5”
Reviews.Author: TexasKami
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Preciados and everything about it was great. It has a terrific location on a pedestrian-only street, just a block away from the Corte Ingles department store and a short walk to major sights. There are loads of good restaurants within steps of the hotel's front door. Our rooms were also terrific. We are a family of 5 and they put us in two separate rooms behind a locked door; we could keep the doors of the rooms open at night with the door to the hallway locked. Rooms were compact but clean and modern. Staff couldn't have been nicer. Altogether a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lolward
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the junior suite - a very nice room with a separate small lounge with flat screen tv's in both areas. Large comfortable bed with good quiet aircon and soundproof windows. Staff very friendly and efficient although one ice maiden refused to engage. This is a very nice hotel in a great location which we would recommend, but we did have one or two gripes: the breakfasts are pricey at 15 euro a head (although in line with other European capitals), and in common with other Spanish hotels in which we have been guests, the room prices were hiked by over 100% according to demand. A big conference was, we were told, being held in the city for 3 days and on each of those nights the cost of the suite was a stiff 400 euro, reverting to 190 euro thereafter. The roof terrace displayed in the picture gallery on the hotel's website is not available to guests - it is for the sole use of guests in the main suite - tough!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Preciados pleases”
Reviews.Author: sastillman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Preciados for three nights at the end of April and found the staff, location, accommodations to all be top notch and very fairly priced. The hotel is walking distance to many attractions and several metro stops. The room was clean and the facilities very modern and spacious (especially for Europe.) The hotel is in a busy area but the high quality windows kept out the street noise. We departed Madrid for a trip to the Basque region and returned in early May for 2 more nights. A standard room was not available at that time so we took a superior room which did have a larger bathroom but honestly, was not worth the higher price to us. In addition. the room was on the 5th floor and the 6th floor has meeting rooms so we heard the movement of charis and other equipment at odd hours as they set up for some meetings. That was somewhat disturbing and even woke us up one night at midnight. We only took the breakfast in the hotel one day. It is expensive but very high quality and delicious. If you don't eat a big breakfast, it probably isn't worth the price. I would highly recommend this hotel and be sure not to stay on the 5th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JONING527
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, walking distance to all the attractions. Great restaurants nearby. Very near two Metro stations (Santo Domingo & Callao) for easy travel by Metro to the airport and other sites in the city. Very helpful staff, modern, convenient facilities. Will definitely go back to this hotel on our return trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: scotaussie
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel in the old city in Madrid Hotel Preciados is a good deal. It is located on a pedestrian mall so no traffic noise but very close to several metro stations, Grand Via and all the sights. Take the metro from the airport although you will need to change twice. Only 2 euro. We booked on their web site to get good reductions but weekends can be expensive. The room was a good size with a room safe which is important in Madrid. We did not take the breakfast as it is quite expensive but there are plenty of cafes nearby. Free WI FI is available in the rooms which was great when checking up if the ash had closed airports. We used Madrid as a base to travel to Avila, Segovia and Toledo. Take the bus to Avila from Chamartin but be careful, the bus to Segovia leaves from Principe Pio. Take the train to Toledo but book at least one day ahead as very popular. All were great.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker03
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in some suite rooms elsewhere in Spain before our arrival at Hotel Preciados, I was fearful that the standard room would make us claustophobic, but I was happily wrong. This hotel is a wonderful deal for Madrid, which is the most expensive of the big Spanish cities. The standard room was roomy enough for two people, one of whom -- I shall not name -- packs as though there is imminent war. The bathroom was also of good size to accommodate dual usage. The bed was really a full size and so there wasn't much tossing room for the two of us, but I do have to praise the quality of the pillows. We were able to pick up free WiFI signals in our room, though it was strange that the hotel did not mention it to us. Sadly, there's no gym/fitness center. The location is fairly ideal as the metro station is down the block and you are essentially in the city center. The El Corte Ingles Supermarcado is down the block.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: adytrip
Reviews.Content: May 2010 i was in preciados for 1 night the staffs were great, room was nice. super breakfast! ideal location, very clean you choose the right one. good luck

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: residentlincs
Reviews.Content: just stayed at the hotel preciados madrid for a long weekend over may bank hol, and as everyone has said a great hotel, very well positioned for everything around within walking distance, lovely and clean and very quiet even though we were surrounded by busy streets, we had a superior room it was lovely, bed very comfy and bathroom great had everything provided even comb toothbrushes shaving kit tissues everything you could imagine 2 sinks, hotel very clean and staff very helpful, we had breakfast which was extra and had some lovely fruit and some beautiful ham and the best coffee ever, would highly recommend this hotel and for price we paid glad i read comments from tripadvisor reviewers, and as for madrid absolutely fantastic city do go there

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel with great rooms”
Reviews.Author: WhisperingSquash
Reviews.Content: Good: Very clean, modern, spacious rooms; perfect location Bad: Concierge recommendations Wifi: free, accessible from inside room, good connection Bed: 2 single beds pushed together, room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - ignore the staff's recommendations”
Reviews.Author: KarenEif
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The location of the hotel was amazing - basically on top of at least 3 different metro stations, in the middle of the busiest shopping area, short walk to nightlife, and yet the room was still quiet at night. Hotel decor was modern, clean, and beautiful. The room was spacious and comfortable. The only negative was that we asked for two recommendations while we were there, one restaurant and one massage, and both were terrible. Obviously the hotel didn't provide the services, but they shouldn't send patrons to restaurants that serve half-frozen seafood.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: orionyh
Reviews.Content: We arrived after an overnight flight tired and rumpled. The desk clerk told us that the bad news was that our room was not yet ready, but the good news was that he had upgraded us to a room "that we would really like". That was an understatement. Were were placed in the only room on the top floor, which is a 3 room suite with a huge balcony overlooking the rooftops of Madrid. We ate dinner twice on our terrace because no restaurant could beat it! We walked to the Palacio Nacaional, the Prado, and many other important sites. Because of the hotel's great location we didn't need to use the metro or a cab once while in the city. The staff of the hotel were all friendly and went out of their way to anticipate our needs. This hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Shkup
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch hotel. The rooms are large, the beds are comfortable, LCD T.V, free WI-FI (There is coverage in the room itself), very helpful staff. Above all, is the location, right near SOL metro station which is right on the center. The hotel resturant is expensive but there are tons of resturants near the hotel. It's a bit pricy (Cost us 128 EU a night) but if you don't have much time and want to be on the center it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mirch
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for staying in Madrid. The hotel is centrally located, very clean, bed very comfy, free wifi, free mini-bar. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Clean, and central for shopping!”
Reviews.Author: rfarragh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Preciados as part of a package deal we booked which included flights....so we didnt have much influence over the price. It was also the weekend of the Champions League final - so if it weren;t for the package deal, we would not have managed to be able to stay here at all!! The hotel was very centrally located, particularly if you are interested in shopping - nearest metros Santo Domingo and Callao. It was superbly clean, if very compact, within the room (we had room 308 on the 3rd floor). Although located right beside the lift - which I was initially concerned about - I heard NO noise at all during the night! There was a very small balcony, enough to be able to step out and see the street below - but not enough to sit out on! Very very clean, lovely comfortable bed. staff were ok - we didnt have to rely on them for anything so didnt really test it out. Locally there are some nice bars (out of the hotel, left, and then left again down the hill; 1st right down the hill takes you to some very local bars, which seemed to be full of Spanish - which was a good sign for us!! We had to take a taxi to get to the tapas street we were interested in visiting - Calle de la Cava Baja (HIGHLY recommended!!), but only cost about €4 or €5, and taxis were very easy to come by. Right by the hotel were some good shops - el Corte ingles, FNAC, and some local shoe shops, as well as other high street stores - Zara, Mango, H&M. All in all - I would stay here again provided the price was right!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SweetPeaSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Preciados was a clean, modern hotel in a great location. It is in close walking distance to the Plaza del Sol, Prado, Reina Sofia, Gran Via, etc. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bathroom was large and the room was spacious as far as European rooms go. I would NOT suggest the restaurant that is attached to the hotel. The staff there was not friendly and the food was not good. Make sure to confirm your room is non-smoking if that is what you request. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: FeynieLily
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations when we arrived at the hotel due to all the great reviews on Trip Advisor. We stayed for four nights. They were definitely met (and more) when we arrived at the hotel. We got in quite early in the morning and hadn't slept for about 24 hours. The room was available early for us - which was a Godsend! The room was amazing. We had our own private deck. The bathroom was HUGE with a whirlpool tub and fresh orchids on the sink top. The bed was very comfortable and the rooms were sound proof to the outside. This made for a fantastic sleep. The wireless internet was free. The hotel was centrally located, within walking distance from Gran Via, Plaza Mayor, Opera House, etc. Such a great place to stay in Madrid, and you can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy at Preciados”
Reviews.Author: EWKSeattle
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 2 nights, and we were very pleased. Our rooms were modern, comfortable and spacious (especially by European standards). The staff were helpful and accommodating, and the breakfast buffet was memorably good. The location is excellent -- very close to shopping, restaurants and important sites. We tried to stay again at the end of our trip and were disappointed that the hotel was fully booked. If we had one complaint, it would be the noise of the bar that was across the alley from our rooms. It got pretty loud at night, but didn't spoil our stay. We would highly recommend the Preciados.

Reviews.Title: “this is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glandman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in late April 2010 for 3 nights. The location is really great. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. We had a reasonable package that included breakfast, which was definitely worth it. The room was quite spacious with a great bathroom (particularly for a European hotel), very clean, totally pleasant space. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: CrackedActor
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here recently. Managed to get an good all-in deal so can't comment on the cost of breakfast; but, as breakfasts go, this was a good one - very large choice of interesting food, fresh fruit, cooked and uncooked meats, cereals, yoghourts, cakes etc. The hotel was surprisingly quiet given its location; staff were all helpful and several spoke English. Through our being disorganised, we ended up eating in the hotel restaurant one evening. Food not especially cheap, but surprinsngly good for a hotel restaurant, with a definite Galician flavour, and in an attractively uncorporate dining room. All in all, a pretty good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: cabaretken
Reviews.Content: We stayded at the Hotel Preciados because the hotel we had planned to stay in (for a 2nd time) slightly further down the Gran Via had gone to seed. This was a new, upscale boutique-like hotel. Very comfortable bed, if in a small room. But what hotel room in Europe (or NYC) short of costing a fortune is not small. VERY convenient to several Metro lines, just a short walk to the Gran Via, and very close to lots of good restaurants. Just around the corner (Go out of the hotel and turn Right then turn Right at the next corner) is the most wonderful chocolate shop in the world, VALOR Chocolates. We had their chocolate and churros for breakfast more times than I can remember. And it was great every morning!!! Bought some recently for use here at it is indeed terrific!!! I'd stay at this hotel again, even if it is a bit more costly than I generally prefer. But the ambiance and the location make up for that. First class place! (But the breakfast was outrageously expensive. Ergo: The Valor chocolate and churros.)

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RoxanneOZ
Reviews.Content: I booked the Preciados Hotel and was a bit apprehensive as it was a 3 star hotel and the other 3 star hotels we had stayed in were pretty miserable. From the minute we walked into the foyer, Oscar who attended to us , was most helpful and changed our rooms at once when we requested a window in the room. Everyone spoke English and could help in booking our tours etc. They laid out a wonderful spread at breakfast which surpassed the ones we had even in a 4 star hotel in France. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to be in a central location and still have a good sleep. The Internet was free and we were in touch with our sons all the time. No other hotel has offered us a free mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller5000
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms, good value for Madrid, breakfast expensive but other options nearby are comparable. Only one block off Gran Via street, and metres from Callao and San Domingo metro stations (easy connections to Atocha) in a quiet square. Some rooms face inner light well, to good effect. The bathroom would have fitted the last several hotel bathrooms I've visited inside it ! Well equipped with accessories you may have forgotten, free wifi and free minibar (about 8 bottles a day). Will that last ? If you're happy with your room rate then this is a great added bonus ! Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: doc_rck
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel Preciados in Madrid on our way to and from Morocco. The hotel is exceptionally convenient to the Metro (near the Santo Domingo and Callao lines), major attractions (like the Plaza Mayor and the museums) and great dining (in Chueca and the center). We booked a superior king room through Travelocity and were not disapointed. The room, located on the 5th floor, had a small terrace and was well appointed. Nice touches included free beverages in the fridge (restocked daily), a bright sky light in the bathroom, a plush and comfortable bed, and dependable and free WiFi access in the room. The front desk staff were a bit brusque but nevertheless competent in obtaining restaurant reservations when asked and booking taxi service when needed. We definitely recommend Hotel Preciados!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: mjmcneill
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, superb service. Staff exceptionally helpfull Centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TallieB
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of many hotels on TripAdvisor before heading to Spain and picked Hotel Preciados in Madrid for the beginning of our adventure. It was absolutely more than I even expected...wonderful. We had a nice little suite for our family of four. Our sons had their own separate sleeping area. The hotel is modern, comfortable, clean and provided many little extras like toiletries, laundry bag and slippers that we could keep. It is in a great central location in Madrid. Excellent for walking to many top attractions. The staff was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service BUT...”
Reviews.Author: JPF_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on all the positive reviews. Service was exceptional. I had stomach distress about 4 AM and called the front desk to ask for an herbal tea and it was promptly brought to my room at no charge. The fridge was stocked with FREE drinks, including beer, and replenished every day - a big Plus. The Jr. Suite was on the smallish side but OK. BUT, the bathroom had a severe odor problem most likely due to poor ventilation and mold growth in the jetted tub due to excessive humidity. Think of the smell of a wet mop that's been lying around for a while and you get the picture. When I first walked into the room, I noticed the odor and asked to be switched to a different room and they obliged immediately, but the other room also had the same odor problem, but to a lesser extent. I decided to stay in the original room but proceeded to open all the windows and kept the bathroom door closed. I shortened my stay to two days from seven days, and mentioned the problem upon check out and the front desk clerk acted like that was a new problem. I told him that if he walked up and checked the room he would notice it immediately. Anyway, my stay was disappointing because of that problem. Instead, I rented a 100 m^2 apartment next to Parque del Retiro for half the price and could not be happier. This apartment also has a jetted tub, but none of the damp moldy smell.

Reviews.Title: “My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mishka1809
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Preciados for 4 days this past February. We were quite pleased with the hotel. The hotel is centrally located and close to musuems, churches, shopping and the Mercado. Also, there are many wonderful restaurants within walking distance. Cabs are plentiful. Regarding the hotel itself, we found everything to be of high quality. Check in was fast and easy. We had a larger room with a balcony. The room was spacious. The queen sized bed was comfortable. The bathroom was clean and equally spacious. The bathtub easily fits 2. The fact that the refrigerator was stocked with free beverages (e.g. juices and beer) was a plus. Room service was fast. I recommend the sea bass. The morning breakfast is served at the restaurant. The food is plentiful and typical of Spanish breakfast (tasty). On our next trip to Madrid, we would definitely stay at the Preciados. The value was also just right. If you're looking for a high quality, centrally located hotel in Madrid, the Preciados is the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: stlouistraveler007
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Preciados. The rooms (superior double, 5th floor, all non-smoking) were excellent. We had 2, one with a small balcony, which was nice. Huge bathrooms, large rooms, very clean, nice amenities, good beds. Quite modern, but very comfortable, nice storage. Great breakfast (buffet plentiful, very complete). My only dissatisfaction is that we came mostly for museums, and the hotel was not terribly close to the museum triangle on the eastern side of the city. Not terribly far, but not close. Hotel is close to shopping, close to palace, cathedral, great tapas restaurants (which are just south of Plaza Mayor on Calle de Cuchilleros and Cava Baja). Hotel was not cheap, but decent value for how nice it was, and for Madrid, which is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with reservations”
Reviews.Author: CharlieCB
Reviews.Content: Over the years we have stayed in a number of nice hotels, and Preciados does not quite make it to the upper levels. The hotel itself is pleasant and comfortable, the staff are extremely helpful and the location is pretty good. Being at the heart of a city there is some noise at night, but ear plugs work quite well! We did stay in a Junior Suite and this was a nice size. The only fault we really found is the restaurant, but this may be because of the type of spanish cuisine, rather than the hotel itself. We felt that the food was over seasoned for our taste. Breakfast was good with pleanty of choice. There are plenty of other places to eat, including a nice (but slighly pricey) grill, De Maria, just along the road, although it is strange to be in a restaurant often surrounded by smokers. The other thing to avoid, which we did mostly, was restaurants that have pictures on the menu! The main aim of the trip was to visit the galleries and the hotel is between 15 and 25 minutes gentle walk from Prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen (which was our personal favourite). It is well placed for the Royal Palace (about 5 minutes walk) and the shops. We also had a pleasant lunch at Plaza de Santa Ana on the way back from one of the galleries. The lunch at Plaza Mayor was not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it!”
Reviews.Author: KCJHC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend and found it just about the perfect choice. Room on 4th floor looked over a fairly busy street, but noise not a problem at all as there are 2 sets of double glazed doors opening from room onto tiny balcony. Modern decor with very comfortable bed and spotless bathroom with deep bath and excellent shower. Minor problem with room safe was quickly and efficiently resolved by very helpful staff. Breakfast served for 4 hours every morning - varied and substantial. Again, a minor mix up - we were presented with a bill for our breakfast on the first day when we had booked an inclusive package - was dealt with very swiftly and without fuss. Hotel ideally situated for Metro, but most major sites are within walking distance as are any number of restaurants and tapas bars - try the Museo de Jamon (one of many in the city) just around the corner - friendly bar staff and every drink comes with tapas. We usually ate our main meal at lunchtime - the menu del dia on offer in many restaurants is excellent value - and had a snack/few tapas on the way back in the evening. Madrid is a lovely laid back city and the Preciados is a good base from which to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable”
Reviews.Author: nayanaya
Reviews.Content: In strategical position, very close to three different metro station (Callao, Santo Domingo, Sol) the hotel is nice and offer a various and good level breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Preciados must mean PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: BubbleDublin
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Madrid with a friend recently, and was recommended this hotel by a friend, but after reading some reviews on this website I was a bit unsure as to what to expect ("small rooms" "looking out at a wall"). Anyone who has something to complain about with regards to this hotel is a Moaner! Hotel Preciados is in the best location in Madrid, for getting to and from all the main attraction, eating, dancing etc. And the metro stop is quite literally across the road, which means getting to it from the airport is very very easy. The rooms are modern, fresh, extremely clean. They aren't super big rooms, but then again how many hotels in Europe are these days? There is a free mini bar, which is refilled daily, which has minerals, water and beer. The hotel is nice and quiet inside, which is great because the location is so central it is good to get some peace when you want to relax. The staff are really helpful, and will go to the ends of the earth for you. Their English is great, which is also very helpful! All the locals give this hotel a thumbs up! I dont think ill ever look for another hotel in madrid again, ill just stay at preciados

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: Brighton9
Reviews.Content: Well located near Calleo metro stop and 50m from El Corte Ingles store. Rooms are medium sized with wood floors and equipped with flat TV, desk, radio, mini bar and good lighting. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was good with hairdryer, bidet and decent toiletries. Reception staff were efficient and helpful. Breakfast buffet (€16( was comprehensive.

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: burt1972
Reviews.Content: Reviews of this are accurate. Nice hotel very central. We like to walk everywhere so location is important and this hotel facilitated this well. Nice staff and rooms. Reasonably quiet. Was woken up on the first night by some drunken shouting but it is the center of town so hey... Generally Madrid is good. We did get ripped off in the taxi on the way in, charged €45 for the trip and only €30 on way back. Guy driving obviously took the long route. Does leave bad taste in mouth at the start of the trip. Arrange taxi back with hotel, not sure if one can be arranged on way from the airport. On the last night we went to see Larry Martin band in Central Cafe. Cost €11 pp but well worth it. Enjoy the tapas, particularly around huertas. Also check for times that are free to enter Prado. We went at 5.30 on sunday and got in free. Saved €8 pp.

Reviews.Title: “Preciados of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MaskedMcky
Reviews.Content: Good, but small accommodations. Complimentary wi-fi & minibar; quiet; very modern. Service can be slow, but centrally located to Gran Via, Royal Palace, Plaza del Sol, Plaza Major and much more.

Reviews.Title: “Good looking hotel but suffering from a sick building syndrome”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Jetten
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I was disappointed by this hotel. I was assigned a room with a view of a blind wall. The room - like the hotel corridors - was hot and suffered from a lack of ventilation. The air conditioning was not very quiet, so I tried to cool the room by keeping the window open during the night (I stayed at the hotel in early February) but with little success as the blind wall that blocked my view also blocked any breeze of wind. Other, smaller problems that I encountered were the very plain duvets and the rather expensive breakfast (15 euros per person). On the positive side: nicely decorated and illuminated, good beds, central location, and free (non-alcoholic) minibar. All in all I would conclude that the hotel appears very nice on the surface, but is based in a sick building that is not recommended for people who appreciate a breath of fresh air and prefer not to keep the airconditioning on all day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TNEG
Reviews.Content: I'm finally getting around to writing reviews for my trip to Spain last May. We arrived in Madrid, and spent 4 nights in the Hotel Preciados. The hotel is in a great location, just a short stroll from the Puerta del Sol and very central to all of the main tourist sights. The rooms were clean and very modern; not large, but a typical European size. They are very quiet at night as well; if anything, too quiet, as our first night we slept in until 1PM due to the lack of noise! The main areas were very nice, and the hotel staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We weren't overwhelmed by the hotel restaurant, there are definitely better options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel..”
Reviews.Author: ahacisuleyman
Reviews.Content: ıts a modern hotel ın the center of the Madrıd. you can reach all the ımportant hıstorıcal places , restaurants and caffes by walkıng. Its near to the metro statıon .the staff ıs very frıendly and speakıng englısh.the rooms are very clean and sılent. we advıse you 1 day toledo tur, you can arrange ıt from the receptıon . the restaurants ın the same street are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic! Modern, luxurious, centrally located, great value”
Reviews.Author: ndmalia
Reviews.Content: This was one of our favorite hotels in Europe so far. It's in a great location (5min walk to Puerta del Sol) and on a great street with lots of restaurants and shops. The included breakfast was amazing--of the best we've had. Lots of hot foods, including 2 diff types of eggs, meats, and so much fresh fruit. Even champagne to make mimosas! The rooms are on the smaller side, but did not feel this way. They did an excellent job with the space and so the rooms do not feel cramped at all. The bathrooms are spacious and spotless. The bath towels were huge and soft. Another perk was the mini bar that was stocked daily with waters, juice, sodas, beer and it was totally free. The staff was very responsive to our needs and booked various things for us (a tour, dinner reservation, etc). We highly recommend this place. What a value for all the luxury and perks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: DameDeBronze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really liked Hotel Preciados. The location could not be better, the room was spacious, nice and clean, the common areas well taken care of. The staff was nice and helpful. The restaurant is okay, they have a very nice breakfast (the other meals were not as good: we had one lunch and one dinner there, bcs restaurants in Madrid are open at strange hours). We would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, VERY central”
Reviews.Author: ssm28
Reviews.Content: 1st, very central to everything. Never had to take the metro ANYWHERE except for airport. Once u arrive to airport: go to Tourist Info desk & ask for: metro map + city map, and u are set! To hotel from airport take metro: 1st L8 line to Nuevos Ministerios stop, then Line 10 to Alonso Martinez stop, then L5 & get off at Callao (closest stop to hotel less than 1 block or so away). If u take metro from airport, make sure u travel LIGHT (lots of steps up & down metros). 2nd, hotel room very good -- hard wood floors, modern, clean, great bathroom, FREE minibar with beer/soda/water/juice, flat screen tv. They have 2 free computers with free internet in basement, but one was not working well, kinda cramped, but still great to have. 3rd, when we 1st checked in, they told us we didn't have a reservation (b/c they had switched my 1st & last name around) -- so please bring a COPY of you reservations! It was an honest mistake. They are actually pretty friendly here. 4th, there is just way too much construction around the hotel at this time. Took away from the beauty of the place, but hopefully by the time u go, it will be completed. Overall, a GREAT hotel. Make sure to see: the Prado (free tues to sunday evenings 6-8pm), Thyssen museum, Plaza Mayor, Puerta Del Sol -- all within walking distance easily from hotel. Skip the Royal Palace -- not that interesting at all, especially if you've seen Versaille (this place was a real disappointment compared to Versaille in Paris). We researched which place to see flamenco shows, and found Casa Patas to be EXCELLENT. It's 31 euros/person which includes a drink. There were locals there too, which was a sign that it is genuine & not just a touristy place. Hope that helps, have fun!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: encinitassusan
Reviews.Content: hotel preciados is a gem. i stayed 11 nites. staff was great. all rooms were very nice from a regular room to the suites and jr. suites. the suites had a beautiful deck with a great view. we had friends staying in the suites. ihad a basic room and it was lovely. it was big enought, thick towels, very clean. so close to anywhere you may want to walk. very safe.near chueca with many great restaurants. i would recommend this to anyone.the value was good even when paying in u.s. dollars..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Find”
Reviews.Author: wayzata1
Reviews.Content: We booked on Trip Advisor reviewers recommendations and were very pleased. They had a room for us early in the day. The location in excellent. Very close to Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. Street outside is just being finished into a pedestrian walkway and is very quiet. The hotel is very quiet, clean and well furnished. Large bathroom, smaller but adequate bedroom. Having a free, stocked mini bar is a great advantage after hours of walking. The front desk staff speak excellent English. We didn't try the restaurant as there are so many places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A "W" hotel without the attitude”
Reviews.Author: obsoperator
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here in 2005, in room 508, for 150 Euros. That room had a lovely, small terrace set into the roof, and a huge bathroom with a sloping ceiling. When I saw that we could get a suite in October, 2009 for 195 Euros Saturday, 175 Euros Sunday, I decided to splurge. (In both cases, breakfast is an optional 15-20 Euros extra per person.) I'd actually been hoping for the massive suite we saw on the roof in 2005, but I guess that was too much to expect. We did get two big rooms, with the curved corner-of-the building bedroom. Every window was french doors with double glass, and every door was actually a pair of doors. So the soundproofing was very good. We had two flat-screen TVs. Our suite bathroom had both a jacuzzi and a stall shower, as well as dual sinks and a bidet, of course! The shiny shower stall, which we both prefer, was gorgeous, but had badly designed weatherstripping. Since the suite came with two bathmats, we could sop up the drips. This hotel was a "gut renovation" within the last ten years, and is still in great shape. There's lots of custom wood paneling and shiny surfaces. It's immaculately clean, and the friendly staff speaks enough English to take care of anything you want. The breakfast is worth the price, including a whole table of cakes and tarts, poached and scrambled eggs, several kinds of Spanish ham, including dry-cured, juices and sparkling wine and espresso made to order. There were only four American-style dry cereals, which I usually prefer. But there were gorgeous fresh fruits, including sliced papaya and sliced pineapple. The hotel is closer to the Royal Palace than to the three "big" art museums, but we walked to all our destinations from this hotel. It's very close to the Puerto del Sol, the two important Monastery/Convent museums, the opera house, and the shopping district. It's an easy walk to the #4 museum in Madrid, Real Academia de Bellas Artes de San Fernando. (This is very worthwhile, and often overlooked by tourists.) The street (that is, Calle Preciados) is being turned into a pedestrian mall, which makes it hard for your taxi to get there. I suppose there's construction noise on weekdays, but we didn't experience any for the three days we were there. There are three subway stops nearby, but we still needed two changes to get to the airport. But for 3 Euros each, I'm not complaining about better airport access than most American cities! If you're crazy enough to have a car in Madrid, the Preciados is just steps from the municipal parking Santo Domingo garage, and only 3 blocks from other garages. We liked that it was near the Trapsatur tourist bus tour company, which we used to visit places like El Escorial and Segovia. I booked this room in 2009 through Continental Airlines because I saw that it was at the same price as the hotel website. I think they would be amenable to direct-bargaining during an off-season like October, but I'm not incline to bargain. This is a very comfortable place that's worth a slight stretch in your budget. Even if you get the standard room we had in 2005, you can expect enough room to live in, and reliable air conditioning in the summer. This is a very good value, with the appearance of a slick business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Marina107
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was lovely. The service, spacious and beautifully decorated rooms, location & price. If you are going to Madrid this is a perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “All the good reviews are true!”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaViolets
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days at this great hotel. Everything was just as I had expected based on other comments (all good) posted on TripAdvisor. I was traveling solo, but opted for the standard double with two windows with tiny balconies. The street was still somewhat torn up but almost completed (they are turning it into a pedestrian only street). In fact, many streets and plazas in Madrid were being spruced up … they must have received stimulus money too. At any rate, the noise from the street is non- existent in the room when you close the double pane windows and push the buttons to close the automatic window shutters … a very nice feature. The staff was efficient and extremely helpful. The taxis were not able to come right to the door of the hotel, but there was someone to greet me at the end of the street when I arrived and someone to take my luggage to the end of the street when I departed. By the way, I used Aerocity transportation. There were some negative comments about them on TripAdvisor but my arrival and departure were perfect all the way. The drivers were on time and very courteous. I made my reservation easily online. My hotel room and bath were spotless, comfortable, and had plenty of space for a single traveler. The free minibar, free in-room safe, and free internet downstairs were especially appreciated. Another plus is the location of The Preciados. I walked everywhere in the city, with the Palace only 5 minutes away and the Prado an easy 20 minute walk. As luck would have it, I had perfect weather. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid choice”
Reviews.Author: squash
Reviews.Content: This is a good urban hotel, close to anything you would want to visit in Madrid, one block from the Metro and in easy reach of a variety of restaurant options. It is "classy" without being overly grand. The staff are attentive and keen to help. The room was in good shape with very very good sound-proofing from the busy streets below. Bed was comfortable; bathroom quite elegant (marble, large tub, etc). All in all a solid place.

Reviews.Title: “good base near puerto sol”
Reviews.Author: mike61
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in the hotel on a recent trip to madrid. Reception was fast and friendly, rooms were adequate but a little on the small side. Tried restaurant on first night, very quiet, not an extensive or imaginative menu but in fairness for a hotel restaurant good. I felt there was not much of a sitting area in the lounge/reception. Excellent location for walking to prado/reina sofia/retiro/plaza mayor/pl. santa ana etc. Also ask reception about the tour bus. Top marks to the staff, always smiling, friendly and extemely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy1944
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating my 65th birthday. We drove thru Andalusia and finished in Madrid. It was my best stayed ,excellent location, breakfast, room, we had suite 002. Your staff is incredible, Raul the most helpful , informative person we encountered. Raul went out of his way to help. Keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: clorane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October. Booked on the telephone - spoke to Oscar - tried to get a deal but failed!. Still decided to stay as the location is superb. Checked in efficiently and got the "heads up" from Oscar about what to see and do and eat in Madrid. Room was lovely. We had no view except of a shaft on the 5th Floor but that suited us as we had been on the "camino" and just wanted a bath and a restful nights sleep - which we got. Oscar recommended a fish restaurant "manas" . It was not great. However, breakfast the next morning was outstanding -- fresh fruit, hot and cold buffet, lovely coffee and breads. Out of the world. Fully sated, we took the red line bus tour of Madrid. They sell the tickets at reception and the nice hall porter walked us to the bus stop. On our return, they called a cab to bring us to the airport €25.00 . Overall, couldnt speak highly enough of the staff, ultra helpful and efficient. Beds very comfortable - no complaints -- a real 4* in a brilliant location. Santo Domingo Metro station 50 meters from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rncnyc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Preciados has many advantages for the price. We stayed four nights in a beautiful comfortable room with a large bathroom including jacuzzi. What was most attractive was the terrace overlooking the Madrid rooftops...fifth floor room. It was so quiet and sleep came easy. The hotel has an excellent restaurant that offers a menu of the day at a reasonable price as well as free wifi. It's location is right off the spectacularly busy Sol station plaza but it on a side far less busy street. The neighborhood has everything to offer: winding charming streets and wide expansive mega plazas with lots of shops. The management of this hotel has taken every step to make clients pleased with their stay as we definitely were.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: cliffwy
Reviews.Content: Well, I booked this hotel since it had such a great rating on TA. And, I agree with the rating. I was very surprised with the hotel. I usually stay at chains such as Marriotts, but I'm changing my ways! The Perks: The entire staff was great. They spoke English at the front desk, they always said Hi when we walked by. There is quite a bit of construction on C. Preciados and when I checked in, I asked if I was in a room facing the construction. They said yes, but quickly changed the room facing the side street. Then, after about 15 minutes of being in the room, one of the hotel staff came up and gave us Lindt chocolates to welcome us to the hotel. The free minibar was refreshing after walking around all day. A couple of beers, soft drinks and water were refreshed daily. The location is PERFECT. Right off the Gran Via, close to Callao metro station, Puerta del Sol, walking distance to Plaza Mayor. Free Wifi was nice since the Marriotts I stayed in throughout the trip (Cairo, Lisbon) did not offer this (even in the executive lounges). The rooms were nicely done, nice bathroom, balcony, soundproofed windows (really good soundproofing). The Cons: Since there was a bit of construction on C. Preciados, it took a little longer walking down C. Preciados as there was minimal space for pedestrians, but this is not the hotel's fault. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. I have stayed at other hotels in Madrid before, but I will return to this one. Friendly staff, great location, good service, no complaints about the hotel here. This hotel deserves to be at the top of TA hotels in Madrid!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but Praise”
Reviews.Author: jersey1977
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, perfect location in the heart of Old Madrid. Even a free mini-bar. Best shower we saw on our vacation. Simply nothing but praise for this hotel. Stay here, you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MaryHB
Reviews.Content: Hotel Preciados had the most friendly and efficient staff - always willing to help you. The location is perfect, the room spacious and clean. We ate at the restaurant many times. This is really a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent restaurant at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DorothyVenice
Reviews.Content: I hoped to stay at this hotel, but the price went up quickly from the time I first investigated it to the time I checked back one week later. We did go there for dinner the last night my daughter and I were in Madrid, and the food and service was excellent. I ordered a glass of wine, but the waiter brought me a bottle and recorked it for me to take back home. My sole was done perfectly, the shrimp appetizers were very tasty, my daughters salmon was excellent, and the finish, tiramasu, was better than we've had in Italian restaurants! If I go back to Madrid, I will stay at this hotel. It's in an excellent location and very well kept.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff + hard beds”
Reviews.Author: joker53lab
Reviews.Content: Our room was certainly nice enough, quiet enough, and the breakfast (included) was lovely. Staff extremely helpful. Our only comment was that the bed was really, really hard!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SteelerFanUS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and were very satisfied. The room was small but clean and quiet. It was centrally located for our sightseeing, only downside was the road construction that closed the road dirctly outside the hotel. We were in Madrid sight seeing and we walked to center city for breakfasts, tappas, and dinner. We took the "Hop on Hop Off" buses for sight seeing (hotel had tickets) and was able to get on the bus at a stop within close proximity to the hotel. The staff was exceptional and never too busy to help with our questions and providing directions. Very close to Placa del Sol and just a bit further to Plaza Mayor.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to fault in this excellently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: voyager1942
Reviews.Content: Location couldn't be beaten - near but not too near to bustling (and noisy) Gran Via and within easy walking distance of the Palacio Real, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol. We went for the tariff which included the excellent breakfast which with its varieties of eggs and bacon, in addition to the normal cereals and fruits and cakes, is enough to set you up for the day. The reception staff, who all spoke english, were helpful in assisting with such things as the city bus tour ( a good way to get an initial overview of the city and identify what you want to visit) and a day-trip to Toledo. (If you go to Toledo on the fast train from Attocha Renfe, be prepared for no one speaking english at Toledo station and don't get caught up with the hoard in the station waiting room waiting for a tour bus; leave the station completely, turn to the right outside, and take the normal blue bus to Toledo centre which stops just outside the station.) Back to the hotel, there are some interior rooms which have little natural light - to be avoided, the beds are on the firm side (but we liked them) but we would definitely stay again - it will be even better when the paving/pedestrianisation works out side the hotel have been completed in a month's time. Final tip; be ready for the €1 fare supplement both to and from the Airport on the Metro, which you have to pay on top of any ticket (e.g. 10 ride Metrobus ticket)

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy523
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the VIP suite for two nights, a truly amazing hotel room with beautiful private patio/balcony. Could not be happier with the room, location, and service. Despite much noise outside we heard nothing while in the room. The free mini bar is a fantastic treat. Walking distance to great shopping and restaurants. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Nice breakfast buffet too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and central location”
Reviews.Author: world_travelers_D&L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Preciados from Sept. 8th thru 14th 2009, in suite 622. Upon arrival, the friendly staff greeted us. Our rooms were a good size and very well appointed. The bathroom had a wonderful glass double sink, separate shower, and spa tub. The top floor terrace had good views of Madrid and we enjoyed sitting out there while enjoying a free beverage from the mini bar and our morning coffee. Room service was very efficient and quick. The entire staff from the reception to maid service was exceptional. Every person in the hotel went out of his or her way to make our stay very enjoyable. Most of Madrid had some major street construction including the street next to the hotel. To our amazement, we could not hear the street construction in our room. The location was perfect for walking to the major sites and shopping. Plaza Mayor is a short 10 minute walk and we enjoyed eating at the many outdoor restaurants during our stay. One restaurant we would recommend is the Preciados Cafe Valera. We ate there twice and the food and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good all the way around”
Reviews.Author: Tsip92
Reviews.Content: The Preciados is a business hotel, which is to say that it lacks certain charm, but other than that, it's a great place to stay. The rooms are modern and clean. There are some street noise, but the double doors on the balcony essentially block out 95% of the external noise. The hotel is also centrally located and very close to two Metro stops. Each room also comes with a complimentary minibar that's re-stocked each day. We'd absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Neat hotel but only just worth it's star value”
Reviews.Author: j4mm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very tidy and room cleaning was done daily and well. On arrival staff gave us two maps and marked on the other map the main sites, where to dine (where it's pricy, where the locals eat etc) and other stuff. All the free items (bathroom kit/mini bar) were filled daily. Minibar only has drinks (soft drink, juice, beer, water). They have many channels on the TV, but failed to mention that only one or two are in English! Most programs are dubbed. The breakfast was quite nice, but as one of us was vegetarian there was not much of hot food without meat. Only fruit, bread and buns were for vegetarians and it was plenty, but after 4 mornings got a bit boring. The free internet means two computers in under ground level and the connection is so slow you can only use one tab at a time (and still have to wait!). All in all our experience in the hotel was enjoyable and value for money (we had a discounted price though).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good food and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: hippychick40
Reviews.Content: Only negative - building work being done outside hotel but not hotels fault - it's the same in quite a lot of places in central Madrid at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAPMAN
Reviews.Content: I am at this hotel now, Sept 15. Pros: Very good double windows PLUS shutters, for quiet room Mini bar with drinks FREE and restocked daily. Clean and decent sized room (reasonably modern) Free and fast Wi-Fi Only 2 blocks from 2 different Metro stations and 3 blocks from Hop On Hop Off stop ( a great deal for seniors 65+, 11 Euros for 2 days) Excellent location to lots of restaurants, stores, etc. A/C worked well as did bath/shower. Decent sized elevators. Cons: Not major, but street in front is being redone (prob. complete by mid Oct) Price varies by day. Call/email ahead and get best rate as market soft. (I paid ave of 115 E, but cheaper on "off days") Breakfast is a bit expensive, but as I take coffee&roll, so did not try. (many places nearby have breakfast, incl McD. Egg McMuffin) Note: Hotel is between Plaza Santo Domingo & Plaza Caliao Overall - location is great, and a good place to base a Madrid vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: muziklv
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Junior Suite for 5 nights and these were the most comfortable nights we had in Spain. Our room was huge (living and bedroom) with total of 6 (!) balconies. Kids slept on their couch in living room which was very comfortable. Our bed was great too. Very large bathroom with jet tub/shower and a separate shower, 2 sinks and enough counter space. All in marble and new upscale fixtures. Rooms had hardwood floor, electronic shutters for total light insulation. Eventhough there was some road work going on on our street, our room was quiet. Very nice reception area with helpful people. Very clean too. Location is perfect - walked everywhere. Couldn't wish for any better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelsofAandL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in August 2008 after reading the tripadvisor reviews, and it lived up to all expectations. This is a great hotel close to the busy Gran Via but on a quiet street meaning very little disturbances or noise. There is a Subway station at the top of the road which is ideal to explore the city, using the Preciados as a perfect base. There is a main shopping street and department store only minutes away enhancing the location of the hotel further. Our room was smallish but ideal for us as a couple, with a small balcony overlooking the street. Modern and clean with the great addition of the free mini bar that was stocked up daily! The front desk spoke good english and were friendly and helpful all the time, even sorting out football tickets for us at the last minute! They also gave good advice on touring the city. We payed very little to stay at this hotel meaning it was excellent value for money. If we return to Madrid we wouldn't even look at another hotel unless the Preciados was already full!! Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick4u
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed here in April and booked a Jr. Suite. The suite was small but comfortable. Since we had a guest we did not use the sitting area which contained a fold out couch. The rooms were suprisingly quiet considering the busy location. The bathroom was attractive. I liked the two balconies which gave the place a nice touch. The best part about choosing this hotel was the location. Right in Sol and a short walk to Plaza Mayor, the Presidential Palace, prime shopping areas and a host of other sightseeing locations. There are so many nice hotels in Madrid that I probably wouldn't choose this one again. The deluxe room at the Room Mate Alicia (Plaza Santa Ana) was much nicer than the Jr. suite at the Preciados.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TatiD
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Preciados VIP from July 18-21,2009. We chose this hotel based on the reviews on tripadvisor.com which were very helpful and very true. The hotel is central as it is close to the Gran Via, main street, shopping, hop-on hop-off buss, metro stations and main attractions. The room and bathroom were recently renovated with very pleasant modern furniture and very clean. Eventhough it is in the center and in a vital area, the room was quite as it has double glazing windows and to my surprise and convenience an electric shutter. The mini-bar was for free with a moderate variety of drinks. The breakfast buffet had a diversity of choices. The staff at the reception were very helpful to advise us on restaurants, tours and available at all times even when we had to check in at 4:00 a.m and when we requested water outside of the room service hours. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!It was a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: philosykos
Reviews.Content: Just back from Madrid.We stayed 4 nights at the Preciados .Not dissapointed! A wonderful hotel! The staff is very friendly,pleasant and helpful in all your needs.The room was clean,modern,good bathroom,no noise from outside at all,great AC,lovely hotel reception etc.Mini fridge is stocked everyday with free drinks ( non alcohol).We could not have asked for more. The location was excellent as far as we are concerned.Close and easy to get around to everything.El Corte Ingles is just a step away where a supermarket in basement was useful for anything you wanted.Pharmacy just downstairs next door....shopping streets all around and a taxi stand just up the street.Plenty of local places around to eat..we found some lovely ones for lunch or just a drink where the locals go which is what we wanted.Non touristy stuff. Would definately go back again and reccomend this lovely hotel!Its a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaBecky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Preciados for four nights in June 2009 in their Junior Suite and loved it. The room was very spacious with a separate living area and bedroom. The bed was very comfortable as well as the fold out couch where my teenage son stayed. Each room had nice hardwood floors with modern decor. There were 2 flat screen tvs with an exercise bike in our room. The bathroom had a rain shower and jetted tub (nice). The room was very clean and well maintained and the free mini bar was a great treat. We had several balconies which were fun, but the room was very quiet with great soundproofing (Madrid people like to stay out late!) and room darkening shades. The a/c was wonderful as it does get very hot here. We loved the location of the hotel as it was just off Gran Via and minutes to Plaza del Sol and a 5-10 minutes to the Palace/Cathedral. The shopping in this area was wonderful as well with many restaurants and bars around. The metro is a few minutes walk from the hotel too. Metro is really easy to use and very inexpensive. The staff was very helful and friendly. They assisted us with mapping out how to get to our daughters school and gave instructions to a taxi driver for us. Our every request was met promptly and to our satisfaction. I can't say enough about this place. It was a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: UpAndUp
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. I came for a business meeeting but I managed to squeeze in a quick walk around the city (The hotel is located close to the Grand Via and the Cathedral) Room is great, wooden floor, bathroom is clean. No view from window. Air conditioning is great. Internet is free, but a little slow. Breakfast was amazing! The chef worked wonders on the food and presentation. Staff were always cheerful and friendly. Enjoyed my stay. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet. Clean. Great Location. Nice & Efficient Staff”
Reviews.Author: kcbmMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 6 nights at the Hotel Preciados over a 2 week period. In total, we had 3 different rooms and found the room to be very clean, quiet and spacious enough for 2 (plus our large bags) . The things we liked the most: * comfortable beds & pillows - after a long day of walking, it was lovely to go back to a comfortable bed. Since this isn't the case for many Spanish hotels (regardless of the number of stars, it is worth stating). * Even though every one of our three rooms had a balcony to the street, we never heard any street noise - day or night. * The hotel is located within walking distance to the Plaza de Oriente (5 minutes), the plaza mayor and the palace. * We LOVED the free minibar. How nice it was to get back to our room after a long day or to wake up in the morning and have free drinks - cold water, juice or a diet coke - available. * the weather was very hot and humid during our stay. The AC in the hotel worked beautifully. * lots of cable channels on the TV. We appreciated getting the english news channels so we could check-in with the rest of the world a few minutes a day.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful, cool and quiet island right in the bustling centre”
Reviews.Author: GabriellaMaria
Reviews.Content: Central, beautifully managed, great breakfast with lots of fresh fruit (breakfast extra but worth it), free Internet and mini bar in every room. Rooms are very clean, newly furbished, with everything you might need - and very quiet because of insulated windows. Air conditioning works to perfection. Found it through tripadviser, I fully agree with the praise of others - and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, brilliant location would definitely visit again”
Reviews.Author: Poptart007
Reviews.Content: So we arrived in Madrid and made a rookie error by getting off at the wrong metro stop which just added a wee bit to our walk but also was a good eye opener to helping us get our bearings. This hotel is near Grand Via which is one of the longest shopping streets in Madrid. It's near a plethora bars and restaurants too. We were greeted by the receptionist who had a very polished look and our bags were brought to our room for us. The doorman was very polite and friendly and always had a nice word to say when we passed him. The room itself was bigger then I imagined, a TV with 40+ channels, mini fridge, sizeable bathroom and AIR-CON were waiting for us on the 3rd floor. Where our room was there was no daylight at all so it was hard to decide what to wear at times, our window looked out on an internal courtyard type area where the lights were turned on at 7:30 in the morning but our curtains managed to keep our room shaded. We got a great price on the hotel and it was a little piece of heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but hard to find!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandBirdy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed one night in the hotel en route to Marbella. The taxi driver left us a few streets away due to a one way system. We attempted to find the hotel on Preciados street but after several failed attempts we spoke to the tourist information at the top of said street. They did not know the hotel but assured us we were on the correct street and just needed to look again. Following another frustrating lengthy look I rang the hotel who informed me that the street continued on another side of a square. Ensure you are dropped at the hotel!! The rooms were modern, airy and clean. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good with a varied selection. We did a bus tour of Madrid and I would recommend this. We found it surprising that by 7.30pm the main streets were inundated with prostitutes openly flaunting their 'wares.' I found this gave Madrid a seedy atmosphere that was offputting. Good hotel and central location

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: spainjunkie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Preciados wasn't on my radar when I was booking a return stay in Madrid. I ended up booking it without knowing that much about it because our stays are more about seeing the city than it is staying in the hotel room. We were extremely happy with our room, our stay and the staff at the hotel. We didn't hear any road noise from the 3rd floor. It is an excellent value for its location. We will definitely put it in the top 2 places to stay in Madrid for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “very good and no complaints”
Reviews.Author: chrian
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here in April and had treated ourselves to the suite. The private terrace was great and the extra room size because it being the suite made a weeks stay more relaxing. The location is good and we walked everywehere. 20 -25 mins to Prado and just 5 to the Palace. The area it is located in is eclectic with some very nice shops / resturanats and some very tatty ones but never felt uncomfortbale walking around. The staff were excellent. Breakfast was perhaps on the pricey sid ebut the quality and choice were very good, set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Airmay
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a few days in Madrid before meeting up with friends in Sitges, and stayed at the Preciados. It is a nice hotel, located in the heart of Madrid. The positives: The location was excellent, near the metro lines, the main shopping district and tons of cafes, restaurants and bars. Another great amenity is the FREE mini-bar. Stocked with water, soda, beer and juice it was really a nice treat to have that waiting for me after a day of walking around. The rooms were modern and updated. The negatives: I found the bed to be incredibly uncomfortable. After staying 3 nights, I couldn't imagine another night on that bed. The rooms were quite nice and updated, it is hard to imagine them overlooking such a basic as the mattress. Also, my room's only window faced a light shaft in the back. I had absolutely no view and only diffused natural light. I didn't really mind so much, but most people probably would complain. Overall, a nice hotel, pleasant staff and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “A 5* experience at the best location”
Reviews.Author: MonicaCyprus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Preciados 5/5-10/5/2009 and it was a fantastic experience. The location could not have been more convinient, the staff good mannered and helpful, the room modern, clean and very convinient, the free internet connection in the room very helpful. An overall excellent experience. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Madrid!!!!! Highly recommented in all respects!!!!!! Thank you Preciados for making my stay a memorable one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Evanescent
Reviews.Content: Hotel Preciados has to be one of the best deals in Spain. Four stars, one block from the metro, very nice rooms, quiet location and helpful staff. It is reasonable waking distance to the major museums and attractions. And all for under 90 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel....pity about the smell in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Milliesydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in April. We were travelling with another couple and a single friend so we had three rooms. One of the rooms our friends had was fine but the other one had a badly leaking toilet and they changed his room to a smaller and not so nice one without a balcony. We were in room 622 which is the top suite with a terrace. The room was nice and the terrace lovely but there was a really bad smell in our bathroom which the hotel must have been aware of. We didn't eat in the hotel but the staff at reception were efficient and friendly and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Living in a shoe box”
Reviews.Author: IckeEssex
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a broom closet with no window then book yourself into a single room in this hotel. At 160 euros per night it's a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay In Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Global8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 days in Spain and while in Madrid, stayed at the Hotel Preciados. Excellent hotel, great value, terrific staff, especially the front desk who were always available and eager to help. We had what was referred to as a "Superior" room with full breakfast included in our rate. Breakfast was well prepared with a wide variety and consistently good quality. Great coffee. Room was clean, good size with a large double closet with draws, comfortable bed, terrific bathroom with double sinks, small balcony and a FREE mini-bar! Also included at no charge was use of internet access on 2 computers located in the basement level. The hotel is in a great location, about a 7 minute walk to Plaza Mayor and to the Palace. Easily walked to all museums and major destinations, didn't take a taxi all the time in Madrid, except from the airport and to the train station. In a nutshell, fair rate, convenient location, neat & clean rooms, helpfull staff, great breakfast, free stuff, what else could you ask for. Stay here when in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: judsonmccann
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 5 nights in Madrid and at the Hotel Preciados. I was very happy. I had a quiet interior single room, (94 Euros/night) which was perfect for a light sleeper like me. It also had one of those electric roll-down aluminum shutters, so I could make the room pitch black when it was time to sleep. Calle de Preciados is about a 3 minute walk from Gran Via and about 5 minutes from Plaza del Sol. Two different Metro stations are 3 minutes away. The staff was excellent. The restaurant was very good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay plus a few nitpicky issues”
Reviews.Author: LandisD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I's stay at Hotel Preciados lasted for 7 nights and we had a great stay. We're a married couple in our late 20's. Overall we don't have any major things to complain about. I can see that somebody with higher expectations could have had a few issues with our room and that's why I had to go with a 4 rather than a 5 rating. My wife and I stayed in room 106. This room is on the first floor almost directly above the entrance and above the restaurant. The hotel is located on the corner of Calle Preciados and Calle de Veneras, which is a block or so south of Gran Via. Being on the 1st floor even with both windows closed we were still able to hear people talking on the streets, as well as buses and garbage trucks going by. I'm a pretty light sleeper and didn't have issues sleeping at all, but of course we walked many miles a day so I was pretty tired every night that we were there. Also, with our room being above the restaurant at certain hours of the day you could hear the banging of things in the restaurant. From time to time we did also hear the neighbors, but it was never too bothersome. The bathroom was large and had nice warm showers every morning. We had some water go on the floor from the shower, but it was easily stopped with a towel. We really liked the decoration of the room. It was simple but stylish. We didn't use the TV much with us not being Spanish speakers. We tried to get English subtitles on the channels, but never figured it out. The hair dryer in our room didn't work well. It would turn on for about 20 seconds and then stop. We tried to get it fixed, but when they visited our room it always worked fine.
