So if you have room to bring your own hairdryer and it is a necessity, I would recommend bringing your own! Our bed was slightly on the hard side for us but again we didn't miss any sleep because of it. If you like to sleep in a dark room I would highly recommend using the rolling shutters (switches are by the bed and easy to miss). These were great at blocking out light and made taking a nap on our first day out (to recover from jet lag) wonderful. The free minibar drinks were a godsend. I think we emptied it out almost everyday. The selection included soda pop, juice, water and beer. The free wifi was nice as well. The front desk workers were friendly and spoke English well. We came into the hotel late a couple of nights and didn't have any problem waiting to get in. Location was great. I'm glad we weren't directly on Gran Via. Gran Via is pretty busy at all times during the day. Restaurants, shops and theatres are all within easy walking distance as well as 3 metro stops. If you need a funky décor, really cheap prices or 5 star luxury this really isn't your place. If you are looking for a decent hotel close to a lot of attractions with a few nice perks I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BanksyUk
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hotel is in a great location for seeing and doing all there is in central Madrid. You would think noise would be a problem, but Quadruple glazing takes care of this. Staff speak excellent English if you haven't had time to polish your Spanish. They are also professional, courteous and provided a superb service. The Room We went for a superior double (so can only comment on this) See pictures for details. Free mini bar (and I do mean the drinks are free). Very nice bathroom including double basins and a Jacuzzi bath. Shower was hot and powerful. Small terrace/balcony (nice for fresh air, you won't spend time relaxing on it). A/C. Beds were very comfortable. Free internet access with free wireless (be it unsecured). No Iron so iron those shirts before you go. Alternatively the hotel will iron for you (€2.80 per shirt).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: rob_natalie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in Preciados. Excellent location, just on the edge of madness. Close enough to the action, if not a perfect location. The rooms were very clean, staff we quite helpful. 1 concern was that day 1 our spare key we left in the room went missing after the cleaner had been. Being a little security conscious had the key changed immediately but the front reception staff brushed it off as though it were a regular occurance? 1 tip - when we went to check out, we were told the mini bar was free, not sure if that is always the case but i wish i knew day 1 not when checking out. Would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Oasis in a Crazy City”
Reviews.Author: cmlmls
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in the heart of Madrid. It was just minutes from the sights, and right next to a pedestrian only walkway full of restaurants and a huge mall. The room was clean and quiet. It even had a view of the rooftops, which was nice. One of the unique elements about this room was the sound system that was wired throughout the entire room, including the bathroom. It was a nice touch. The room was updated and modern and quite comfortable. Breakfast was not included although there was a place to eat in the restaurant. We selected to go out on our own for the meals because there were great options surrounding the hotel. The hotel had valet parking and it was necessary. It was not included, but again, worth it. There was a lot of mass transit close to the hotel to get to the other areas of town. We really enjoyed our stay and would absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: imdi
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our 4 night stay last week at the Preciados. The location, staff, room, WiFi, were all great. The bathroom/shower was really nice. Everything looked new and clean. Our room didn't have much of a view (to a side alley of sorts) but it was great having doors that opened out and power controlled shutters which shut out noise and light. The in room safe was large enough for our laptop and the WiFi worked great. There were also 2 computers in a lower level attached to a printer which came in handy for printing our boarding passes on the last day. We didn't have breakfast or dinner at the hotel. The free minibar was a plus - nice to have a juice in the morning or a cold drink when returning from sightseeing. It's convenient to everything and very close to the pedestrian part of Calle Preciados that leads directly to Puerto del Sol. There's a supermercado in the bottom of the Corte Ingles dept store nearby as well so we could pick up additional snacks/drinks to keep in the room. We also thought it was a good value. The desk staff were very helpful. We felt sorry for them working under the heat of what seemed to be halogen lights. (We had great weather while there) Luckily the room had nice temperature control so we were always comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!!”
Reviews.Author: deadmedia
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel back in July 2008. Madrid was our stopover coming home from Ibiza, so we decided to stay two nights in Madrid, and based on reviews on Tripadvisor, we chose Hotel Preciados. We chose to take the subway from the airport to get to our hotel. It saved us a lot of money and the hotel is located inbetween two stops so it wasn't hard to get to once we hit the street. Upon arrival to the hotel, the staff were friendly and courteous, and other than checking in and checking out, we didn't really didn't interact with the staff because we didn;'t really need to. We stayed in a standard double and the room was a decent size and very clean. I was actually surprised on the size of the bathroom as it was much larger than i was expecting. The room had free internet access and free minibar, which were nice touches. Noise wasn't a problem as the window's were sound proof. Good thing because there was always a little action going on outside our window, as is the case with most streets in Madrid. We only stayed here for 2 nights, and mainly used the room for sleeping, but it was in a great location and we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. We didn't eat at the restaurant so i can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel & staff!”
Reviews.Author: twinklesplodge
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we knew we had picked a great hotel. Staff on reception were very welcoming and always on hand to give advice about directions things to do etc. nothing was too much trouble for them. Housekeeping were the same, we had to call housekeeping twice to the room regarding 2 different issues and they were there within 5 minutes, the staff are a credit to the hotel!! The hotel is spotless in every area; our room was on the 3rd floor at the end of the corridor so as a result it was nice and quiet. There were the usual facilities, minibar, safe and nice big wardrobes with lots of storage. There were electronic shutters that shut the light out completely and made for a great nights rest. Air conditioning was also in the room although we did not really use it. Again the room was spotless- could not fault it. We even had chocolates left on our bed’s ( v comfortable) after returning to our room to retire on the first night, a nice touch The bathroom was marbled with a great power shower, the only downside of our overall stay was the terrible hairdryer in the bathroom- one of those ones that is stuck to the wall - make sure you bring your own. Our room rate did not include breakfast so I can't comment on the quality of the food in the hotel. The location could not be better, 2 mins walk from Gran Via and yet on a back street so very quiet. On day of checkout our flight was quite late so the staff let us keep the room until 2pm with no extra charge which was very accommodating of them. Overall could not recommend this hotel enough, for the rate we paid it was top class!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jenny666
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights last week and found it to be a very pleasant experience. We stayed in a standard double room. The room was an average size but did have a more than average size bathroom which was pleasantly surprising. The room faced onto a side street and we had no problems with outside noises. We availed of the breakfast which was a buffet and I would definitely recommend, fruit, meats, salmon, cereals, bacon, eggs. A great start to a days sightseeing. The hotel is located within walking distance of the centre of town and we walked to all the galleries, and palace from it.

Reviews.Title: “Helpfull Staff And Very Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonoandwhitey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights,staff very friendly and helpfull,Hotel very clean,a bit noisey at night and in the mornings,we had a suite room 207, which had two showers plus jaccuzi very clean and fresh.on the down side the room did not have any tea making facilities.i would personaly recomend this Hotel.Travelers BEWARE we got ripped off with the taxi to the hotel 45 euros,we paid 27 on the way back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: Wheesht!
Reviews.Content: Based our stay here on the previous reviews and were not disappointed, this stay was very pleasant, the staff were very helpful with trip suggestions and any other requests. Room was a good size with plenty of wardrobe space. Free wireless internet and sat tv. Virtually in the centre of Madrid, so the shops and the nightlife are literally on your doorstep but still quiet enough. Even the culture, Prado etc is a 15-20 minute walk. Complimentary minibar with beer and soft drinks. The only slight downer was the bed. It was comfortable enough and we got a good night's sleep but it was very rocky. By this I mean the bed did not seem to be very sturdy. It was on legs and everytime you moved on it you got the feeling it was about to collapse. Would have been a 5 but for this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jimmylonghurst
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Preciados through TA, the price was right and the we found the hotel easily as it is near two main Metro stops. The hotel overall was well presented from the outside and the reception staff and concierge were most friendly. We were shown up to our room which was of typical European standard size and had all normal facilities expected except an iron. To make up for this a fully stocked mini-bar is provided free of charge. Two little balconies let you look over the street, which was lovely. We didnt pay for breakfast as around the corner there are so many little bars and cafes you would rather sit there and watch the world go by. We couldnt find the hotel bar, so we cant comment on that. The room blurb did state that the room was sound-proofed, this was not so, although the hotel is on a side street traffic could still be heard. All in all a good hotel in a great location in a beautiful city.....especially if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality and Location”
Reviews.Author: hannahk1m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. The place was reasonably priced and in a great location. The hotel was very clean and modern. The beds were comfortable and tastefully decorated. Madrid can be very noisy so we appreciated the double-paned balcony doors which were amazing at keeping the noise out. The hotel is a bit business-oriented so it's not quite "romantic" but it served our purposes fine. The front desk agents were helpful and friendly although their English (and our Spanish) was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: SineadAndFergus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the one to stay in when going to Madrid its in the centre of everything and the staff were more than helpful with anything we asked for! From the moment we arrived we were greated with smiles! I would highly recommend Domingo's for breakfast we ate there nearly every morning!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TripFanIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at beginning of December. Travelled from the airport by metro, change trains x 2, v. easy, and there are 2 stops just 100 metres from the hotel. It is situated right in the centre of Madrid, but on a quieter street, with plenty of restaurants. We booked a superior room, which was small, but had everything you would need, including a jacuzzi bath. No problem with noise - slept like a baby !. Across the road, you will find De Marios restaurant, which I would recommend. Excellent Argentinian style menu - great atmosphere, even for a drink, and advise booking on Saturdays . DId'nt have the breakfast in the hotel, not included, but coffee shops in same street, with coffe, fresh juice and croissant for €3. or €2 for coffee/croissant. (hard to beat). Loved Madrid. V. easy to eat Tapas in the many bars, and the Hotel staff will point you in the right direction. The art is out of this world - give yourself plenty of time in the galleries. They are mind-blowing.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Holiday in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ArtandWine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent four fabulous nights at the Hotel Preciados! We booked a Junior Suite through the hotel website and we were delighted with our selection. The room was modern, clean, sound proofed and great for a multi-night stay in Madrid. This is a hotel that certainly makes travel a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - perfect”
Reviews.Author: psychtobe
Reviews.Content: This was an outstanding hotel, good value for the money, great location, and very very very quiet rooms (see below). Everything we could have asked for. The hotel is 5 minutes from Puerta del Sol but not on a major street like Gran Via, so it is reasonably quiet. Very safe area. You are within 1 minute of 2 different metro stops. The hotel is a business class hotel, with extremely sleek interior and professional staff. The staff was very helpful - fair English, very willing to help make reservations, call taxis, etc. Made good suggestions for restaurants, shopping, etc., and provided a useful map, too. There are 2 computers with so-so internet access in the basement. The room is small to average for Europe, small by US standards, but is extremely sleek and with a lot of features that were unexpected. For example, there are electrically-controlled window shutters; a flat-screen TV with about 40 stations; tons of lighting including 2 different individually-controlled reading lamps for each bedside; a small refrigerator; safe and hair-dryer. The bathroom is very good size, with lots of space for toiletries. The shower is a full bath-shower combo. Nice soft towels. The bed is a little soft but perfectly acceptable, with lots of pillows. We had asked for a crib in the room, which was already in the room when we arrived. The room was ready at 10 in the morning, which was very nice. I want to commend in particular the housecleaning services of the room. The room was always cleaned on time, and at a very high level. As an example, every morning they refolded the sheets and blankets of our baby's crib; folded up the blanket that we used to cover the crib (to keep it dark while we watched TV) and placed it neatly in the crib; folded up her pajamas and sleep sack; and straightened the crib out in the corner of the room. I was very impressed by the housecleaning staff. The only drawback is the strong smell of vinegar in the towels, but that wasn't a big deal. The room was very very quiet and dark. The room has 2 large windows, each having TWO sets of double-paned windows with a mechanized rolling shutter between them. When you bring the shutters down, and close the drapes, you are talking about 4 panes of glass, drapes, curtains, and the metal shutter separating you from the street. Believe me, it was dark and quiet. We often slept til 10 am without stirring, even our infant daughter who is a bit of a light sleeper. This was a great night's sleep! We would stay here again in a heartbeat - simply couldn't have asked for more. Exceeded all expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfert and Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MMH
Reviews.Content: This wonderfully updated boutique hotel is in an ideal location. It is tucked between the Puerta del Sol and Grand Via and walking distance to the museum distric and the Royal Palace. It's location gives you easy access to all important Madrid sights without having to deal with the unbearable noise and congestion of the Grand Via and Puerta del Sol. The hotel itself is extremely clean and updated with great room amenities. We had a Junior Suite which gave us plenty of room for four and a good view onto a Plaza. The service was impeccable. We are well traveled and recognize the difference between good and excellent service. Any and all requests were immediately responded to. Extra pillows arrived within five minutes, a request for cups and saucers in our room was met without hesitation, a call was made to our room the night before check out to ask if we needed a taxi for transport to the airport, and on and on. We had the hotel breakfast each morning and it was worth the cost and kept us going for the hours before a late lunch. It is more like a brunch than a breakfast. Fresh baked goods, fresh fruit, ham, salmon, ham and salmon mini sandwhiches with fresh baguetts, scrambled eggs, bacon, eggs sunnyside up, yogurt, cereal, and granola. I am sure that I am missing some of the items but it was great. Once again, the service at brunch was impeccable. The reception staff can appear to be stoic but they are extremely helpfull. They made dinner reservationss and printed out Renfe time tables and weather forecasts when requested, and again, within minutes. I saw an earlier post regarding the sleepness nights from bottles being unloaded outside their window. We heard a little of this from our second floor room but were able to muffle it by closing the double windows. However, I could imagine it being a problem if your room was in close proximity to this noise. We did conclude after our trip that our perception of a hotel was influenced by our rooms as well as the over all quality. We were in a fabulous hotel in Granada but the room was less than desirable. We were in a good hotel in Seville but it was made better by having the best room in the hotel. So, be certain to discuss room location and view when booking anywhere. The Preciados was perfect for our family of four which included two adult children. We all had a great experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Quite Oridinary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronaldjp
Reviews.Content: A forgettable albeit quite decent hotel. Nothing in particular would make us remember this hotel with any fondness or disdain. Mostly sullen staff (except Anna the receptionist who was excellent) and a ground floor room which certainly was acceptable with the mod cons and free wi-fi, but with windows which were opaque so you couldn’t see out and which gave onto an exceptionally noisy street at night and a less than queen size bed which was just too small. Location excellent however and was the unique selling point as was its restaurant which was very good but there were many notable restaurants nearby. I would recommend for location and providing you took rooms which were on upper floors but other than that give this one a miss…there are so many better and maybe even cheaper hotels in Madrid in the same category..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: ikaros58
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days end of October with my wife. Excellent hotel, in a fantastic location in the center. Spacious room 4th floor with all necessary things brand new and well operating. Cleanliness all over the space same for the room items, although centrally located amazingly quiet and above all polite staff ready to help and advise accurately and on time. Maybe the best value hotel I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve_DC
Reviews.Content: This is a very fine, slightly expensive hotel tucked away about one block off the main commercial street in Madrid, Gran Via. Staff was excellent, rooms immaculate and very well appointed. Big bathroom with modern fixtures, hotel safe, and a small balcony to boot. This is not a bargain hotel, two nights, with one breakfast, was about $500 for a small room. Their breakfast is first rate, but be prepared to pay Waldorf prices: About $40 for two people, but the food was of very high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigbang13
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean, nice and kind staff, breakfast over the top. Will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Service great street noise unbearable”
Reviews.Author: BarryBenajarafe
Reviews.Content: Just had two sleepless nights at Hotel Preciados, Madrid. Paid €128 per night for a rear facing room, reasonably quiet during the daylight hours, but after midnight my room number109, which was 1st.Floor, was directly above the bottle bank ,paper for recycling and other rubbish collection boxes. Around midnight the bottles from the day's sales were thrown into the collection point. Around 1.a.m.they were collected by a team of noisy workers who made even more noise than when the bottles were deposited. At two a.m. another lorry turned up, turned the waste paper bin upside down and crashed everything into the lorry. By this time I had become so annoyed and wide awake that it was after 4 a.m. before I went to sleep, to be woken again at 9 a.m by a lorry dragging a very large skip container along the street immediately below my window. where it was left to be used by workers in the building opposite, who filled it with mountains of rubbish by 11 a.m, making more noise than ever. This was my worst ever experience of hotels in fifty five years of travel throughout the world. I would not stay at Hotel Preciados ever again if I was offered a free week as compensation in response to my written complaint to the hotel made as I left this morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: emmandjay
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading other TA reports and we were not disappointed. The rooms are modern and very clean and we found the staff very helpful and friendly. Although it was very warm outside, the air con was efficient and we were able to keep the windows closed to eliminate any street noise. Its location enables you to walk to all the major sights and there are plenty of nearby cafes for a reasonably priced breakfast. On the downside, there was some building work going on in the reception area and this didn't give a very good first impression on arrival. Once this is completed this area should be very nice. If your budget can run to it, I recommend an evening meal at the Cafe Oriente, facing the Royal Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Julie071
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel through other reviews here on Trip Advisor and weren't disappointed. Although the reception area is quite small the staff and standard of accomodation were good. Breakfast was excellent - fruits, cereals, cakes, breads, all the coffee you could drink as well as the usual eggs and bacon - but was16euro each. There are numerous bars and cafes nearby who serve the more typical fare of chocolate or coffee and donuts. Their restaurant had a varied menu also but we preferred to try the tapas bars and cafes in the surrounding streets. Our room was clean, comfortable with modern furniture and serviced daily - all you should expect from a 4 star hotel. The Preciados Hotel's main benefits are its proximity to the Big sights such as Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor and the Cathederal which can all be reached easily on foot. The reception staff gave us a map to help find our bearings. A word of warning - watch out for Chinese women who hang around the gardens in front of the Palace and try to grab you to give you a massage or what looked like accupressure. They are very forceful and I found one a little threatening when I said "no" . Over all, we had a wonderful few days in Madrid, the hotel was very comfortable and the staff helpful and polite to English tourists who spoke very little Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - even better Location!”
Reviews.Author: louisvilletravel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Preciados is a great find in Madrid. We stayed there for 5 nights on our recent vacation. The front desk speaks great English and is willing to help with anything you might need. The room is a little small (like most European rooms), but offers great utilization of space and a nice bathroom. We were pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness and overall feel of the room. On top of the room itself, the hotel is in the perfect location. It is right off the Puerta del Sol and other popular plazas. We loved the location because it was quiet at night but still right in the heart of everything. Frommer's said this hotel was a "find" - I have to agree!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mr_magoo_8
Reviews.Content: A 3 night stay at this hotel was an enjoyable experience. The room was nicely furnished and clean, yet smaller than some hotels we have stayed out. The bathroom is great. There is a Juliet balcony, but not too much of a view. The hotel itself looks great from the outside, but less grand inside, but again clean. The staff are friendly and helpful. The location is in a good position, one block from the busy Gran via and short walking distance to the opera and the palace area. We purchased a three day travel card for 11 euros each. This enabled us to take the the metro from the airport to the hotel with two changes in about half an hour! Much cheaper than a taxi. The metro is a good and cheap way to get around the city and is relatively simple to use with clear directions and trains run every 3 mins. Overall this is a good hotel and would recommend this to anyone, but facillites are lacking compared to other hotels if you like that bit more luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Agathalina
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. My room was very quite and confortable and very near from tube. In my case, all that I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: MouserB
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, central location but quiet once in room, clean and modern, helpful staff, complimentary mini bar (low-cal beer, juice, water etc), good range of toiletries, air-con. Not the cheapest hotel but thoroughly enjoyed our stay and Madrid was fantastic, would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “To many Tapas, Rioja and sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: grahamandjulie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay in the Hotel Preciados Madrid. The taxi ride from the station was 25 euro, husband thought he had been ripped off as they add 5 euros on top of the meter price, which we didn't realise until returning back to the airport. Had an excellent stay, the reception staff were exteremly freindly and helpful. Hotel is spotless, it's very central. Three/Four doors from the hotel is a Tapas bar which is worth a visit, as the tapas were delicious. Madrid was buzzing, plenty to do and see, went to Tolerdo on the train for the day which is interesting if you have the time. The Plaza Mayor is a must but meals are expensive, try one of the side streets. The open Top bus is a must, we stopped at the Real Madrid Footy ground for a tour, not usually my cup of tea but it was highlight of the day, real treat, even get to go to dressing rooms. Bullring was quite a hike, as we walked, but easy to take the metro, however although we would of loved to see in side all we could see was a very disappointing museum. All in all the hotel is worth a stay, although breakfast was very nice it was a little over priced at 15 euros plus taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevewarbie
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at this Hotel. Very clean and helpful staff. Room of a good size and large bathroom with full bath and shower over it. Hotel is only a few hundred yards from the palace and has a lot of good bars near by. Good local bar at the back of hotel frequented by locals so good atmosphere and reasonable. Would stay again at this hotel when in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: WeekendBreaks
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last weekend and the location is fantastic. It is located near two metro stations which is convenient for the airport. As we were out and about most of the time we didn't spend too long in the hotel. However the room was spotless and while small I'd highly recommend it. The chocolates on arrival are a nice touch. A good variety of toiletries are provided including toothbrush, toothpaste, comb etc. The room was €125 including tax but not breakfast. However we got lattes and doughnuts for €5 around the corner, much cheaper than Dublin prices! We went to the markets on Sunday and stopped at a bar there and it it was half the price for tapas and beers compared to the city centre. Saying that the city was still cheap. There is a pub called BeerStation near the hotel in Plaza Santa Domingo which has a great atmosphere. We sat outside the restaurant on the corner opposite the hotel and got a bottle of wine for €11. I'd highly recommend this hotel as it is within walking distance of the sights, shops and places to drink & eat.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel. Modern Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: KristaInLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Preciados for two nights with my cousin in August 2008. We were pleased that the rooms were nice and modern. I totally forgot that the minibar was free so if you do stay here, drink up! Our safe wasn't working when we checked in, but this was fixed shortly. When we first got to our room, the entire floor reeked of cigarette smoke, despite the no smoking signs. For the rest of our stay, it reeked of room deoderizer spray. The hotel is a short walk to Plaza Mayor. I found the surrounding area though less than attractive. The streets smelled like urine and there's a lot of graffiti. Also, there are a bunch of beggers on Calle Preciados, the pedestrian shopping street. There are two PCs in the hotel basement, but only one had an Internet connection while we were there. I found the front desk less than helpful when it came to restaurant recommendations. Perhaps the normal staff was away for August? Firstly, I e-mailed the hotel a week before we arrived and asked for some recommendations and they never responded. Secondly, when we did ask for tips, the guy at the front desk just responded vaguely with "Plaza Mayor. Everything is good there." Well, everything directly surrounded Plaza Mayor is a bit of a tourist trap. Plus, we were two females wandering around at 11 p.m. at night and we didn't like not having a direct destination. So while the accomodations were clean and neat, I wasn't too keen on the location or the service we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hospitality, quiet, hotel, rock hard bed...”
Reviews.Author: wonderland30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was under contruction while we were there, just this summer (2008). Though the construction was inconvenient, the hotel staff was wonderful and the hotel was very very nice. The rooms are small but of course, that's a typical European hotel room. The double-paned windows made the noise from the busy street below virtually non-existent. The hotel is literally in one of the best and most convenient areas!!!! The only thing that was hard (literally) was the bed. It was a rock. Other than that, I highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sf7307
Reviews.Content: We agree with everything said in the last few reviews. I don't know what more to add. It was a little disconcerting when we arrived that there was so much work going on in the lobby, but then they have to do it sometime! Our room was on the 2nd floor overlooking the back street. Absolutely quiet from the street and rooms to the sides. We did hear a few footsteps above us, but nothing major. Like another poster, we thought the beds were too hard, but we got used to them (still I do prefer a softer bed). The rooms were so well designed that the [small] size of the room was not a problem. The shower is outstanding. The staff was very friendly and helpful, not that we asked much (we arrived at 1 a.m., and they had our paperwork all ready, so all we had to do was sign and go...much appreciated at that hour; next day, we mentioned that we couldn't get the TV on the night before, and one of the desk clerks, just left the desk and came to our room with us and got it working straight away). Location of the Preciados is great. We were glad we were staying close to the Puerta del Sol. I give this hotel 4 stars plus within its category, which is small boutique hotels (we walked into the Westin Palace, and the type of hotel is not even comparable; the Westin has an elegant and expansive lobby, for example).

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Location, Comfortable, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Ghostship
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel back in the spring for our August stay when it was rated number 1 in Madrid. Our stay was for 5 nights and we had one of the Junior Suites (Room 307) which was spacious, modern, and very quiet. Overall we were very pleased with the room. The junior suite with a separate bedroom and living room was quite large as was the very modern marble bathroom. The bath had two vanities and two showers, one a glass enclosed shower and the other in a large tub that also included whirlpool jets. There was a problem in the bathroom with the enclosed shower leaking water out onto the marble floor making it necessary to mop up the floor after each shower. One great feature that I did not expect was that each window and exterior french door had a blackout shutter that we could close and make the room virturally black, blocking out the bright city lights that otherwise may have made it difficult to sleep. The double glazed windows also made the room almost sound proof from the very busy street below us. I suppose being a spoiled American there were a few minor details that would have made the room perfect. There was no coffee maker of any kind. I like having my coffee first thing before showering and going out, and this made it a very long morning having to wait to shower, get dressed and then find someplace with either cafe con leche or just plain joe. Another lacking detail was an iron. When you are traveling and just going to walk around and go to cafes, a wrinkled shirt is no big deal. But if you want to go to a nice restaurant or club, an iron would come in handy. I asked for one, but they said they did not have one, but could send someone up to iron at what I am sure was some outrageous rate. I made do with a few wrinkles. The third detail was that the in-room mini fridge was not working very well. When I mentioned it, they said it was not suppose to be very cold. Again, suppose I am spoiled, but I like my diet cokes cold and not luke warm. The only other comment I would make is that they have ruined the wooden floors by using some the wrong type of cleaner. The floors will need be resanded and restained to make them look good again. Okay, now for the major complaint. When we arrived at the hotel on Monday evening, the entire lobby was being renovated. I knew from pictures that the lobby was not spectacular or large, but I was very dissappointed that while there, we had no lobby at all. It was always dusty and loud from the construction, day and night. Fortunately, our third floor room was very quiet and the construction noise did not bother us. One elevator was always out of order making the wait for a elevator car very long. I complain because when you pay that much for a suite in a hotel, you do not expect to have to put up with construction. The hotel should have made us aware that they would be doing this while we were staying there and should have offered sometype of apology and quite frankly sometype of discount or possibly free breakfast for the inconvenience. Instead, the staff seemed at best indfiferent and annoyed at the construction and that was past along to us. Not everyone mind you, but most of the staff was just not as friendly as I had been told they would be and certainly not helpful. On two occasions when I asked for help with reservations at restaurants, I was very disappointed with how it was handled. The first time, when I requested help in reserving a table at Botin, the desk clerk said it would be impossilbe to get a table at such late notice and did not want to bother to call. I had to request him a second time to do so, and when he did, we easily got our reservation. On our last night, I requested assistance and advise on a new popular restuarant at the ME Madrid Hotel, Midnight Rose at the Plaza Santa Anna. The desk clerk had never heard of it and I had to make the reservation myself. Turns out Midnight Rose is the hit of Madrid and our meal was excellent as was the service. The Penthouse Bar on the top floor terrace is a great place to see all of Madrid. Given what I have said, the hotel still has great promise. The location is first rate, within walking distance of eveything and a subway station very close (although we never used the subway). If not for the construction and the indiffernce of the staff for our inconvenice, I would have rated this at least above average and very close to excellent. But service is the name of the game and the hotel failed to provide excellent service and lacks the trained ststaff that knows how to make it clients feel special. A pity, but there are too many better hotels in Madrid for me to stay at Preciados when I return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: elizajanec
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, in a really central location. While we were there (the last week of Aug 2008) there was a fair bit of work going on in the reception area (painting, and a general facelift by the looks of it), but once you've got through that it's great. We were in a standard double room, which was rather small, but had everything you need in a modern, sleek and clean environment. There's plenty of hanging space in the wardrobe, a minibar/ fridge, safety box, flat screen tv and a comfy bed. The bathroom was larger than average - all marble effect with a good shower over the bath. The rooms have two sets of double glazed doors leading out to a balcony (only big enough to stand on), so we heard no noise from the street below. Breakfast was about 16Euros and sets you up for the day. There are 2 Metro stations within 2 minutes walk from the hotel, the main square (Plaza Mayor - rip off cafes!) is about a 10 minute walk away, and the Gran Via is one block away - lots of good shops and realisticaly priced restaurants, almost on your doorstep! If is wasn't for the building work in the foyer I'd have given this hotel 5/5, and I guess in a few weeks it'll be done and looking great!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: SKCTokyo
Reviews.Content: Good location, especially to get to the palace and the old section of the city. Quite far from the Prado, Reina Sofia and Retiro Park. I had a VERY small room with no view of anything (except other hotel windows). Outstanding breakfast. I would stay here again, but would assiduously research other options before doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMcKenzie
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were met and exceeded. Modern, tastefully decorated, comfortable, good value, well located, we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rachelg62
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in an excellent location. Staff were helpful and professional. Our room (on the 4th floor) was not huge, but stylish, air-conditioned, lots of storage space and very clean. I thought the bed was too hard at first, but got used to it. Although it was a twin room the beds were right next to each other (and no room to move them apart), which might not be ideal for everyone who wants a twin room. It looked as if rooms on lower floors might be quite noisy, and there was a lot of rubbish on the street below. The balconies are tiny, too small to sit out on, though they are typical of Madrid architecture. We felt quite envious of people who could afford the rooms/suites with terraces on the 5th and 6th floors! There was a problem with the safe not working but this was sorted out within minutes. We could walk to all the main attractions in Madrid’s old town, also the Prado and the other art galleries. If you don’t want to walk, there are several metro stations close by, and taxis are reasonably cheap. Particularly liked the free wifi, the plasma TV with 42 channels (we watched Rafa win a Canadian championship) and free minibar (only soft drinks and beer, but room to store your own water). Breakfast was charged extra (very expensive) so we went to various local cafes – about 2-3 euros for a coffee/juice and croissant – though we wouldn’t recommend Domingo’s. Lots of restaurants and tapas bars nearby. Also the Corte Inglés. Madrid is just fabulous and we had a great time here. A feast of cultural and culinary delights… We would stay at Preciados again but not without checking out other beguiling hotels like the Room Mate chain!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Shain
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely quiet, centrally located (you can walk to both the Royal Palace and the Prado), within a block of one metro line and two blocks of two others, and the staff is generally very helpful. The front desk was able to identify all Italian restaurants within a ten block radius for us and also printed out all the train schedules for day trips and could make reservations. There were only two things I didn't like about the hotel: whatever cleaning fluid they use on the towels has a pretty distinctive and unlikeable odor. If this sort of thing bothers you, bring your own towels. Also the stuffed animal that my daughter had hand-made disappeared from her room, and it took four visits to the front desk before they would call the laundry to see if it got mixed up in the sheets. They never did find it. Presumably one of the housekeeping staff took it, which points up a general problem with Madrid and indeed every city we visited in Spain: the petty theft and pickpocketing is completely out of control. There were three attempts on us and we watched as a thief brazenly walked into a restaurant where we were sitting on the main street in Madrid and started to walk out with someone's camera after eyeing our (well-protected) backpacks. If you are going to visit this country you have to start out with the presumption that they are going to get you unless you are on alert all the time. Also the hotel restaurant at the Preciados is very expensive by American standards and the lobby is currently undergoing some sort of renovation so that a small part of it is blocked off.

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond selected from T A Reviews”
Reviews.Author: BandBTourist
Reviews.Content: Our small group of 2 couples stayed here for 4 days prior to touring the other major cities and sites of Spain. We selected it solely by T A reviews and rankings. We were very pleased with the result - good value, well located, very clean, reasonable size rooms and friendly and helpful front desk staff. What a contrast with the four star hotels which our tour company selected for us elsewhere in Spain. We never ceased to be amazed at how these other hotels maintained their star ratings -often poorly located, rooms that reeked, TVs that hadn't worked in years, outrageous prices for basic services like room safes and internet and indifferent staff seemed to be the norm. If you can, avoid the so-called four star hotels where the group tours stay. This is where T A reviews are so helpful - The Preciados turned out to be a diamond in a sea of sludge.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value, Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Silvana_Michel
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early on a Sunday morning from the U.S. We were shown to our room in 5 minutes which is so wonderful after a very long over night flight. The people at the front desk could not have been more hospitable in booking tours, restaurant recommendations, mapping out the city, immediatelly printing out train schedules, arranging for taxis, etc. The hotel is in walking distance to most Madrid sights and the Metro station. It is situated in the old part of Madrid (that is where you want to be) a few minutes walk to Plaza Mayor, Puerto del Sol and the Royal Palace. Our room was clean, quiet, air conditioner worked wonderfully (major plus), free mini bar, Swiss chocolates delivered to your room on your first night. We reserved our room through a travel agent and had breakfast included. The breakfast was wonderful, one of the best breakfast displays I've seen in Europe (and we travel extensively). So, overall for the price and location this is the hotel to stay at when visiting Madrid. We had a wonderful time and will certainly return on our next visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Find Much Better in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: PNMLAW
Reviews.Content: This is a lifeless hotel in Madrid. We stayed in a suite with our 2 kids, and for Spain, it was of an ample size. The location is central for tourism, but nothing with this hotel stands out. It was quiet, but weekend house cleaning had real problems. There is no concieige, and the front desk was frequently vacant. On Friday night we asked the time for breakfast, and was informed 7 am. On Sat. morning, the same guy rolled his eyes at us and mumbled that breakfast was at 8:30 a.m. on weekends. Another time, we asked for directions to a restaurant, and the desk tried hard to redirect us to someone they obviously wanted us to visit instead. Little stuff like that holds me back from a positive review. I'd stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: heinertx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Preciados late last month for 3 days/nights. Overall impression was that it was a very clean and modern hotel. Our room on the forth floor was large as was the bathroom-full bath. It was quiet too. Pros: Location was convenient with public transport nearby. Taxies seemed plentiful too. Near the Plazas-Sol, Mayor, Royal Theater, shopping and not far from the Royal Palace. Many places to eat nearby too. Large room-bathroom Very clean & modern Quiet Staff helpful & attentive. Cons: None come to mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room Value”
Reviews.Author: DBooger
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this modern, spacious hotel. It is well-situated north of the Plaza Mayor, and east of Old Madrid. We found the staff to be very helpful. We went through the front desk for bullfight tickets and paid a premium, but that was our own fault. We could have just as easily taken the Metro straight to the bull ring (metro: Ventas) and done it ourselves, so no "points off" here. We were lazy, and paid the price. The rooms were (relatively) large, with very nice / spacious bathrooms. The rooms were substantially nicer than the Sumner (London) or the Relais Bosquet (Paris). This is no comment on the hotel, but we found Madrid to have more street people and (pretty obvious) hookers than either Paris or London. Maybe this was just random chance. The lobby restaurant is not cheap. It's fairly priced, but not cheap. If you're looking for bargain eats, you'll have to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandFlan
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three weeks in Europe and stayed at 5 hotels -- Preciados was in the lower half. The location was excellent but the staff was only ok. We were 2 adults and 2 children (8 and 13) and had a double room on the first floor (which is the second floor to Americans). Room was oddly configured corner room with pull out sofa in front room which was shaped like a triangle and very tight. Also, room was very dark and they had heavy curtains and poor lighting. I assume the room was clean but who could tell. Bathroom was large and spacious. Room was quiet. If you don't care about your room and focus on location, the Preciados is very good. Also, restaurant on first floor was not a great value, overpriced poor service and quality of food was lacking. I would try another hotel in area, on my next trip to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great experiance at the Preciados”
Reviews.Author: lar36
Reviews.Content: This is a medium sized hotel in a great location. Only a two minute walk to a couple of different metro stations and a short walk to the Opera, perhaps a 15 minute walk to the Prado.Just a short walk to the Grand Via with all its international shopping. We had a modern room that was well insulated from the exterior noises that come from a low floor. Our room wascomfortable, well lit and had a great bathroom with a great shower. The house keeping staff did a great job as well. I was very pleased with the staff at the reception desk as well. When i had a problem with a restaurant reservation they solved the problem and took care of it. All other requests were also handled with a great atitude. Really terrific considering that English is their second language. Sorry to say that we never did try the hotel's restaurant. There were also a couple of computers available to guests for internet access on the lower level. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: angloT
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in central Madrid. As you first enter the street from the metro, you wonder what you're getting yourself into as the street is narrow and looks vaguely questionable. However, as soon as you enter the hotel, the contrast couldn't be greater - it's clean, modern, quiet and quite luxurious. The staff are very efficient. We stayed in a superior double with balcony on the 4th floor overlooking the street. The room was very well furnished (modern style) with lots of space and a huge bathroom with a skylight. There was a small issue with the in-room safe when we first arrived, but it was very quickly and efficiently resolved. At night we had the balcony doors open, and it was extremely quiet. The hotel is in a perfect location, with the metro, the palace, the shops, Plaza Mayor etc all within a 10 minute walk. We didn't use the restaurant, though it looked fine (hotel restaurants are always pricey, with not much atmosphere) - as there were plenty of decent places to go to close by, including a number of simple coffee shops where you can get a great breakfast of pastries and cafe con leche at a very reasonable price. Considering the value of the dollar against the euro, this hotel provides outstanding value.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Liath
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, it was at No.1 in Tripadvisor ratings. We stayed in Room 508 for a week. Disappointed at the cramped space on each side of the twin beds which had been pushed together. There was not room to separate them in any case. This room is described as 'superior', but its size does not suggest that. Making the room even more cramped was a padded seat along the foot of the bed. The bathroom is massive and special, but I would prefer to have had some of its space incorporated into the bedroom. The skylight with electric shutters is an interesting addition to the bathroom. But, I fail to see how the sloping ceiling in the bedroom is considered a selling point! Just adds to the cramped feeling! We failed to gain access to the rooftop where we could see evidence of seating. The lobby is not somewhere you would want to sit to read or relax as it is too small and positioned between the desk and the door to the restaurant. The brochure still shows a residents' lounge, but, when we asked, we were told that it no longer existed!!! And the room,as I said, was not big enough to allow for comfortable lounging and reading. Sorry for sounding off on the negatives, but it was supposed to be The No 1 hotel in Madrid. (I note that it has now slipped a couple of places) On the positive side it is one of the cleanest hotels we have ever been in. The standards could not be higher throughout the entire hotel. The staff are friendly indeed and we saw only one who had a grumpy look, in the restaurant. The soundproofing from the street is perfect. Not a whimper from outside. It surprised us then to find internally how noisy an American sounded when talking at a late hour in a neighbouring room. We dined in the restaurant on three days and the food was excellent. We found that the set price and set menu, running from 12 to 4pm each day, was excellent and very good value. Calle Preciados is as central an area as you will find in Madrid, whether it be for shops, eating, galleries, parks. I have no doubt that this is one of the great advantages of Hotel Preciados. The small free bar containing juices, water, soft drinks and two beers is unique and is refilled each day, no questions asked or payment sought. We had decided to use transport which would drop us at the door of the hotel and back at the airport. We avoided the taxis and used Aerocity. Their small minibus is comfortable, prompt and costs €21 each way. We had it to ourselves when arriving and had just two others using it when departing. When I contacted the hotel in advance, I was quoted €70 each way for what they would provide. It was probably for a limo! Aerocity can be booked on the internet for both journeys in advance and you simply go to their desk in Terminal 1 when your flight arrives. If you have hand luggage only, you can get into the city by rail for just €2, but you need to know how to use the Metro to get to the hotel, getting off at Metro Callao. Madrid is buzzing and well worth the visit. Hotel Preciados has a lot to offer by way of courtesy, cleanliness, good food and above all convenience in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Modern design in right place”
Reviews.Author: PeterMirka
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in this excellent hotel in Madrid. It is located two minutes from Gran Via shoping area and 10-15 mins from major museums. The Calle Preciados itself has at least six restaurants. The room design was modern (done by an architect) and we loved it. Bed was firm and although you can hear busy street with open balcony you can hear nothing after closing the balcony doors that perfectly attenuate noise. The staff greeted us with a chocolate. Everything was perfect. The room was not as large as happens in US but it was comfortable. If you like art and museums but have a limited stay in Madrid choose Thyssen-Bornemisza (extraordinary), then Prado, and Reina Sofia. Remember that most restaurants do not serve a main dish after 4 pm. The hotel restaurant does. We strongly recomment this "luxury without pretension" hotel with moderate prices. Peter and Mirka, NY, USA

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rakona
Reviews.Content: When booking this room back in March, this hotel was #1 on TripAdvisor. I can't say if it is truly #1 as I've not stayed elsewhere, but I can say it was a great stay. Staff was helpful, polite and the room was quiet. After driving around Spain for a week, I was sooo happy to pull up at the hotel and have someone else take care of parking and the bags. The location was ideal, we didn't get the car out once and only had to use a taxi a few times. The Prado, Plaza Major and Palcio Real were all short walks from the hotel. If were are luck enough to make it back to Madrid we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: baysidegirl55
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. I booked directly with the hotel as they had a special deal which was better than Venere. The hotel is well located with several major bus routes stopping in the same street as the hotel and a subway not far away. It's also close enough to walk to all the major sights. The room was very large for a European hotel as was the bathroom. Everything was spotless and having free wireless in the room was a real bonus. Large comfy bed, heaps of closet space, toiletries replaced daily - I don't think I could ask for more. Staff at reception all spoke excellent english and were very helpful with directions etc. Breakfast deserves a special mention. Without a doubt this would have to be the best breakfast I have ever encountered. They had fresh fruit juices (not powdered), selection of fresh fruit, pastries, rolls, breads, cheeses, ham cut freshly from the bone, smoked salmon, small filled rolls, tomatoes and other veges, cereals, eggs, bacon etc., freshly made coffees and teas. Then if you hadn't quite had enough they had desserts such as cakes and creme caramel. It was quite extraordinary. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Carlettino
Reviews.Content: We took one of the (higher priced) superior rooms in the upper floors, which have a small terrace (unfortunately without table and chairs) and a nice view over the neighbourhood's roof landscape. Room (and bathroom) was very charming; the staff at frontdesk and the room service was very friendly and professional. Location is very central with short distances the most popular sites of Madrid, but foor good restaurants and shops it's better to leave the immediate neighbourhood. Price is relatively high - but anytime again!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as stated--great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Quido
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on way to Seville. The reviews on this hotel were correct. One street away from the Gran Via and steps away from the walking streets. Great value for the money charged. Room was very quiet, staff helpful. Would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Break”
Reviews.Author: globetrotte11
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stayed here for 3 nights and couldn't fault the Hotel. It is well placed for attractions, Restaurants & Metro. Our room, overlooking the front entrance, was slightly noisy due to traffic - however, not as much as most major cities. The external window shutters managed to keep out all the light & most of the noise so we were able to get a good night's sleep in the comfortable bed. The mini-bar was most welcome even if only for the cold water which can be expensive in some hotels. The bathroom essentials such as make-up removal pads, cotton buds, tissues etc were replenished daily..........the standard of cleaning was excellent. I would certainly recommend this Hotel & wish all those reading this review a pleasant stay. ps.......Visit Toledo it's beautiful, but allow plenty of time to get your ticket at Atocha Station.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good...”
Reviews.Author: londonbaby2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and well located. The people who work there super friendly. Rooms and bathrooms are good size and air conditioned. No iron/ironing board in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location, but a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: TMitch6542
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, I thought this hotel was well located, had modern clean rooms and generally the staff was helpful. This however, was not my favorite hotel of my recent visit to spain. I agree with one of the previous reviewers that the room was unbearably hot. We complained, and although someone from the maintenance staff was sent up to the room, bottom line was that the a/c was not on. We had to sleep with the windows open which would have been fine but for the fact that Madrid (and most of Spain) is a late night place with people walking the streets and talking most of the night. I'm not an early bird, but once it hits about 2 a.m. I like to sleep. With the windows closed, the hotel was quite soundless, but without A/C, we had to either not sleep or try to deal with the street noise. My other complaint is the knowledge that the front desk staff has of the city. I am a food freak and love to visit the food markets/mercados of the places I visit. I came armed with a list of the main food markets of madrid ( La Paz, Chamartin, etc) and the man at the front desk had not only not heard of them, he looked at us like we were crazy when we asked where the markets were. Since I had a list of at least 10 that I had found in one spot on the internet, had seen on tv and read about in various books and magazines, I was quite taken aback that I seemed to be asking for something so unfamiliar to him. He was familiar with the Sunday flea market ( El Raestro (sp?) and was happy to direct us there, but I think a hotel from a large chain (NH) should have better informed people at the fornt destk. Othere than these two complaints, I would say this was a good hotel. Would I return? Probably not, only because on my return to Madrid I stayed at the Atlantico and found the staff more informed and the temperature of the air more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “5 days in early spring”
Reviews.Author: MARGIE-L37
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Preciados after reading reviews on Tripadvisor.It was comfortable,reasonably priced and well located for metro, shops restaurants. A great flight direct from Liverpool then straight on to the Metro where trains left every minute. Clean, fast ,efficient, oh to have such a great transport system at home! Blue skies and sunshine awaited us as we reached street level. Our room was very clean, the mini bar (juices, water- still and sparkling) was free and replenished each morning. Do go and see flamenco dancing and after lots of art at the Prado, my husband really appreciated the Bernabeu stadium visit which is free entrance when you use the Madrid Card. We went on the Madrid Vision open topped buses, which helped familiarise us with the layout. For a capital city, Madrid is quite compact. and clean, we saw very little litter. A stroll in the Retiro Park is a must . At night, and in early hours, even at 4 in the morning ,there are so many people about and all we saw were happy revellers, so you can enjoy Madrid by night too. Superb architecture, well worth a visit .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great loocation”
Reviews.Author: mellemel
Reviews.Content: I and a friend stayed at hotel Preciados for four nights from April 20-24. Our rooms were ready within 10 minutes of arrival. The hotel is very nice with marble and wood floors. We both had seperate rooms and they were very clean and modern with a small balcony facing the front of the hotel plus a complimentary mini bar which is always a plus. This hotel is in great location very central, walking distance from everything. The receptionists at the hotel were very helpful. We encountered two negative situations: The thermostat in my friends room to control the heat was not working but then it was fixed with a phone call to the receptionist desk. Second, There was a sewage smell every now and then coming from the toilet of the bathroom in room 304. But, once you close the lid you want smell it. Obviously, It was'nt that annoying because I forgot to mention it to the front desk. Overall, I would definitely stay here again when I come back to Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about Hotel Preciados”
Reviews.Author: Grindley
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed at the Hotel Preciados for 3 nights in mid April 2008. In most ways it was as previous tripadvisor reviewers had reported. Its location was great. Our room was gorgeous - modern, clean and very functional. The free minibar was a really nice touch. The front desk were very friendly and helpful. A serious unresolved problem for myself and my cousin though was the heat in the room. We had travelled from Ireland which has experienced a particularly cold spring. To us our room in the Hotel Preciados was stifling and it seemed that only the heating but not the air condtioning was working. We reported the problem to the front desk but to no avail. Considering this hotels 4 star status and how much we had paid, I would have expected that we could have had the room as cool as we had desired - but were disappointed here. Personally if I had to choose I would prefer a less fancy room but one over whose temperature I had more control. Others from warmer climates would have had no complaints. So hopes fulfiled but also disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: MarkfromBath
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights after reading the reviews and it certainly lived up to expectations. The location is very central which makes it easy to walk to the various attractions in Madrid. I thought the room was very comfortable and was impressed with the electric curtains which cut out light and noise. The only trouble was that it was too easy to sleep in the morning! The free internet was good and I it was great to get so many complementary toiletries! The staffs spoke excellent English and were helpful in providing advice. I had a problem with the electronic safe and this was quickly resolved. Madrid is a great city and the Hotel Preciados made it all the more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met!”
Reviews.Author: TexasAMC3
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our decision to stay at this hotel. It's everything we expected--great location, clean, roomy, comfortable, kind and helpful staff. Also, there's a ton of storage--we had more than enough room for our things. After a long day it was nice to come "home" to complimentary drinks (water, juice, soda, beer) in the fridge--something we sorely missed when we left for other hotels elsewhere. There are two computers on the lower level which always had a connection and always were available for use. For our six-night stay, we requested and received a double superior which included a terrace overlooking the rooftops and sky light in the bathroom. We loved how sunny and bright our room was. And although street noise can be heard with the doors and window open, closed the room is quiet as can be thanks to double paned glass. The hotel was so quiet it felt as though we were the only one's there. Love this hotel and hope to return one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “En el centro del centro - superbe location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Frequentvoyager
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Preciados. The location of the hotel is absolutely excellent if you want to be in the very centre of Madrid. All the monumental places (Gran Via, Palacio Real, Puerta del Sol, Plaza Espana, etc. ) are within walking distance, more or less. Surprisingly, the location is rather quiet, also because the rooms have double windows . The old (around 1900?) building has been completely overhauled and now has extremely modern amenities, the rooms are modern style, clean. The four stars are well deserved. Everything, including bathroom, works very well. However, there is no coffee maker nor ironing board in the room. Bed is very comfortable. Staff is very friendly. Rooms are a bit small. There are rooms facing the street, but also rooms with no outside view (single rooms). There are many light switches, about 20, you have to identify before going to bed. Breakfast is charged separately at 15 euros plus tax, the buffet is mas o menos ok, but sometimes no waiter or waitress around. If you are not hungry and want to save money, there are a few bars in the vicinity that are substantially lower cost. In restaurant there is a smoking zone, but in the cafe section with the television, no smoking. The minibar appears to be free of charge, but we hadn't knew that, what a pity. The reception is helpful, they also arrange taxis e.g. to the airport at regular price. But to conclude, we really enjoyed the sojourn at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pollybelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week with our teenage son in the Suite Privilege. This included a sitting room with a pullout couch and a very large rooftop balcony with a great view of the city. We do not speak any Spanish and had no problems communicating with the front desk although their English was not fluent. The rooms, bedding, bathrooms were very clean with ample storage space. I found the best rate on the hotel website. We were charged an extra fee (39 euros)to have our son in the room but much less than the rate listed by other Madrid hotels.The location is the best, with the Plaza Santa Domingo metro and Plaza Callao metro steps away. We took the metro to and from the airport without difficulty although we did have to carry our bags up several flights of stairs. We booked a tour of Toledo with Trapsatur through the front desk which was terrible. The group was too large and we were rushed to get to the souvenir stand at the end of the tour. I would highly recommend the flamenco dancing at Cafe de Chinitas (walking distance) and diner at Cafe Botin (off Plazor Mayor) . There are many wonderful trabernas and cafes nearby for meals. In summary an outstanding hotel in a great location in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - better locations”
Reviews.Author: giggitygoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for our tenth anniversary after reading all of the great reviews posted here. We can't say enough good things about the Hotel Preciados. The location was outstanding, outstanding, outstanding. We walked to every major attraction in Madrid and took the metro (2 stops right near the hotel) to the train station to go out of the city. The room, while small (European), was exceptionally clean, stocked everyday with free drinks, and had all toiletries including toothbrushes, razors and shaving cream, shampoo, bath gel, and plenty more. They have in an in wall stereo system with speakers in the main room and bathroom. The floors are hardwood and the bathrooms are ceramic / marble. Most rooms have balconies (although they are very small) and flat panel TVs. We order room service once (just for coffee) and didn't eat at the hotel (too many choices right near the hotel. If you do stay here, hang a left when you go out the front door and an immediate right at the first intersection. You will see a cafe called Domingos - I highly recommend it for daily eating (breakfast and lunch). Order the tortilla espana and jamon. You can't go wrong. The staff was courteous and professional - although one of them printed us a train schedule to segovia and accidentally gave us the wrong schedule - which had us sitting at the train station for an hour waiting for a train that wasn't going to come for another two (by the way, the Renfe people don't really even know there own schedules - but that's a different story). Other than that, the staff was perfect. The hotel has wifi (I've seen conflicting reports) and I used it every day. While it's not super fast (don't plan on downloading any big files) it is sufficient and it allowed us to check reviews of restaurants while we were there. I don't know how well the staff spoke english - my wife speaks fluent spanish so I just stood behind her like a dope the whole time. All in all - my wife and I had a great time and it was in large part because of this hotel. I am a very experienced traveller and this was one of the most memorable trips I have even taken (first time in Spain) I can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: linduguapa
Reviews.Content: I can see why the Hotel Preciados gets such great reviews. I just returned from staying there for 3 nights and highly recommend it to others. It has a perfect location, on a quiet street very close to the Gran Via and the Pueta del Sol. You can walk to many places from here. The hotel front desk staff is very friendly, helpful, and accomodating. The hotel itself is beautiful, well kept, bright and clean. On the ground floor there are two computers offering free internet to guests. We booked two double rooms for my family and they put us in two rooms at the end of a hallway, with a door separating us from the rest of the hallway, It was very nice to have that extra privacy and my two year old could safely wander between the rooms. Both rooms had very small balconies and nice views to a pedestrian street below. The rooms had wood floors and felt very clean. The bathtub was nice, and the water pressure plentiful. The rooms had plasma TVs. I don't think we could have chosen a more perfect place to stay while in Madrid. I will say that I had breakfast at the hotel one morning and was disappointed - there were many options for ham, pastries, fresh juice, coffee, yogurt, cereal but if you don't eat ham, you are left missing something. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Preciados - First Rate”
Reviews.Author: BigDaveWirral
Reviews.Content: Nicely furnished hotel in a great location within walking distance of the central attractions. Room was very quiet (double double-glazed) and very clean.Staff were courteous and helpful. Only minor downside was that the "complementary" minibar wasn't! Overall an excellent choice and we could see why it was top rated.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baixas
Reviews.Content: I booked the Preciados because of the recommendations that I read on Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed. The location of the hotel is very central. I had a room with twin beds that overlooked a wall. That didn't bother me because on the plus side, it was very quiet. The room is fairly large with a very big bathroom. There was a flat screen TV and a radio with speakers in the bathroom. The room was spotless evrey day and there was never anything missing: soap, etc. I found the bed to be very hard in the beginning but I got used to it after a couple of days. The two chairs in the room need changing or cleaning. The staff is nice but I found the two women receptionists more helpful than the men. Overall, I was very satisfied with my stay and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great attention to detail, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelexplore
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two year old in a Junior Suite (i think 407) which had a separate sitting room and bedroom. We were really jet lagged from an overnight flight from JFK, so having the automatic shutters were fantastic. The concierge and porters were so welcoming and helpful. Everything was ready upon checkin and a nicely made up crib/cot was ready for our toddler. The amenities were fabulous and the mini bar. Breakfast was very european (we are health freaks and would have liked some wholemeal bread, skim milk, high fibre museli) - but I am being picky, as it was a nice spread. We checked out the menu for dinner in the restaurant and found the staff a less friendly and welcoming than the staff in the morning. We decided not to eat in the restaurant. There is a cafe next to the restaurant that might have had a more casual selection. All in all, this hotel lived up to our high expectations and those minor things which it didn't have, kind of didn't matter. We would definitely stay again for the great service, location (walking distance to everything Royale Palace, Plaza del Sol, Plaza Mayor, El Prado. El Cortes Ingelis Department Store is about 100 metres from the hotel with a good supermarket and other things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Convenient Location With No Smoking Floors”
Reviews.Author: MobileResident
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at this property earlier this month and could not have been more pleased with my choice. I booked my room on the hotel web site and requested to be on a no smoking floor and a higher floor. My room on the fourth floor was fresh,clean and very quiet. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was clean and in good working order, the safe was easy to use, there was ample closet space, the mini bar was restocked each morning and my room was cleaned and refreshed each morning. Unlike some previous reviewers,I thought that the front desk staff(particularly Oscar) were very helpful during my stay. Oscar gave me a very thorough and helpful orientation to the local area and city and provided me with a helpful map that I used throughout my visit. The nearest METRO station is Santo Domingo(Line 2). Callao(Lines 3&5) is also nearby. Plaza de Espana(Lines 3&10) is about a 5 minute downhill walk from the hotel. I never had to wait at all to use one of the two free computer teminals on the level below the lobby. Every aspect of the facilities that I looked at on their hotel web site proved to be the case during my stay. There were no surprises or unexpected charges. I think that this property is of good value and is an excellent base to enjoy all that Madrid has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ktkat59
Reviews.Content: My finance and I stayed here for 4 days for my birthday. The hotel is in a great location in the center of the old town. Easy walking to many sightseeing attractions. We stayed in the penthouse suite for one night and it is absolutely fabulous. Well, worth the extra money for a special occasion. Afterwards, we moved to a deluxe room for 3 nights. Very clean but could use some paint and minor fixups. However, I would hightly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding little hotel”
Reviews.Author: theTraveLees
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful, charming hotel with a great price to match!! We stayed in 4 hotels during our 3 weeks in Europe, and this was the best deal by far. It's in a great location right by the Calle Preciados, which is a great place to be. The room was very large and simple - definitely no frills here - but there was nothing lacking. Comfortable bed, usable safe, good closet space, fridge with free drinks, a few computers downstairs (though no wireless). Our room overlooked a busy street but it wasn't very noisy at all. The staff was supercilious and really not very nice, so we tried not to have too much interaction with them, but we'd go back to this hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: GwennSingapore
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the metro station as well as walking distance to major sites. The cleanliness of the hotel makes it a delight to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rareNItraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend for 3 nights. Central to most of main Madrid sights, with a metro stop at each end of the street, but then any hotel in old Madrid is central to most of main sights, either on foot or metro. If coming from the airport via the Metro, would suggest changing at Mar de Cristal and then taking line 4 to Alonzo Martinez and then line 5 to Callao, rather than the route described on hotel website. Callao is at the end of the street where hotel is situated, 2 minute walk, whereas directions on website are from Gran Via and took us a while to find (OK once you have your bearings and know where you are going, but Callao is easier for first time travvelers and avoids Nuevos Ministerios changeover which is notorious for pickpockets). We had an interior twin room, which was clean but not overly big. Good sized bathroom,. Free minibar with 2 bottles of beer, 2 bottles of mineral water, 2 bottles of fruit juice and about 5 small bottles of soft drinks (these were replenished each day).
