Shutters on windows and interior room meant we had no noise at night, which was good. Didn't eat in hotel, breakfast wasn't included in rate and at 16.50 euros was expensive. A short stroll to the Gran Via got breakfast for 2 for around 8 euros total. Staff were friendly, reception staff spoke good English. They let us use computer in back office to check in on-line for our return flights and print out our boarding passes. Madrid is a lovely city and we had a great stay. Compared to other hotels we have used I would say this isn't quite a 4 star but close, certainly a very good 3 star plus and would use it again if in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Preciados”
Reviews.Author: christine32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Preciados for a weekend recently, and really enjoyed it. The room was huge for European standards, with contemporary furniture. The staff was very helpful, recommending a great paella restaurant to us, and booking a flamenco show for us to attend afterwards. The location was central, so we were able to walk everywhere, but public transportation was nearby if needed. And the minibar was free.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Preciados was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mrsm2007
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel Preciados after reading about it on Trip Advisor and we could not have been more pleased. The room was immaculate and spacious. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful to us during our stay, and although we prefer to walk rather than use public transportation, the hotel was close to the transportation systems. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jaimef_whufc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Preciados for two nights at the start of January and cannot recommend it enough. I have been going to Madrid a couple of times a year for the past 5 years so have stayed in my fair share of hotels in Madrid, including 5*. Hotel Preciados is by far the best. I usually go out there for the football and for family as my father works in Madrid. I took my girlfriend this time and i booked the VIP suite on the 6th floor with the roof top terrace as it was her first time in Madrid. The room was large, modern and clean and the terrace was amazing......just a shame it was too cold to sit out for too long or i don't think i would have ever left!!! I have never seen more helpful and courteous staff....they could not do enough for us, especially when i was trying to arrange a trip to Segovia.....(Which i would highly recommend!!) I am currently looking to book up my next trip to Madrid in the middle of May and will be booking Hotel Preciados again. It's easy to understand why this hotel is rated #1 on Trip Advisor

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CMAS_Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Preciados for a week in January. My husband was visiting on business, and I tagged along as a vacationer. We found the hotel to be clean and well lit. The desk staff was very helpful, and all spoke at least some English. Oscar checked us in and was the most helpful. We arrived very early, around 9am, and were able to check in right away. It is in a great location near Gran Via and Puerta Del Sol. Great shopping, restaurants, and bars nearby as well as the Metro station at Callao. The hotel offers free wireless internet access in the rooms, as well as two PCs in the basement guests can use to access the internet. We also very much liked the free mini bar. Our room was on the small side but the furniture was well positioned to allow for movement and the closet held all our belongings. We stayed on the 3rd floor, facing Calle Preciados, but had no troubles with street noise - double sets of doors on to the Juliet balconies and the mechanical shutters blocked out all noise (and light, which was nice for sleeping in!). A few minor negatives we noted. First, the towels in the bathroom smelled very strongly of vinegar. They appeared otherwise clean. Also, the room had a very slight musty smell. There was an air freshener in the bathroom that dispensed a minty spray every 20 minutes or so. Finally, the 1/2 wall in the shower did not keep the water inside the shower, and we had a puddle on the bathroom floor after each shower. Generally the positives far outweighed the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “classy and good value”
Reviews.Author: bluesfamily
Reviews.Content: We splurged a bit to stay in the junior suite here, while on a trip with our teenage son. The Preciados was great - good location, friendly helpful staff, free access to computers and internet downstairs, a lovely suite which was as good as one in an expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly, highly recommend Hotel Preciados!”
Reviews.Author: kdeme
Reviews.Content: Hotel Preciados will not disappoint. This modern, well-managed, spotless hotel caters to both the business traveler as well as the tourist. My boyfriend and I travel frequently and are often disappointed with the standard "limited service" hotel, but not here. We stayed here for 5 nights during our trip to Spain and we’re very impressed. Hotel Preciado's new amenities, excellent housekeeping and welcoming staff make it a real stand out. In addition, the hotel is safe with 24-hour front desk service and centrally located with easy walking/taxi/metro access to all points of the city. One suggestion, request an upper floor room if possible as the street is busy and can be loud in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, great value and location”
Reviews.Author: savvyyatri
Reviews.Content: We took a 8 day trip of spain starting with madrid. Of all the hotels we stayed in Madrid, Seville and Barcelona, we thought Preciados was the best. Rooms were clean, hotel very centrally located. Hotel was very close to the metro stations, staff spoke good english and very helpful. We were traveling with my daughter age 7 and this was the only hotel in our stay in spain that didn't charge us for the extra bed. Also there were 2 computers in the hotel that we could access internet freely. We didn't try the restaurant but there were a lot of eating places including late night tapas bars very closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Good for groups”
Reviews.Author: Mjtee
Reviews.Content: Very tidy & clean. Not far from the city centre attractions. Restaurant was good. They let us stay until closing time. A good italian eatery next door and a funky little bar 50 yards away for a 'nightcap'. You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mmctrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November for 3 nights and would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Madrid. The reviews are accurate. The location is central and close to all major attractions. The staff were professional and courteous. The room was a decent size and was very quiet. It had a nice bath/tub combination and a free mini-bar. The housekeeping was excellent. The bed was very comfortable. I prefer a small breakfast so did not have the breakfast offered at the hotel. However, I did eat at the Cafe Varela for dinner and was very pleased with the quality of food. The service was excellent. Overall, this hotel provides great value to the customer. When I return to Madrid, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended !!!”
Reviews.Author: honestadvice1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel not only in location (Very Central) but the service from the staff is second to none. (English spoken). The Breakfast is typical Spanish, Cheeses Meat, Bread and the european bacon and scrambled egg. For evening meals resturants are in abundence and within walking distance. The rooms here are modern and contemporary and the hotel website is very accurate. Lift to all floors available and entry to the hotel is from floor level. Personally if you can afford the extra it will be well worth it not only from the location (cutting down on taxis etc) but also on the worry about the luxury. Remember that the taxis charge an additional 5 euros from Madrid Airport to the centre of Madrid and this is shown in the taxi so approx between 25 and 35 euros is payable for a taxi. everything is within walking distance so unless you need to get outside Madrid a car hire would not be nessacary even the local sightseeing bus is one street away at stop 19.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for a Mid-Range Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicolle_a
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice if you're looking for a mid-range hotel which is close to all the main tourist sites, and yet located off the main streets in a relatively quiet location. The rooms are clean, quiet and we found the staff to be very helpful. The mini-bar is free and they also have two computer terminals off the reception area where you can check your e-mail and surf. You are only a couple of minutes away from El Cortes Ingles, as well as other major European chain stores. And if you're not having breakfast at the hotel, I would suggest you try La Mallorquina which is only about a five minute walk away on the Puerta del Sol. They have really nice pastries and they also make a decent cup of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: JESVancouver_B_C_
Reviews.Content: Great place in Madrid.A block off the Gran Via and at the quiet end of Calle Preciados. A metro stop within a block and an easy walk to many of the sites and plazas. The staff was very helpful and the room was great. Good size, modern, very clean, and a free mini-bar replenished daily (water, soda, & cerveza!). The bed was typical of many hotels, i.e. on the firm side.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the right spot!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandKilkennycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a group for a long weekend. Hotel was very helpful on check in to get rooms to suit our uneven number. Compact rooms were very comfotable and well appointed with nice cool drinks in the inclusive mini bar. Situated in a quiet street this hotel has the benefit of such a terrific location. We walked to the palace , tour in English execellent, surveyed the city on the open top bus, well worth it. Discovered by chance El Prado museum is free on Sundays and enjoyed a Sunday afternoon in Retiro Park, where a few ventured to row on the lake €4.30 for 45mins! Three different restaurants all within 50m of the hotel were excellent as the 7 of us enjoyed eating in a Spanish local, a seafood night and an Argentinian restaurant. Some of the group ate breakfast in the hotel which was fine , a good selection of fresh fruit and the usual cold meats etc. enough to set you up for the day. As stated by others the night sounds of the city were well shut out by the double glass windows. definitely recommend this hotel and would stay if returning to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms !!!”
Reviews.Author: cocos_knight
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior room and were not at all disappointed. It was a very cosy attic room with two small balconies. The room was very well kept and clean. We really liked the tasteful furnishing. Room and bathroom featured everything we needed and were well appointed. Minibar was free. The bed was very comfortable. Location is good for first time tourists. It's a good place if you want to stay in the center of Madrid. Staff at the reception was not particularly helpful and generally rather stiff than friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lost in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: No_pacifier_required
Reviews.Content: My wife, 10 month old, and I recently stayed at Hotel Preciados in September 2007. To make a long story short, we were looking for an apartment we had reserved and couldn't find it. Frustrated, we found Hotel Preciados in our Rick Steves guide book. Desperate, they gave us a room around midnight. We would have paid anything that night - our room cost us 140 Euros. They parked our car, brought up all of our luggage, and brought us a nice crib. The hotel is nicer than most European hotels. There's plenty of room, A/C, and the bathroom is spacious. It's also conveniently located in Madrid (and there's a Starbucks about a block away).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SanchoPanza07
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 3 nights at the Hotel Preciados and can thoroughly recommend it as a place to stay in Madrid. Firstly, the location is indeed excellent. I only ever needed to use the Metro to get to and from the airport (EUR2 each way); all the major areas of interest are within comfortable walking distance. Moreover, as a single (female) traveller it was great in the evenings to be within easy reach of plenty of lovely places to eat and drink and to still be able to walk home only a short distance in a well-populated area. The room was very comfortable; modern, well equipped and tastefully furnished. The hotel was immaculate throughout. I very much appreciated being given a double room on a single room rate (rather than poked in to the smallest single room in the house as is often the case elsewhere!). The chocolates on arrival and the free minibar were most welcome too. Breakfast wasn't included in my rate but there was no need as there are ample lovely cafes just round the corner or only a few minutes away (particularly San Gines) where you can get excellent chocolate y churros with the locals. I found the hotel using the TripAdvisor reviews and found earlier comments to be useful. Although in response to the reviewer who posted a negative comment with regard to the friendliness of the staff, in my experience they were without exception friendly, professional and very helpful. I would hope to be returning to this hotel soon as I loved both it and Madrid and would happily recommend the same to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tangoloco
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Tripadvisor, my husband and I booked a junior suite through the hotel's website. We were very pleased with the service (the desk clerk kindly pretended my Spanish was much better than it is) and with our room, which was spanking clean and spacious. The location is great. We would definitely stay at Preciados again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: robertc808
Reviews.Content: We had a weekend break at the end of August and booked a queen bed room with a view onto the street. The room wasn't huge but this was reflected in the very reasonable cost. The decor was modern with white linen and wooden floors and flat-screen TV and marble in the en-suite and the room and en-suite were very clean. The bed was firm but comfortable. The sound proofing was excellent. We were surprised at an earlier review regarding the manager as we found all the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. The location was very convenient right in the centre near the Gran Via, with all of Madrid's highlights within walking distance. We got there from the airport using the Metro to Santo Domingo - only 2 euros per person and quick and hassle-free. We didn't have breakfast as it wasn't included in the price but there are plenty of eating places nearby, including the Valor Chocolateria around the corner for the true churros con chocolate experience! Not for those watching the waistline...! The Madrid Vision open-top buses are great for sightseeing as you can get on and off as you please. It helps if you get into the time zone of the Madrilenos, i.e. have an afternoon siesta and don't expect to eat before 10pm! Madrid is a wonderful city and we would thoroughly recommend it for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Preciados is a winner”
Reviews.Author: LauraNYC
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, you can't beat the location of Hotel Preciados. In addition, we found the breakfast buffet to be extensive and delicious (was included in the price of our room), the staff helpful, and the hotel in general quiet and well-kept. Our room was small but very modern and sleek and comfortable. There was some street and interior noise, but it wasn't terrible. I would recommend this hotel to friends and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice start and end to our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Caren17
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 12 yr. old stayed here the first and last night of our trip to Spain. The hotel was lovely, the location good and the staff accommodating. The first night we were upgraded to a junior suite which gave us 2 small but separate rooms which was very nice. But both rooms we had (no upgrade for the last night) were comfortable, with good a/c, modern decor and spotlessly clean. It is within walking distance to a number of attractions and good eateries (try La Maria across the street) and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but Horrible Hotel Mgr. Javier Gutierrez”
Reviews.Author: Mesa07
Reviews.Content: There was nothing good about the hotel except the location near to the metro station and Gran Via street. It took 35 minutes for the front desk only clerk to check us in when we were the only customer at the counter. The front desk clerk was incompetent but the hotel manager Javier Gutierrez was down right horrible. Javier was rude and we thought he had no business being a hotel manager. After we checked in, we found a big ball of hair from the previous guests plastered on the shower wall. We called the manager Javier Gutierrez and showed him the hair ball and his arrogant comment to us was that his hotel normally had the best rating for cleanliness. Then through his arrogancy he offered us free breakfast for one day which at the end he never came through. So, we thought that not only Javier was a poor hotel manager but he was also a man of no integrity. Finally, the room was very small compare to other 4 star double rooms we have stayed in Madrid and other European cities. Please stay away from this terrible hotel run by a terrible manager!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: rocketguy2
Reviews.Content: As with the other reviews, we had a great experience at this hotel. The location really is superb, with two different metro stops a few minutes away. While there are lots of places nearby to eat, we had reason to stay in the hotel one evening, and found that the food at the hotel restaurant was excellent. The breakfasts there are very pricey, however, so we usually walked two blocks to a small cafe called Domingo's (recommended by the hotel staff) - low prices and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to Leave”
Reviews.Author: DrSGPrice
Reviews.Content: We booked online and had excellent, responsive email follow-ups. The hotel is an excellent location, convenient to two Metro stations and many enjoyable eateries with outdoor tables. The suite we booked for three was comfortable with excellent amenities, and it was ringed by balconies. The bathroom included a stall shower and a bathtub with shower and whirlpool. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the breakfast buffet was attractive and ample, with excellent serving staff. We had a really good time!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: muchachas
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Hotel Preciados for a total of 5 nights. The hotel staff was great and all of our hotel needs were met with much kindness and respect. We had a suite which had a very nice pull out couch for 2, a seperate bedroom with a wonderful king size bed, 2 flat screen televisions, the marble bathroom with a double sink, jacuzzi tub and shower was very nice. It was also nice to have free internet service. They stored some of our suitcases while we traveled around Spain. The hotel also offers a free mini bar filled with something for everyone. The staff was SUPER !

Reviews.Title: “Well located - great and reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beetleman
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in Madrid at the Hotel Preciados and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel both in its convenient location (near Puerto del Sol, busy Calle Preciados, Gran Via and gay Chueca. The hotel staff was pleasant and spoke enough English to make up for our lack of Spanish. We upgraded to a room with a terrace (because they were having a July special) and found it quite nice. Although the room didn't face the street, it had a nice little private terrace that you could sit out on with rooftop views. Our first day we got an afternoon surprise of a bag of chocolates and got additional chocolates every afternoon. The free mini bar was nice although i'd have preferred more waters (2 daily) and less of the other stuff - but that's just us. You can't complain about a free mini-bar. We got a uniquely shaped room that included a little desk area and the hotel had wireless internet with a strong signal.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luisp8
Reviews.Content: Situated in a quiet street off Plaza St. Domingo, this hotel is an unpretentious little gem. We stay two nights in July. The bedroom and the bathroom were clean and spacious enough for our needs. The beds were of good quality and the staff was friendly and capable in handling our English queries. We had a room with a balcony but with a double glass window and we notice no noise from outside or from within the hotel. The contents of the mini-bar (no hard liquor) were on the house. The location was perfect – a few meters from the metro station of Santo Domingo, with the Callao station a few minutes walk away. Puerta Del Sol is a five minutes walk and Gran Via even less. Many restaurants and cafes within a 100m radius. Minor criticism would be one only English TV channel (CNN). Beautiful city, lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Juan45
Reviews.Content: I had a single room for one night and was frankly a bit disappointed at the room, which was a bit cell-like without a view. On the other hand I hadn't paid a lot for it and what I saw of the rest of the hotel was pleasant enough, The breakfast was on the scarce side of adequate and as there are plenty of cafes within a short stroll I'd go for that option instead. The room was well appointed in a modern style and very clean. Next time I'll aim for a double.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: SandyBolzano
Reviews.Content: The Preciados is in an excellent location, close to Grand Via, but in a quiet side-street. Very clean, pleasant and friendly staff. A good place to stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: diva2
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home having spent 3 nights at this hotel. We couldn't fault it - room was airconditioned and immaculate. Sound proofing was also an added bonus as it is very central and Madrid can be quite noisy in the early hours. Staff were friendly and able to give advice on city tours etc. Breakfast wasn't included and was quite expensive but we discovered a "Chocolaterie" round the corner so went there for chocolate and churros. Free mini bar was replenished daily! Ideally situated for exploring Madrid. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: rogtravel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to its central location and Trip Advisor ratings and weren't disappointed. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were excellent and we ate a nice dinner one night in their restaurant when we were too tired to go back out. The bathroom was huge and the price was reasonable--nice contrasts with Barcelona. The room itself was adequate. There are lots of great restaurants and tapas bars in Madrid but be sure to try La Casa del Abuelo (Near Puerto del Sol) for shrimp with garlic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pemtca
Reviews.Content: The Preciados is in an excellent location, close to Grand Via, but in a quiet side-street. Rooms were also soundproofed. Immaculately clean, pleasant staff, not the biggest room in the world, but perfectly sufficient for a short stay in Madrid. Free mini-bar is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “BKK-traveler”
Reviews.Author: Bkk_traveler
Reviews.Content: I read the review and chose this hotel....The result was fantastic...everybody in my family loved this hotel.. the service was so attentive... When we wanted to go to Atocha station helped us by calling a taxi and brought our lugguage to the taxi !!! many thumbs up!!! The bad thing was that they didn't include the breakfast in the accomodation price but I didn't care cos in the neraby area u could find great cafe!.. but would prefer to have breakfast in the accomodation's price.... u should try and u will love this property.. PS. I love Mini bar...it's free and has loads of Coca Cola, orange juices, mineral water and beer!!!! Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mcnallyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Preciados for thee nights in May 2007, and would stay here again if we ever came back. Great location, very quite rooms, clean, and helpful staff. The staff pointed us to an area away from the touristy restaurants that we visited every night.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: mayochick
Reviews.Content: i have to admit that i thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel,it was so central to the shops restaurants etc.Staff were ever so helpful with any requests we had. The mini bar was also re-stocked everyday,which i had read on some reviews didnt happen. Cannot fault the place and would stay there again if i went back.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: tlcarlson
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel. the staff were so helpful with booking taxis, restaurant reservations, and train sechedules. the location is great. the Metro stops are very close. all you want to see is within walking distance or 2-3 metro stops. room 204 is smaill but nice. it had a very large bathroom, which is very rare in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in two rooms for our family of 5. The Preciados was perfect for our family. The rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff was friendly, helpful and professional. The location was perfect, close to sites, metro, shopping but not in the heart of the really busy pedestrian area. I would highly recommend the Preciados for any family, just asked to have the porn on your TV blocked!!

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance, central, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CaraEastMidlands
Reviews.Content: Fab location - walked wherever we wanted to go. Clean, stylish room - wood, marble, crisp white sheets - but ask for a room with a view as ours had none! Appreciated free minibar. staff helpful. As noted in other reviews - breakfast expensive. Helpful staff - booking excursions etc. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Simple Hotel in the center of everything!”
Reviews.Author: rochelle.alexis
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through booking.com and made our choice because of the reviews on this site. The hotel is simple. There are no frills, no bar, etc. It is a clean nice hotel in the center of everything. The bed was comfortable, the towels were nice, the bathroom was a good size. There are double glaze windows plus automatic blinds so you can't hear the street and if you stay up partying too late one night, the room will stay dark & quiet!! The internet in the room is free, which is very nice. When we needed to print something for work the front desk printed it for us for free. The mini-bar was also free (and it was re-filled everyday)! On our first night, they even put champagne in the room! We bought a bottle of wine one night to have in the room and reception sent up someone for the neighboring restaurant to open it for us - That's Great Service!! If I have to say anything negative it would only be that the light in the room wasn't great. We didn't think that the fact there was no bar mattered, everything in Madrid is open late and there are plenty of places around the corner for you to grab your last drink! For 1 Euro you can take the subway from the airport. You get pretty close to the hotel. The hotel website has great directions: [-] Enjoy Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Liked Preciados A Lot”
Reviews.Author: GOBEAVS96
Reviews.Content: Terrific location. Clean, modern rooms. And very helpful. The location is great. Kind of on the spendy side, so you might want to shop around if price is an isse. We travelled with two children and they squeezed a cot into the suite giving us 3 beds. Ask for an upper floor due to noice on street below. Excellent location near Sol and Plaza Mayor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Wearywary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week at the Hotel Preciados in September 2004. Being forewarned not to let the taxi drop us at the end of the pedestrian mall, we were driven to the hotel entrance on a narrow side street. The reception was efficient and our rooftop room with balcony and large bath with whirlpool tub was great. There was no scenic view; instead have lunch at the top of Ingles department store nearby for a city view. Be aware that the "suites" are still small by American standards, but still larger than most. The small in-room frig was kept filled each day with cold beverages at no charge. The staff we dealt with were not strongly proficient in English, but skilled enough to direct us where to find what we were looking for. The Plaza Mayor, the Palace, and great shopping were all within easy walking distance as well as several great restaurants. Everything else was accessible via the subway only five minutes away by foot. A small but excellent restaurant adjoins the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyntia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with wonderful staff. Near all the major sites of the old city. Double rooms have chaming balconies and slanted celings. Hotel is newish and immaculately clean. Breakfast is good but very over priced - go out the door and you'll find dozens of nice cafes. I'd stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mojie
Reviews.Content: Had a fun 3 day stay in September 2006. Location is great -- near shopping, subway and some interesting restaurants. Rooms are very clean and modern with nice baths. Staff was very helpful and front desk helped with our local bookings. I was not impressed by their breakfast offering -- it was expensive and not very good. This was a blessing, as it forced us to discover some interesting local breakfast spots nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay indeed”
Reviews.Author: wtanih
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and found the location absolutely ideal for the tourist haunts. Our room was well air-conditioned with a good size standard room and bathroom. The staff were attentive to our modest needs. They parked the car and brought it back to the front when we were leaving. Never use hotel restaurants for meals, however in the square next to the hotel there were numerous restaurants/bars/cafeterias to have meals or breakfasts in the morning. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel at a Very Good Price”
Reviews.Author: OnVacation17
Reviews.Content: This was a very good surprise in Madrid: The rate was extremely good (90 euros/night, booked about 2 months in advance); included internet, minibar complimentary; was Exceptionally Clean; Recently renovated; Quiet; Well located (short cab ride or walk to Prado in one direction; Mayor Square in the other); very friendly. I was extremely happy with this hotel and would recommend it if you're looking for a smaller hotel that is quiet and well located. Note, it did not have exercise facilities and the on site restaurant was pricey; however, eating options were readily available at a number of restaurants within 1 to 3 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Junior Suite...not; 3-star...not”
Reviews.Author: Tranquila
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite for 180 euros and was disappointed to find a room that could easily have been a standard room. There was no sitting area, unless a desk with a chair qualifies for one.There was also just about enough space to walk around the bed. The only benefit seems to be that it was on the top floor and had a small terrace. All in all, the price did not befit the quality and space so I was really tempted to switch hotels entirely. Still, the man at tthe front desk did genuinely appear to do his best, apologizing that all other rooms on the top floor was fully booked. I am not sure if that room was actually a junior suite or not...perhaps they were sold out of this type of room and assigned me another slightly superior room. While my original plan was to stay for two nights, I decided to accept the offer of two abutting standard rooms on the first floor for one night. Having spent some time in both of these rooms, I must say that there are a couple of problems...first the intense smell that gave me a headache...it´s a mixture of heavy body odor and aggressive cleaning agents. If you are sensitive to chemicals as I am, you will not want to stay at this hotel. I am trying my best to spend as little time as possible in the room. While I tried to air out the room by keeping the window open, it is VERY noisy when the two sets of glass doors are not closed securely. Each room is very small, the furniture is worn and the toilet seat is stained. This is definitely more of a 3-star hotel in a noisy, busy area. It was error in judgement on my part for selecting this location as well. This is akin to staying in Times Square in NY. Not a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrw89144
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Preciados at the end of May 2006 and felt it was an excellent hotel and really enjoyed our stay. Staff was friendly and helpful. We loved the room and the bathroom was one of the best we’ve seen. We had a top floor unit with a sun roof in the bathroom and a terrace. Everything was very clean and neat. The free mini bar is a nice touch. The bed was very comfortable and the AC worked perfectly. The sound proof windows blocked out the outside noise nicely. The location of this hotel is really unbeatable; it is near many tourist areas, shopping, buses and restaurants. Morning breakfast was good with great coffee. It’s a little high in price but, didn’t mind paying it since everything was perfect at the Preciados. Next time we come to Madrid we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel/location/food”
Reviews.Author: keitho73
Reviews.Content: What a superb gem in Madrid. Clean. well presented. excellent food/wine and well priced. After reading some reviews I thought I was at a different hotel Reception staff very nice, restaurant is a class act. The presentation and food were first class. The rooms excellent clean and well presented. Quiet location. Go in the restaurant for the set menu - daily changed 12 euros(01.00-16.00 hours) for starter of the a la carte menu then 3 options main course . sweet bread and wine. All for 12 euros in a city .fantastic value And, had a la carte for main meals great choice and value. Already booked again with (--) for february next year. GO AND ENJOY.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!!! but poor air con”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights from 5th May & I have to say this place is all about location. It's conveniently located a short distance between 2 metro stations and just yards from one of the main shopping streets in Madrid. Also a very short distance from many of the main attractions the city has to offer - and for those farther afield you can always jump on the metro. We had a 'Superior Double' with a lovely little terrace. Room was a good size, bathroom was excellent but I have to say it is let down by the air conditioning which actually made the room warmer rather than cooler!! Wasn't too concerned as we weren't in there much, but light sleepers may be bothered particularly on warm evenings. Don't bother with paying for breakfast - there are some nice local cafe's where you'll pay far less & get to sit in the sun & soak up the great atmosphere. To conclude, great location, lovely room but I believe it is slightly over priced and something has to be done about the air con!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mascarasnake
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, near the centre with shops and bars, just far away from the busiest area so that noise levels at night doesnt keep you awake. I chose this hotel from tripadvisor reviews as it had a high score. I had booked superior rooms, to have balcony and whirlpool bath. The rooms were adequate and very clean. I had trouble operating the whirlpool bath - the reception staff were not very helpful with this. When I found the instructions - it was fine - the instructions were a little out of sight!! Breakfast charge was 15 euros - In my opinion it was poor- along with the service. The food on the hot counter was cold. There were four of us - we decided to have breakfast at a local cafe for the rest of our stay - much better and at half the price. There was no bar lounge - the bar was in the restaurant with just two stools - missed coming in and chilling out over a cool drink or coffee. The plus for this hotel is the location, and I would recommend the hotel for a short stay. 4* is perhaps being very kind - I would of thought more like 3*. Madrid is a colourful and vibrant city - we had a great break.

Reviews.Title: “room very hot in March”
Reviews.Author: Kamante
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights over the weekend for 452 euro’s excl 7% tax and excl breakfast (16 euro). Positive: the nice interior of dark wooden floors, closets of blond wood, the fluffy pillows (4) and towels, a good –strong- shower and tabs with temperature control, the free minibar (although the room price is accordingly), a varied buffet breakfast and desk personnel who speak English. Negative: the room was so hot, I woke up in the middle of the night feeling like I had a fever. Because of the noise outside the french doors can not be opened for a long time. (You hardly hear noise when double windows are closed) When I put the air system on cold, it still blew out warm air. It felt like 25-28 degrees (this was in March, outside temperatures 13-20 C.) Changing rooms –from 205 to 305- did not make a difference in regard of heating system or street noise. In 205 a curtain was missing. When I pointed this out, hotel staff could not see the problem, as there were (metal/plastic) window screens to close at night. I prefer curtains. The room was big enough for 1 person, but it could get cramped with 2. Although breakfast was very varied, hot dishes such as fried and scrambled eggs were cold (right from the start of breakfast time), as a previous reviewer also pointed out. It is a common problem with buffet breakfast, but for 16 euro’s one expects differently. Although Madrid has lot of pretty streets, the hotel is not located in one them. However, it is close to major attractions such as the Royal Palace. An internet computer is more or less hidden away in a conference room, when I asked I could use it though. Be aware; when I got into the taxi to the airport, the taxidriver had the meter covered and I believe he tried to overcharge me.

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot in madrid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After much study of where to stay in Madrid we decided to stay at the Preciados and couldn't have been happier. Starting with the warm, cheerful greeting at the front desk to the spotless rooms, we were happy with the spot our entire stay. As we wandered Madrid, we also realized we couldn't have found a better location. we walked everywhere and found great cafes, shopping, historic sites nearby. Friends staying near the Prado admitted we were in the better location. You can't go wrong with the Preciados!

Reviews.Title: “Mixture of pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot worldwide and I always choose my hotels carefully to align with my needs (price is a secondary issue - this room was 135 EUR, which is average for Madrid) Hotel Preciados is a clear mixture of very good and very bad things: Cons: - the air conditionning just does not work (confirmation of previous comments). It does some noise but the temperature stays high (about 23-25C) - the beds are very small and on wheels (they move all the time) - some of the staff was terrible, one older lady was perfect and very helpul - my room had a view on a wall a meter away form the window (NOTE: this is actually a 'Pro' for me as I asked for a very qiuiet room and did not care about the view at all) - you can easily hear other guests walking above you, flushing water etc - TV coverage poor (both amount of stations and quality of the picture, some channels were really bad) - the safe was not working Pros: - the location - free wireless internet access - free minibar - the beds are hard - the room was clean - the size of the room is OK (not enormous but I do not intend to play football here) Overall average. I will probably not stay again, but this would be my forst choice if other hotels are occupied. I think it is great if you are here for one or two nights and do not know Madrid (good location). If I was to stay a week I would chose something else.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: howardde
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews here and was not disappointed. We paid something like $90 ahead of time booking directly through the hotel's website. When we got there, we paid an extra $25 a night to get upgraded to a penthouse room...definitely worth it, in my opinion. Reason why: you have skylights throughout the bathroom and juliet balconies in the bedroom and very high ceilings. As has been mentioned in prior reviews, the floors are marble and wood. The bathroom was all marble and had a jacuzzi tub. Everything looked brandnew and was extremely clean. What's suprising is that the lobby/restaurant decor do not live up to the rooms at all! Usually its the other way around, but the lobby looked like something out of a 1980's British hotel whereas the rooms were creams and rich woodtones and very contemporary (looked nautical, almost like a ship). In any case, if you can get a good deal on this hotel, take it.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I walked by the Hotel Preciados while we were staying elsewhere in Madrid and decided to change hotels to this one. Wonderful hotel, comfy beds, great service. The room was a little small but still very comfortable. The breakfast was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: TomNSyl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading reviews on this site and have to agree that this was a very nice place. The hotel staff spoke English for those of you who may not speak Spanish. Location was very close to the Metro (about 1 block) You can get there by taking the Metro from the Airport, its a long ride but only cost 1 Euro/person. From the hotel you can walk to Plaza del Sol or Mayor ... Lots to see and do on foot or just hop on the Metro. The mini bar was well stocked and free. Internet access was a pay service, but I was able to use an available free access point from my room as well. Note: If you go out late, and who doesn't in Mardid, don't be surprised if the doors are locked when you home back. Also, its dry in Mardid so it was a bit hard to sleep in the warm dry room. We liked this place enough to book another night on our return thru Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Preciados on the first week our honeymoon. Wonderful location that put us in the heart of Madrid close to great shopping and eating. Easy taxi and subway connections to all sights. Top floor suite had large bath and private balcony. Some of hotel staff were less than proficient in English, but worked hard to be helpful with any request. A near-perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Watching the Reviews of Preciados...”
Reviews.Author: crackofdawn
Reviews.Content: Since we stayed in the Hotel Preciados over a year ago, I've enjoyed reading the reviews -- you always wonder if you just hit the hotel on a good week. It seems that the reviews since mine have been equally positive and I just wanted to drop in a review to recognize the Prciados' continued good service. My Wife and I hold fond memories of our visit to Madrid and many thanks to Preciados for our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: baltohon
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. Our room was modern, a bit smallish, but well laid out, and the bed was very comfortable. Firm mattress, but not too hard, and real feather pillows. Great bathroom. Small balcony overlooking a side street. Tad noisy at night because we kept the windows open. Only disappointment was that we could not get a NS room, but our room was so nice, and with the window open the smell dissipated quickly. We didn't even change when we had the chance. Mini-bar was complimentary. A few soft drinks and a beer or two, but very welcome! Close to Callao metro. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice but get there early”
Reviews.Author: kad
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Preciados Hotel (6 to 10 October 05). The only reason I do not give this hotel full marks is that we arrived late (about 2215 hrs) and, despite having phoned about 10 days in advance to advise that we would check-in late, the hotel claimed not to have a room for us due to problems with electricity (even though outside it was lit up like the Blackpool illuminations). They had, however, organised another hotel which was pleasant and close by and we only had to stay there one night (we would have been seriously hacked-off if it had been for more than one night). When we returned to the Preciados the next morning, we were able to check in almost immediately and I think the problem was one of overbooking rather than anything to do with electricity, which is why I recommend getting to the hotel early. Anyway, as for the hotel, it is in an excellent location, close to Plaza de Santo Domingo metro (red line, no 2) and minutes from the Gran Via. The metro system is excellent and we bought a 10-journey ticket for Euros 5.80 (we passed the ticket between us, which is allowed). Lots of places are within walking distance (Sol, Plaza Mayor and the Prado/Thyssen Museums, the Royal Palace etc if you have comfy shoes). The room was not large but was modern, clean and well appointed, with a good-sized bathroom (and big, fluffy towels!). The free mini-bar is a god-send after hours of walking! The hotel fronts a busy-ish street but our room was round the corner on a quieter street and, in any case, the rooms have electric shutters which block out the majority of outside noise and a good air-con system which drowns out most internal noise. We were amazed at how quiet it was when you saw how close it was to the incredibly noisy Gran Via! The desk staff were helpful (though I'm not sure how much was due to the fact that I speak passable Spanish). The person in the room prior to us had shut the safe, despite the instructions telling you not to, so I went down and asked someone to come up and sort it out, which was done in minutes. I had asked for extra pillows before going out on our first night and we arrived back to no extra pillows. I phoned Reception a couple of times to try and sort it out but there was obviously a fault with the phone (I could hear them but they could not hear me) but someone turned up at the door within about 5 minutes to find out what the problem was. They were happy to keep our bags on the last day as we checked out about 1100 hrs and then came back for them at 1700 hrs, so that was very useful. As a gesture for messing us about on arrival, we were provided with free breakfast. The food was very nice and there was a good selection (fruit, cold meats/cheese and pastries) but it was a bit shambolic - the room used (the hotel's restaurant) is not big and we struggled each morning to find a clean table with cutlery. There only seemed to be one girl who was trying to do everything (clear tables, make them up, make coffee) so it was a bit hit and miss about how long you had to wait but we weren't bothered. The only bad point was that we decided to have a slightly longer lie-in on our last morning so did not get down until about 1000 hrs - it was as if locusts had been and taken just about everything! I don't know whether it was replenished after we had gone but we had our coffee and a few bits and pieces and left to the sound of grumbles from people who had arrived even later than us! All in all, this was a very good choice of hotel which lived up to the reviews we had read, so much so that my husband is going to recommend it to work colleagues who travel out to Madrid on business. My one gripe (a small one and one which I have for lots of hotels, not just the Preciados) is that they do not offer a choice of feather or synthetic pillows - I cannot abide synthetic pillows as they are either lumpy or it's like putting your head on a marshmallow but, for the 3 nights we were there, I could live with it! One word of warning - on all my visits to Madrid, I have been targetted by pickpockets or people trying to rip you off. This time, we were walking along a quiet street near the Plaza Mayor at about 2000 hrs. A guy approached us asking in Spanish for directions and, as we were looking at his map, two other guys appeared, flashing "police" cards and badges and demanding to see identity papers. We smelled a rat straight away and walked off and, based on the fact that we were not challenged by the so-called policemen, this must have been a scam though I am unclear what the purpose was. Sad to say, if anyone asks for help then my advice is to walk away unless you are 100% certain that they are genuine (if we had thought about it at the time, why would a Spanish-speaking person ask obvious tourists for directions, it just doesn't make sense).

Reviews.Title: “Great modern central hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A lovely oasis in Madrid. Close to all of the sights but in a quiet corner so you are not bothered by the noisy streets. The rooms are very modern and clean and of a superior standard. The staff are really friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel. centrally located, great price, nice size room, quiet, great shutters that shut out all the light so you can siesta during the day. only minor complaint is that the temperature of the water varies when you shower. i think if someone on the floor above you flushes the toilet or something the water temp in the shower first gets really hot then cold before it returns to the temp I had set. really minor complaint though. this hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: hmac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in June 2005 and we were very impressed overall. Our room was small but really clean and very modern: I loved the polished wooden floor, and the pale wood effect finishes kept it very bright. The bathroom was quite small but was sensibly laid out and thus seemed bigger than it actually was - and it was beautifully clean with plenty of toiletries etc. Our room did look to be one of the smallest and looked over a very dull side street (we booked the day before, literally, and got the last one available I think, at a very good rate) but we still liked it a lot. As other reviewers have mentioned, the minibar is free which is great - and you can just about squeeze a bottle of cava in there to chill if you want (the basement supermarket at El Corte Ingles at the top of the street is useful for this!). There are two metro stations very close by (I was about to write 'within a few minutes walk' but they're better than that - for a fast walker like me you could almost count it in seconds!) and the main square, palace etc. are all within easy walking distance - in fact, walking back late after a day sightseeing and an evening trying different tapas bars, it was really good fun to walk back to the hotel through all the busy streets. The lobby area is small and there didn't seem to be much atmosphere at the hotel - but there's more than enough out on the streets so who cares! The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I will definitely try and stay here again when we return with our teenaged daughter later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay, good price”
Reviews.Author: Katya10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights here for our honeymoon, May 2005. This hotel has a great location, first of all (and for having such a location, the rates were very reasonable); Right in the thick of things, and near at least three Metro stops. Our room was very nice, with two balconies (as we'd requested) although not so great of a view. Food was good, wireless internet access in the room was very appreciated, beds were comfy, noise level was practically non-existant, even from the busy street below. (Watch out for the XXX channel; it flashes current programming for about four seconds before going to the "blocked content" page. If we'd had kids with us, we'd have careful explaining to do to them.) Our main complaint was that the hotel staff didn't seem to speak much English, nor did they understand my husband's Spanish. It got very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: lorero
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times. The first was just a lucky guess while browsing the Internet, and the other two are because I just plain love it! Running down the list of key factors to consider: Service: top-notch, always! The staff really goes out of their way to help any way they can. Rooms: fantastic layout, well-maintained, nicely equipped, and comfy. Special features: free minibar fridge. Yep, you get juices, soft drinks, water, beers, and more, and you can consume all of it on a daliy basis free of charge. That shows class. The bathroom has a nice sized tub with air jets (jacuzzi effect). Ask at reception how to use it, or lay out about 20 towels on the floor the first time. Windows keep out all but the loudest street noises, but you can hear stuff from adjacent rooms. Location: the best. About 1 kilometer from the true center of the city (Puerta del Sol), but it is somehow on a quiet street. By the way, there is no such thing as a safe street in Madrid, but the safety is above average for its specific location. Many attractions nearby, plus a subway station about 200 meters away. Breakfast: a buffet style assortment which is not too varied, but nicely selected. The staff is really nice there too, so just ask for your eggs any way you want them, etc. I am an iced tea lover, and each morning (after the first, when I expressed an interest) thereafter it was freshly brewed for me. Granted, iced tea is a simple thing, but what I liked was the caring service. Price: a bit pricey, but well worth it! Amenities: not many. The lobby is small but cozy, and in back there is a bar exclusively for guests of the hotel. The restaurant offers good food, but if you are in Madrid you should eat out. Healthy eaters tip: the best salad bar in Madrid is at VIPS (they are all over the place, and some have the salad bar.) I bet you did not know they had salads in Madrid. Ha ha, a little hotel review humor. Besides this, I have absolutely no complaints. Well okay, just one: there is no gym in the hotel. If you want to work out during your stay in Madrid it will cost you. I most emphatically recommend this hotel, so do yourself a favor and give this place careful consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amanda-James
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a trip to Madrid for my boyfriend's birthday and we stayed at Hotel Preciados. The hotel itself was easy to get to, we used the underground system from the airport and was very centrally located. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and our room was lovely - on the roof with a balcony - definitely worth the upgrade. Would recommend the hotel to anyone staying in Madrid and hope you have as good a time there as we did.

HotelInfo.Name: HOTEL PRECIADOS
HotelInfo.Address: c/ Preciados 37, 28013 Madrid, Spain
